The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joyce Nculubi

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 30 years. She describes herself as ambitious and honest.

Joyce operates a retail store where she sells farm and home good products. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. It is located in Athiru shopping centre. Joyce describes her biggest business challenges as the increased cost of farm and home product goods.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm and home products. Her business goal is to expand the general store within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy farm and home good products

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru:
Рыскуль  49 лет, вдова, воспитала четверых детей. Основной деятельностью  семьи Рыскуль является животноводство.  В 2005 году, Рыскуль решила заняться и откормом и перепродажей скота, вложив в первоначальный закуп скотины  25,000 сом (KGS). 
На сегодняшний день,  хозяйство Рыскуль приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 24,500 сом. Доходы от бизнес - деятельности Рыскуль  позволили помочь детям обустроиться в жизни и сегодня Рыскуль – счастливая бабушка двоих внуков. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Рыскуль планирует направить на закуп строительных материалов для постройки дома.
texts.en:
Ryskul is 49 years old, she is a widow and has raised four children. The main activity in Ryskul's family is livestock. In 2005, Ryskul decided to start feeding and selling cattle, investing 25,000 KGS in the initial purchase of cattle.

Today, the farm brings Ryskul monthly income of 24,500 KGS. Income from business - the activity which allowed Ryskul to help her children settle down in life and today Ryskul is a happy grandmother of two grandchildren. In order to further develop the business Ryskul has come to the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to purchase additional stock. Ryskul plans to direct the income from the loan to purchase construction materials to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rael Kamami

texts.en:
Rael Kamami is married and has three children who are ages of seven and eighteen years old. She describes herself as ambitious.

Rael runs a retail shop that has been in operation for five years.The business is faced with the problem of increased costs of stock. Rael will be using the loan KES 15,000 to add to the stocks. In the future, she want to expand her business in other neighboring towns.

loans.use: To add stocks of home products.

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Stewart from Harare. He is married with two children, one of whom is still in school. Stewart runs a restaurant business selling fast food. The business has been in operation for 6 years. He says the main challenge faced is competition as the business depends on customers among motorists and there are some other players by the road side. Stewart has requested a loan of $400.00 to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, meat products, and snacks. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his school-going child to go to a better school. In the future, Stewart plans to have a state-of-the-art restaurant.

loans.use: to buy stocks of drinks, meat products, and snacks

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur ADAMA   est âgé de 51 ans et vit avec ses 6 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à KOUNKODJAN, un des villages de la commune de BAGUINEDA, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
ADAMA n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école car il fut  vite exclu du système éducatif.  Alors il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’embouche (qui est une des activités de leur famille) et à l’achat stockage vente de céréales qu’il appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de quatre ans, Monsieur ADAMA jouit d’une grande renommée et est très sollicité à KOUNKODJAN et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé les   quatre prêts précédents, il est à son cinquième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil) auprès des paysans producteurs qu’il gardera pendant au moins un mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
ADAMA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et le reste  réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Adama is 51 years old and lives with his wife and 6 children in a traditional family environment in the village of Kounkodjan, located in Baguineda commune, in the Cercle of Kati, in the Koulikoro region of western Mali.

Adama was excluded from school at a young age and unable to get a formal education. He therefore turned to income-generating activities, notably animal fattening, a family occupation, and the buying, stocking and selling of cereals, a trade he learnt from his uncle.

Adama now has 4 years experience in the business and enjoys a great reputation, which makes him much in demand in Kounkodjan and the surrounding area. He decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy his growing customer demand. Having already fully repaid 4 previous loans, he is requesting a fifth, so that he can buy 4 tons of cereals (corn, beans, millet) from the agricultural producers, which he will then keep for a month before selling.

Adama does most of his business wholesale and sells to retailers who then resell the products in large towns like Bamako. He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 120 000 francs, which will be used to reimburse his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Berdimurot

texts.ru: Бердимурот уже три года как занимается скотоводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Он берет кредит для закупа несколько бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Berdimurot has been engaged in animal husbandry for three years. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He is 56 years old. He is married and has seven children. His sons are working in Russia. He is taking the loan to purchase of a few calves to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy several calves.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia is an artist; she prepares beautiful flower brocades to sell to generate income for her family. She is also involved in an embroidery and sewing business. She does embroidery and sewing because it also produces good revenue, which she uses to manage the household expenses.  

She is very dedicated and hard-working. After seeing her efforts, her daughter has also started helping her manage her business. Fozia feels happy to see her daughter’s care and sense of understanding towards her.  

With this loan, Fozia will purchase flowers and thread in bulk to be able to prepare flower brocades in larger numbers to sell for a good profit.  
In the future, Fozia would like to save money to expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy flowers and thread for her flower brocade-making business.

loans.name: Showers Of Grace Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42 year old Mable from Harare. She is divorced with three children, two of whom are attending school. She also cares for two dependents who are her sister's children. Mable runs a retail business selling fish. The business has been in operation for five years.
 
Mable finds it difficult to to pay for school fees and uniforms whilst keeping her business going. 

Mable has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy more fish for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to send her children to a better school with complete uniforms. In the future, Mable plans to be a fish supplier in the southern African region.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Malekha West Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Malekha West Group in Western Kenya! 

Enock takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure quality farm produce. In the recent 2011 season, Enock had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Enock was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Enock will educate his children and invest in business.

Enock is the facilitator of the Malekha West group. He is pictured with his group members in the photograph. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Malekha West group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Enock and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is single and has three children ranging in age from 11 to 18 years.  She describes herself as jovial.  Her business faces the challenge of inadequate funds to add stock.  She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy rice and beans.  In the future, she wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DRISSA  est âgé de 43 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à KOUNKODJAN, un des villages de la sous- préfecture  de BAGUINEDA,  Région de Koulikoro.
DRISSA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de KOUNKODJAN et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins deux mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Drissa is 43 years old and lives with his ​​six children and his wife in a traditional family in Kounkodjan, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Baguinéda, part of the Koulikoro Region.

Drissa has not had the opportunity to go to school. Very early on he became interested in income-generating activities, in particular the buying, storing, and selling of cereals. He learned the business from his maternal uncle, who was once a major grain trader.

In order to satisfy his growing number of customers, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. He is now on his fifth individual loan he will use to buy two tons of cereals (maize, beans, millet, fonio) from farmers and producers in Kounkodjan and the surrounding area, and store them for at least two months. He mainly sells wholesale to a clientele made up of dealers from big cities like Bamako.

Drissa expects an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, the rest being reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Severino

texts.en: Born in the town of Cabatuan, Isabela, in 1961, Severino lives with his wife and their two children. Recognized by the people of his neighborhood as a jolly person, Severino, a farmer, would like to expand his crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, he needs a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seed and fertilizer. The income from his farm will then help him cope with the needs of his family and give all of his children a higher education. Severino is very grateful to everyone who can help him achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Более 7 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном Бахтиёр выращивает лук и морковку. Он тщательно ухаживает на землю и всегда получает хороший урожай. Бахтиёр хочет перерабатывать свою землю предстоящего посева. Бахтиёр запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. А часть займа хочет использовать на оплаты труда работников.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a hardworking and conscientious family man. He has been engaged in cultivation of agricultural crops for more than seven years. Mainly Bakhtiyor grows onions and carrots. He carefully takes care of the earth and always gets a good crop. Bakhtiyor wishes to convert the land for the upcoming crop. He requests a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He wants to use a portion of the loan to pay the workers.

loans.use: to purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Savana Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Savana Jitegemee Group in Western Kenya! 

Hellen takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 16 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Hellen will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

Hellen is the facilitator of the Savana Jitegemee group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Savana Jitegemee group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sidi Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SIDI YAYA est un homme  qui est âgé de 35 ans et qui vit avec ses sept enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle dans le village de  KOUNKODJAN, sous  préfecture de BAGUINEDA,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, SIDI YAYA, qui n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école, s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage commercialement des céréales et des produits de cueillettes tels le néré, les noix d’acajou et  le tamarin.  
Nanti  de deux années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, SIDI YAYA décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
SIDI YAYA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne  d’arachide et 5 sacs de grain de néré, auprès des paysans producteurs de KOUNKODJAN et de TIELE qu’il stockera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il effectue sa vente  au marché de BAGUINEDA, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
SIDI YAYA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui   sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt,  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Sidi Yaya is a 35-year old man, who lives with his seven children and wife in a traditional family in the village of Kounkodjan, in the sub-prefecture of Baguineda, which lies in the region of Koulikoro.

Sidi Yaya was not lucky enough to succeed at school, and in order to embrace an economic activity, he rapidly picked up the business of commercial stockage of cereals and harvested products such as "néré" grains, cashew nuts and tamarind seeds. Having gained two years of experience in this field he is now in great demand.

In his search for additional financial resources, Sidi Yaya decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso's, loan program and is now on his second individual loan. He is planning to use this loan to buy a ton of corn, a ton of groundnut and five sacks of "néré" grains from farmers in Kounkodjan and Tiele and he will stock these for at least two months. He sells at the market in Baguineda, for cash and rarely on credit to a customer base made up of women and men. 

Sidi Yaya hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000FCFA which will be used to repay his loan, to provide for his family's expenses and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Wekhonya Shg Group

texts.en:
Judith takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from maize sales, Judith will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing to save for future use.

Judith is the facilitator of the Wekhonya SHG group. The photograph shows Judith with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer. Judith and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Wekhonya SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 30 year old a married woman with five children between the ages of 16 and four years. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling beer in Kator, South Sudan for five years. Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Seronei Indumuli

texts.en: Seronei is 32 years old and single. He describes himself as honest and jovial. He has been running a bakery retail shop for the last one year. The business is faced with the problems of inadequate funding to add a stock of bread and the difficulty of access to his area of operation when it rains as the place floods. He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy bread. In the future, Seronei wants to own a permanent area of operation and have many customers.

loans.use: To buy bread, scones and rolls.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24-year-old single man who has been working as a photographer since 2004. His shop is well known in the region. Most of his customers are neighbors and relatives, in addition to nearby villagers. Ibrahim is a talented, hardworking man. He tries his best to improve his business, in order to improve both his social and financial situation. Ibrahim is recommended in most engagements, weddings, and many other private events. He has special techniques that give his pictures a special identity. 

To improve his business, Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new frame collections, cameras, and batteries necessary for his business. He hopes that his business will improve more and more in the future, and he hopes to expand his business to be a special events planner from A–Z.

loans.use: to buy new frame collections, cameras, and batteries necessary for his business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
This is Leah, 42, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. Her husband is Roderick, an overseas contract worker. She is the mother of one child. She manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Leah operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the item. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 50,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leah hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Perrise Mbeneka

texts.en: Perrise is 37 years old and married. She has been a tailor for the last four years. She describes herself as quiet and a good team player, and she likes sharing ideas with others. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to add stock. She will be using the 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy material for making clothes for the December holiday, as she anticipates that the purchasing power of her clients will increase. In the future, Perrise wants to run a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing material

loans.name: Luteshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Luteshi SHG Group in Western Kenya! 

Ruth takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Ruth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Ruth is the facilitator of the Luteshi SHG group. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Luteshi SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Rose personifies humility, ambition, prudence, and poise. There is a visage of discipline, organization, and focus amongst the people she has employed to work at her beauty salon in Jinja. Her philosophy and that of her workers is "one hand washes the other, and together they wash the face." Rose, a mother of six, has tried as much as possible, in the last eight years her salon has been in existence, to instill that precept in her workers. That is what has given her business strategic leverage.

Eight years' experience in this business, where she offers mostly hairdressing services, has been worth every while, Rose says. Her proficient delivery of service to clients has been a calling card. The future prospects look good for Rose's business. This is the fourth time her group will receive a loan from Pearl. Weekly, her income totals 100,000 Ugandan shillings. Rose set forth in her business immediately after the completion of school. She also sells scrap metal to earn an extra buck. Rose says she intends to use her loan to purchase cosmetics for use at her salon, and the rest of the proceeds will go towards the purchase of a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for use at her salon, and the rest of the proceeds will go towards the purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Saphaniah

texts.en:
Saphaniah is a married man with two school-going children. He rents a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Saphaniah has operated a retail shop for the past three years. His potential clients are the local area residents. Seasonality is the major challenge he faces. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), he wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and soap for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and soap for resale

loans.name: Busena

texts.en:
Busena is 30 year old a married woman with three children between the age of 9-3 year. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for four years.
Busena requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dunamis Group

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Jaqueline from Harare, Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, two attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Jaqueline runs a retail business selling shoes, skirts and shirts. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenges faced are competition and duty charges (taxes). Jaqueline has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy shoes, skirts, shirts, and tops for resale. She is hoping to maximise her profit as a result of the extra income generated from this loan. The loan will allow her to cater to a larger market in bulk purchases. In the future, Jaqueline plans to establish a company that will sell at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Lisse

texts.en:
Lisse is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Sasina.  She is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Lisse owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community.  Lisse has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lisse joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lisse has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  Lisse is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase a new fishing boat to replace the old one. This loan will be the 2nd one taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lisse plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat to replace the old one

loans.name: Manasbek

texts.ru:
Манасбеку  43 года, женат и воспитывает троих детей. 19 лет назад, в в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Манабек начал свой бизнес в торговле продуктами и товарами повседневного спроса, используя при этом сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS). Магазинчик Манасбека известен тем, что при хорошем качестве товара, он реализует продукты по низкой цене, что важно для людей с небольшим достатком.  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду, Манасбек сумел развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом   около 20,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Манасбек обратился  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Манасбек планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en:
Manasbek is 43 years old, married and has three children. Nineteen years ago in search of a source of income for his family Manasbek started his business selling food and basic goods using the sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Manasbek's store is known for good quality products which are sold at a low price, which is important for people with low incomes. Through persistence and hard work Manasbek was able to develop his business with a monthly income of about 20,000 KGS.

In order to further develop his business Manasbek turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to expand the product range. Manasbek plans to invest the income from loan in the expansion of retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 28-year-old single man, working in the selling and manufacturing charcoA. since 2000.

Malek's business is highly requested in the region not only because of the expected winter season, so that people use it to stay warm, but also for the big request by Hookah lovers, who are increasing in a very fast way these days.

Malek is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, in order to increase his charcoA. capitA. through buying extra wood and to prepare it for the expected winter season. 

Malek is a hard working man. He also works in planting and harvesting speciA. Hookah tobacco, which most of his customers think it is the best tobacco they ever tasted.

Malek hopes to increase his business  more and more in the future, through opening a wholesale store, capable of storing a huge amount of charcoA. in the future.

loans.use: to increase his charcoal capital through buying extra wood and preparing it for the expected winter season.

loans.name: Khakakho Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the facilitator of the Khakakho group. Caleb and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Caleb takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Caleb had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caleb was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caleb and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Caleb will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khakakho group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tailoring material (cloths, lappers(traditional cloths) , and a new sewing machine) to expand his business.

loans.name: Faasegia

texts.en:
Faasegia is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Samata. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Faasegia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Faasegia has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Faasegia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faasegia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faasegia is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Faasegia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Dieu Vivant Plus Group

texts.en:
Pierre is the chairman of the community bank named “Dieu Vivant Plus” which is composed of 13 micro-entrepreneurs who are united in the same goal — to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through HOPE RDC. 

Pierre is 53 years old. His main business activity is selling beverages. He buys them in bulk and resells them at the retail level for a profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area located west of Kinshasa. His business makes a profit of about US $180 per week. 

Pierre started his business in 2000. He is a trustworthy client of HOPE RDC, having seven times obtained and correctly repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy twenty crates of beverages to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. The aim of this loan is to reinforce his working capital and provide food for his family. Pierre is married and the father of nine children, whose ages range from 10 to 33 years old. Four of the children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase beverages in bulk

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine, 46, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Catherine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Catherine hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Gawa

texts.en:
Gawa is 26-year-old a married woman with three children between the age of 6 year to 2 years. One of them is in school. She has had a hair dressing business in her salon in Kator, South Sudan for two years.

Gawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase weaves and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase weave and hair lotions for sale.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat, 54, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Phat and her husband are farmers. Phat is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase groceries to start a new business. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a L.-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to start a new business

loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.en:
Bakumedibi, aged 50, is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Adonai Plus” which comprises 9 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bakumedibi has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. She runs a general store in the western area of Kinshasa. Bakumedibi has already obtained and correctly repaid five loans from microfinance institution and Kiva partner HOPE DRC. She works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her area. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business which earns her $55 daily. Bakumedibi will increase her stock of goods by buying items such as soaps, cans, sacks of sugar, etc. for resale at a profit with this next loan. She is married and the mother of two sons aged 12 and 13, both of whom attend school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her goods by buying the store’s items such as soaps, cans, sacks of sugar, etc. for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Malu A Group

texts.en:
Grace is the facilitator of the Malu A group. Grace and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. 

The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Grace takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from her maize sales, Grace will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Malu A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Grace with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida, a happily married mother of one, spends her time at home taking care of her young son. Her husband relies on income from his trade selling cattle and goats. He has good knowledge of animal breeds, buying animals from the animal market and selling them. His clients are community members and friends.

Zahida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He intends to use this loan to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.use: To buy goats to resell

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
Bibi is 53 years old and married.  She is the mother of an 18 year old son who goes to school.  Bibi’s main activity is selling smoked and salted fish from her business located west of the city of Kinshasa.  Besides that, she also sells peanuts, mushrooms, beans and miscellaneous items.  Currently her business brings in $60 USD weekly.  Bibi has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1982 and is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC.  She has received and repaid eleven previous loans.
Bibi is requesting a loan to increase her stock of goods by buying packages of smoked fish in order to meet the high demand of the customers in her community and to make more profit.  Her ambition is to open a cold room to keep and resell fresh fish in her area.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods by buying packages of smoked fish in order to meet the high demand of the customers.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, 25, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Chanthy is employed at the garment factory. Chanthy is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en:
This is Ernelyn, 39, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo. She is an employee and a mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ernelyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, The Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer who then has one month to pay. The dealer’s prices to buy the merchandise are lower than the prices in the catalog, and the remainder of the customer's price is the profit that dealers can expect as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 4500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ernelyn fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Prophète Plus Group

texts.en:
Prophète Plus is a community bank made up of nine micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Jean Pierre.  These members are united for the same goal which is to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Jean Pierre sells beverages in the eastern area of Kinshasa.  He has been in the business world since 1994 selling palm oil.  After much hard work and good management, he succeeded in making his business thrive thanks to the accumulated profits.  He is happy to be one of MFI HOPE’s clients.  He has already obtained and correctly repaid eight loans from this micro-finance institution.

He intends to reinforce his capital with the next loan by adding twenty crates of beverages.  Currently, the business gives him a profit of US $50.00 per week. 

Jean Pierre’s ambition is to open a soft drink facility in his area.  He is 46 years old, married, and the father of four children whose ages vary between 4 and 15 years. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase in bulk twenty crates of soft drinks for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Saem

texts.en: Saem, 42, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Saem sells Cambodian noodles to her new and existing customers. Saem is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 39-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 3-15 years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a stall in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Julia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread, tomatoes, and green vegetables. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread, tomatoes, and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Chimeddulam

texts.en: Chimeddulam is 50 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Her son is employed. She started her business in 2000 by purchasing salvaged cars and selling their parts. Now, she sells a broad range of parts and accessories; however, Japanese cars are increasing in province. Therefore, demand for their parts is high. She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy car supplies. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "My product's demand is decreasing, and I am getting into a danger where I could be kicked out of the market, and I need to act aggressively in order to survive".

loans.use: To buy car supplies for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 45-year-old married man and father of four beautiful children. He has owned a shoe sales shop since 1996. Hassan's business is going well, since most of his prices are affordable to most of his customers. Almost 90% of his customers are his villagers, but sometimes their friends and relatives are his customers too.

Hassan is a hardworking man. He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise for the coming Winter & Christmas Season. Hassan is optimistic that this Christmas season will generate considerable income and that he will be able to expand his business more and more in the future, either by opening another branch or by starting wholesale trade.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise for the coming Winter & Christmas Season

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Сафарбек женат и ответственный отец семерых детей. Он занимается купле- продажей продукты питания такие как печенье, конфеты, макароны, рис, масло и овощи. А также он продает хозяйственные товары. Сафарбек хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он запрашивает займ для покупки продукты питания, хозтовары и картошку с целью расширения бизнеса. Сафарбек надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарить вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Safarbek is married. He is a responsible father of seven. He buys and sells food products, such as cookies, candy, pasta, rice, butter, and vegetables. He also sells household items. Safarbek would like to expand his business and make a good profit. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of food products, household items and potatoes. Safarbek hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase food products, household items and potatoes

loans.name: Dildekan

texts.ru: Дилдекан 50 лет, замужем и имеет двух взрослых сыновей.  Дилдекан работает посудомойщицей в кафе  и параллельно занимается откормом и перепродажей скота и полеводством.  Начатое еще в 1990-х годах с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  и насчитывающее две дойные коровы и одну лошадь, сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   В данный момент, семья Дилдекан обрабатывает  3.0 га орошаемой земли , где выращивают клевер и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Дилдекан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Дилдекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины.
texts.en: Dildekan is 50 years old. She is married and has two adult sons. Dildekan works as a dishwasher in cafe.  At the same time, she is involved in fattenening and selling cattle, and cropping. The business, which she started back in the 1990s with the starting capital of 5,000 som (KGS), includes two milk cows and one horse. The sale of dairy products brings brings about 4,000 som (KGS) per month. Dildekan's family currently works 3.0 ha of irrigated land. They grow clover and perennial grasses. In order to further increase the number of livestock, Dildekan turned to the company "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30.000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bulls. Dildekan plans to use the profit for further increasing the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith, age 57, weaves Cambodian traditional silk to earn a living. Ith is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more raw silk to use to produce silk products. She needs the additional funds in order to meet the market demand for her products. This will allow her family to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to make essential repairs to her house. She and her husband live in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy raw silk in order to produce wovven silk products

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Teresa, 36, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rhoderic, a driver. She is the mother of three children. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Teresa maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers depend on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 13,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Teresa fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold, age 44, is a furniture maker. He started his nomadic furniture making business in 2004. He manufactures high-quality furniture items with embellishments and quality painting work. However, his equipment is getting old and at present is unable to operate. 

Ganbold is requesting 650,000 MNT to buy timber. 	

Ganbold lives with his wife and three children in a "ger" (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is employed as a janitor and their three children are all school students.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Agnes Mutete

texts.en:
Agnes earns a living by selling used clothing. She has applied for her third loan of KES 85,000, from KADET Ltd, after paying back the previous loans consistently and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more ladies' clothes, particularly blouses and skirts, to offer for sale.

She will invest the anticipated profits back into the business. She hopes to grow her business and own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to add fresh inventory of blouses and skirts to offer for sale

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Grace is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. Grace and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Grace takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and secure enough food for her family and community. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. 

Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Grace will educate her children and save in business and livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Grace is pictured with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer as shown in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, age 31, weaves Cambodian traditional silk to earn a living. Sokly is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more raw silk so that she can produce her silk products in necessary quantities to complete the market demand. This will allow her family to be able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. Sokly lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy raw silk to produce traditional woven silk products

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr:
Mariétou est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants et 4 petits fils.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick .
Mariétou pratique le commerce dans la vente de fruits et légumes une activité qu'elle maitrise bien pour l 'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau prêt de 250000 elle va acheter 35 paniers d'oranges , 25 paniers de mandarines et 15 sacs d'oignons et des pastèques.
A l'aide de ses bénéfices Madame va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des enfants et acheter du riz du sucre et de l'huile à la fin de chaque mois.
texts.en: Mariétou is a married woman who is 60 years old and has six children and four grandsons. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 1st September 2008 and belongs to the Sope Malick solidarity group. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables, a business which she masters well since she has been doing it for a long time. With her new loan of 250,000 francs she is going to buy 35 baskets of oranges, 25 baskets of mandarins and 15 sacks of onions, as well as some water melons. With her profits Mariétou will help her husband with the cost of their children's education and also buy rice, sugar and oil at the end of each month.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables (oranges, water melons, mandarins and onions, cabbages, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more everyday provisions to offer for sale in his shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more stock of clothes, bedsheets, reams of printing paper and mattresses for resale. In the future, Agnes aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Agnes has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes, bedsheets, reams of printing paper and mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme Zenabo est la responsable du groupe ADONAÏM2.Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Le plus âgé a 5ans et le moins âgé a 3ans. Aucun ne va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments depuis 5ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter un sac d’oignon, un carton de patte de tomate, un plat de tomate fraiche, un demi plat de percile et de celerie, 2kg d’ail, un paquet de Maggi.

Elle prend soin de ses enfants avec ses bénéfices. Ses ambitions sont de scolariser ses enfants et d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Zenabo is in charge of the Adonaïm 2 group. She is married and mother to two children, the eldest five years old and the youngest three years old. Neither of Zenabo's children attend school and she also has two other dependents.

She has been selling condiments for five years and gets her supplies at the Pissy market in town. Her customers are both men and women.

Zenabo wants to buy a sack of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a plate of fresh tomatoes, half a plate of parsley and celery, 2kg of garlic and a packet of Maggi stock cubes.

She takes care of her children with her profits and her ambition is to be able to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a dish of fresh tomatoes , half a plate of parsley and celery, 2 kg of garlic and a packet of Maggi stock cubes

loans.name: Philoméne

texts.fr:
Philomène est une mère de famille âgée de 33 ans et mère de 3 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 02/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité  sope sa jeker.

Philomène pratique du petit commerce plus précisément  la vente de céréales( mil maïs arachides)
elle vend également des habits déjà confectionnés.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 250.000 francs Cf a elle va acheter du mil , du maïs 10 paires de chaussures et 10 habits pré-confectionnés  destinées à la revente.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle va acheter du riz de l'huile et du sucre à la fin de chaque mois pour ses enfants. 

Elle va également acheter des médicaments pour sa famille en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Philomena is a 33-year-old mother of three children. She has been a member of the local "Banc Villageois" association since September 2008 and is part of the "sope sa jeker" solidarity group.

Philomena practices small retail trading, specifically dealing with cereals (millet, maize, peanuts). She also sells ready-to-wear clothes.

With her new loan of 250,000 XOF she will buy millet, maize, 10 pairs of shoes and 10 ready-to-wear ​​clothes for resale.

Using the profits she will buy rice, oil and sugar at the end of each month for her children. She will also buy medication for her family in case of illness.

loans.use: buy millet and maize for resale

loans.name: Nehema Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nehema SHG Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Nehema SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nehema SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase a drier, cosmetics, hair extensions and some clothes for her salon. In the future, Louis aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Louis has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a drier, cosmetics, hair extensions and some clothes for her salon.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Cipriano tiene 49 años, está casado con la Sra. Mari, tienen 6 hijos, el mayor tiene 33 años y el menor de todos 11 años.
Cipriano es gomero, nos comenta que empieza sus actividades diarias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y regresa muy tarde a su casa por la noche, cuenta que se dedica a esto hace mas de 27 años, tiene su casa en una de las compañías de la ciudad de Paraguarí, 5 de sus hijos ya trabajan por cuenta propia y el menor de todos se encuentra cursando la primaria. Gracias a su esfuerzo todos sus hijos terminaron sus estudios.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas, el cual es el principal insumo de su negocio. Agradece a la fundacion por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Cipriano is 49 years old and married to Mari.  They have six children; the oldest is 33 and the youngest is 11.

Cipriano fixes tires.  He tells us that he begins his daily activities very early in the morning and returns home very late at night.  He says he has been doing this for more than 27 years.  He has his house in one of the neighborhoods in the city of Paraguarí.  Five of his children are already working on their own, and the youngest of all is in elementary school.  Thanks to his dedication all of his children finished school.

He is requesting the loan to buy tires, the main supply of his business.

He is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity this gives him because the loan will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to buy tires to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sneakers, easy wear, slippers, jeans trouser, neck trig, and baby tubs for her business

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Абдукарим женат и имеет 4 детей. Более одного года он занимается перевозкой грузов. Он усердно работает для того, чтобы обеспечить своих детей  и хочет получить хорошую прибыль для  содержания семьи. Абдукарим хочет устроить своих детей в хорошие школы и университеты, чтобы они стали образованными и воспитанными людьми. С этой целью он запрашивает займ для покупки мотороллера, который позволит ему получить прибыль и улучшить условия содержания семьи.
texts.en: Abdukarim is married with four children. For over a year he has been providing freight services. He works hard to make good profit and provide for his family. Abdukarim wants to ensure that his children enter good schools, that they grow up educated and well mannered. With this goal in mind, he is applying for a loan that will allow him to purchase a scooter, make profit and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a scooter

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Isabel tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, es dueña de una pequeña Despensa en su ciudad, tiene casa propia, que logró por medio de su arduo esfuerzo, es madre de 2 hijas menores, ella es madre soltera.
Ella nos cuenta que se esfuerza diariamente por darle lo mejor a sus hijas, ya que ella se encuentra sola. Trabaja dia a dia para poder tener el sustento diario. Por medio de su negocio ha logrado salir adelante y darle a sus hijas lo maximo que ella puede para que ellas tengan una vida digna y decorosa.
Solicito el crédito para poder surtir su negocio y así poder mantener su clientela y mejorar su ingreso. Podrá comprar más productos para la venta como harina, fideo, lácteos, panificados, yerbas, arroz, etc. La misma es de muy escasos recursos y con su perseverancia y su labor diaria de sol a sol está logrando mantener a su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel, 31, is a single mother of 2 young daughters, and she lives in Villarrica.  She owns a small store in the city.  She has her own house that she was able to buy with a lot of effort.  

She tells us that she struggles every day to give her children the best since she is now single.  She works every day to be able to support her family.Through her business she has succeeded in giving her daughters the best so that they can have a dignified and decent life.  She is requesting the loan to supply her business and keep her customers and improve on her investment.  She would like to buy more products to sell such as: flour, noodles, dairy items, bread, herbs, rice, etc.  She has little money but with her perseverence and daily work, she has been able to support her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, noodles, dairy products, bread, herbs, rice, etc

loans.name: Rajabaly

texts.ru: Ражабали 27 лет, женат, воспитывает двух детей. Ражабали работает в стоматологической поликлинике и параллельно занимается животноводством, что является очень хорошей поддержкой в покрытии расходов молодой семьи.  Стартовав в этом бизнесе с суммы в 20,000 сом  (KGS), Ражабали приложил все усилия для развития своего хозяйства  и добился успеха – на сегодняшний день его ферма с двумя дойными коровами и 25 баранами приносят ежемесячный доход в сумме около 10,000 сом от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ражабали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Ражабали планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en: Rajabaly is a 27-year old father of two. He is married. Rajabaly works in a dental clinic. At the same time, he is involved in animal husbandry, which is very helpful in covering the young family's costs. Having launched this business with a starting capital of 20,000 som (KGS), Razhabali made ​​every effort to make it successful. Today the profits from the sales of dairy and meat products from his farm, which now has two dairy cows and 25 sheep, yield about 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop this business, Razhabaly turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle for fattening. Rajabali plans to invest the income from this loan into increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha is a 40 year old married woman, and mother of 2 children. She has worked as a tailor since 1996. This long experience gives her customers' trust and confidence, and her shop is improving through renewed loan cycles applied for and invested in her business from Kiva partner A. Majmoua. This is her eighth cycle as an A. Majmoua borrower, all with very positive effect.

Her clothes selling is improving too, and this is all because of the trust she has gained from her customers. Her good standing and history of paying back, encourages A. Majmoua to reply to her requests without hesitating.

Nouha very much enjoys sewing and running a shop, and also finds the contact she has with her customers very rewarding. Since beginning her business, Nouha has built up a large number of clientele, whom she insists on treating as her precious treasures.

loans.use: To buy a special sewing machine

loans.name: Saint Luc Group

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata Pascaline est la représentante du groupe SAINT LUC. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 1an 02 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy.ses clients sont les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter une balle de fils de tisse.

Mme économise ses bénéfices et met une partie dans les charges familiales. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande vendeuse de fils de tisse et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Pascaline is the leader of the SAINT LUC group. Married, she is the mother of 04 children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. 2 go to school and she has 4 people in her care.

She has been a weaver for 4 years. She stocks up on supplies at the Pissy market. Her clients are men.

She wants to buy herself a bale of yarn to weave.

She saves her profit and puts a part of it toward the family expenses. She aims to become a great yarn saleswoman and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy herself a bale of yarn to weave

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tailoring materials (cloths, traditional cloths, etc) for his business

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Astou est une femme mariée âgée de 59 ans mère de 8 enfants et responsables de 3 petits fils.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 05/03/2009 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope serign babacar.
Astou fait du petit commerce de poissons activité qu'elle pratique depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter du poissons séchés et fumés qu'elle va revendre au détails dans son quartier.
A l'aide des bénéfices réalisés elle va soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Astou is a married 59-year-old woman, the mother of 8 children and responsible for 3 small sons. 

She has been a member of the banc villageois since 05/03/2009 and is part of the solidarity group Sope serign babacar.

Astou has a small fish business that she has had for a long time.

With her new loan, she is going to buy dried and smoked fish that she is going to sell in her neighborhood.

With the help of the realized profits, she is going to support her husband with the schooling and health of their children.

loans.use: to buy some dried fish and condiments that she is going to resell

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Seynabou est une femme mariée âgée de 74 ans et mère de 6 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 01/09/2008 elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Moussa .

Elle pratique du petit commerce plus précisément la vente d'arachide de mil  et de haricots.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs elle va acheter 10 sacs de mil 20 sacs d'arachides et 35 sacs de haricots qu'elle va revendre au niveau du marché de son quartier.

Grace à ses bénéfices Seynabou va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire des enfants mais également elle va payer des ordonnances à ses derniers en cas de maladie.
texts.en: Seynabou is a married 74-year-old woman and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the banc villageois (village bank) since 01/09/2008. She is part of the solidarity group Sope Moussa. She practices a little trade specifically the sale of peanuts, millet and beans. With her new loan of 500000 francs, she is going to buy 10 bags of millet, 20 bags of peanuts and 35 bags of beans that she is going to resell in the market of her neighborhood. Thanks to her profits, Seynabou is going to help her husband with the school-based care of children but she will also pay for some prescriptions from her last illness.

loans.use: to buy millet, peanuts and beans

loans.name: Bilkiss

texts.fr:
Bilkiss est une femme âgée de 27 ans. Elle est célibataire. Elle a 1 enfant de 12 ans qui va à l’école.  
Bilkiss travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des céréales et de la bouillie pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Bilkiss a requis son 4ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs, du fonio des haricots et du sucre. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bilkiss voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir heureux à son enfant.
texts.en:
Bilkiss is a 27-year-old single woman.  She has one twelve-year-old child who attends school.  She has been working in retail sales since 2000.  She sells grains and baby porridge for all the customers at the market.  She purchases her products in Lomé.  She works alone.  At this time, she has no difficulty.  Bilkiss requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to purchase corn, fonio, beans and sugar.  She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the years to come, Bilkiss would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that she plans on using the profits to ensure a happy future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase grain to make baby porridge.

loans.name: Janine Trezina

texts.en:
Janine Trezina, age 56, has been the owner of a shoe shop since 1975. She is a hard-working woman and her business is flourishing, since most of her prices are affordable to most of her customers. Almost 90 percent of her customers are her fellow villagers, but sometimes their friends and relatives are her customers too. 

Janine is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her products for the coming winter and Christmas season. This will be her second loan from Al Majmoua. Her first loan had very impressive and encouraging results, and she is a borrower in good standing. Janine and her husband are optimistic that this Christmas season will bring a positive income. Janine is confident that she will be capable of expanding her business more and more in the future, eventually to the extent of buying new shops and opening new branches.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise for the coming Christmas and winter season

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, is a happily married mother of three. Her children are 23, 20 and 17 years old.  Her children are well educated which makes Salma and her husband proud. 
Her husband is a salesman by profession and his income relies on his sales.  He buys household supplies and food items at wholesale and sells to different grocery stores and general stores.  
He has been involved in this business for the past seven years.  
To improve his finances and his clientage, Salma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah.  Her husband intends to use this loan to purchase more household supplies and food items for resale. 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to his business and her family will use the increased income for their well-being.

loans.use: To buy household supplies & food items for resale.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Comité "Santa Rosa"  D. la ciudad D. Villa Ygatimi. Están en el primer Ciclo del Programa Comité D. Mujeres Rurales D. la Fundación Paraguaya con el total D. Diez integrantes. Todas son mujeres responsables y dedicadas, que diariamente se esfuerzan para que por medio D. trabajo puedan ayudar a sus familias e hijos, son jefas D. hogar que cargan con la responsabilidad D. cuidar a sus familias.
Una D. ellas es la señora Juana, quien se dedica a la cría D. gallinas desD. hace ya un buen tiempo. Ella comenta comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que siempre debe D. estar pendiente para que sus animales no tengan ninguna enfermedad. Ella comenta que venD. bien los animales que cría, por lo que quiere seguir invirtiendo en ello.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas pequeñas para la cría y posterior venta, además D. eso para comprar alimento para los mismos. Agradecen la oportunidad que la fundación les da.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Communal Bank of the city of Villa Ygatimí is in the first loan cycle of the Programa Comité D. Mujeres Rurales, of the Fundación Paraguaya, with a total of ten members.  All are responsible and dedicated women who make an effort through their work every day so they can help their families and children.  They are heads of household who bear the responsibility of taking care of their families. 

One of the members is Juana, who has worked raising chickens for a long time already.  She comments that her work is very selfless, since she always has to devote her time to her animals so they do not get any illness.  She says the animals she raises sell well, which is why she wants to continue investing in them.

She is requesting the loan to buy little chickens to raise and later sell.  She also will buy feed for them.

She is grateful for the opportunity that the foundation is giving her.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr:
Soda est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans  mère de 12 enfants.

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 02/09/2008 ou elle occupe le poste de présidente.
Soda fait parti du groupe de solidarité ande liguey et elle pratique du commerce plus précisément la vente de poissons frais.
Avec son nouveau prêt de 400000 elle va acheter 40 paniers de poissons qu'elle va revendre au détail  au niveau du marché de son quartier.
A l 'aide de ses bénéfices elle va acheter du riz de l'huile du sucre et payer des fournitures scolaires à ses enfants .
texts.en:
Soda is a 44-year-old married mother of 12.
