Gracias al trabajo que realiza todos los días logra satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes, pan, jugos, refrescos entre otros. Esta es la primera experiencia que tiene con créditos y se siente muy feliz por tener esta oportunidad promete cumplir con las cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Mrs. Jacqueline works in her small store, which she started with a small capital that she had saved up; she is a very hard-working and responsible person. Thanks to her daily work, she is able to cover her household's needs. She is currently requesting this loan for the purchase of candy, basic grains, detergents, bread, juice, and pop, among other items. This is her first experience with loans and she is very happy to have this opportunity. She promises to repay her quotas as established.

loans.use: to buy candies, pop, basic grains, detergents, bread, juice, and other items.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a 31-year-old married man with two children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. He owns a house, which does not have electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Mwero has operated a retail shop for the past three years. His customers are the local villagers. He faces a major challenge of transport. With a loan of KES 25,000, he wants to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and soap for his shop. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future. He decided to join Yehu to access loans so he can expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and soap for his shop.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: La socia Gladis; sigue trabjaando en el mismo mercado grande en la ciudad de Cusco, ella continua vendiendo sandalias y ahora tambien vende babuchas para niños y adultos, la socia a creciedo estos meses y ahora desea el credito para invertir en la compra de mercadería mayor a la que tuvo antes, la socia implementara su stand con mercadería renovada, para ello solicita el prestamo, la socia desea a futuro seguir prosperando para dar mejor calidad de vida su hija. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra de sandalias variadas y de temporada, para implementar us negocio.
texts.en: Gladis continues to work in the same big market in the city of Cusco.  She continues to sell sandals, and now she also sells slippers for children and adults.  Her business has grown over these months, and now she wants a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise that is better than what she had before; she wants to stock up her sales post with fresh merchandise.  To do this she requests a loan.  In the future, Gladis wants to continue to prosper so she can give her daughter a better quality of life.  Gladis wants this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of summer sandals to stock up her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of summer sandals to stock up her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Narcisa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes y gallinas al por mayor, la socia en la tienda de abarrotes vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como azúcar, leche, arroz y aceite y también para comprar alimentos para los animales. 
La socia Narcisa ha solicitado un anterior credito individual,pero este credito publicado pertenece al grupal del banco comunal perolniyoc,este creedito grupal solicito para su tienda de abarrotes y crianza de animales y el credito individual solicito para agricultura y tambien para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is named Narcisa. She is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. 

The member alternates her daily activities between her grocery store and the breeding of animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and hens at wholesale prices. 

Regarding her grocery store the member sells basic stapes such as rice, sugar and milk and through this business the member is able to raise her children. She wants to expand her grocery store and breeding of animals. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for the grocery store such sugar, milk, rice and oil and also in order to buy feed for the animals.

Narcisa has also asked for a previous individual loan, but this stated loan, as a member of the communal bank group Perolniyoc, is for her grocery store and animal feed, and the previous individual loan was for agriculture and also to supply her grocery store.

The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store such as sugar, milk, rice and oil, and also to buy animal feed

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children, one of whom attends school while the other is too young. His wife is a tailor who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. He owns a house without electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Kassim has operated a retail shop for the past four years. His customers are the local villagers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. With a loan of KES 15,000 he wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business, which is his dream.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa Del Carmen tiene 60 años, su actividad es la venta de verduras. La necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar hicieron que Luisa buscara la forma de obtener un medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se siente muy contenta de volver a tener esta experiencia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de naranjas, tomates, cebollas, bananos, papaya, piña, mangos entre otros. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado en donde circulan variedad de clientes.
texts.en: Luisa Del Carmen is 60 and sells fruits and vegetables. Because of the need to cover her household costs, Luisa looked for a good job. This is not her first loan, and she is very happy to be taking out another one. This loan is for the purchase of oranges, tomatoes, onions, bananas, papayas, pineapple, mangoes, and other items. Her business is in the market, where she has many customers.

loans.use: to buy oranges, tomatoes, onions, bananas, papaya, pineapple, mangoes, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. One is enrolled in school while one is still too young. Her husband, who is employed, contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanajuma has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past five years, with her neighbors as customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. With a loan of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get funds to expand her business, which is her dream.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miguelina; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también para comprar insumos para preparar chicha como maíz y azúcar.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 42, is a member of the “Perolniyoc de Urubamba” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business raising animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She also sells ‘chicha,’ a drink made from corn.  Through these small businesses she’s able to raise her children.  She wants to expand and improve the business raising animals and the chicha sales so is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs and also to buy supplies needed to make chicha like corn and sugar.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and also ingredients t make chicha like corn and sugar.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 23 years old and is single. He has one year's experience selling various goods such as watches, glasses and bags. The hours of his business are from 7am to 8pm every day. 

Joel has requested a loan to purchase stock of watches, glasses and bags to sell. With any profits from the loan, Joel would like to satisfy his family`s basic needs and start saving for his future

loans.use: To purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es: Luz Helena le fué muy bien con la inversión de su credikiva anterior y está aplicando a uno nuevo, porque va a aprovechar muy bien la temporada de Diciembre para aumentar su oferta, captar nuevos clientes y aumentar sus utilidades. Con su credikiva comprará tratamientos capilares, tintes, shampoo, en volumenes superiores a los que actualmente está comprando,; su inversión será exitosa porque ganará descuentos, la realizará en época de un gran desplegue comercial y de mucho dinero rotano por efecto de primas, bonificaciones que reciben los trabajadores de las empresas.
texts.en:
Luz Helena did very well with the investment of her prior Kiva loan and is applying for a new one because she wants to be very prepared for the December season to increase her offers, capture new customers and increase profits.  

She will use her Kiva loan to buy hair treatments, hair coloring and shampoo in larger amounts than she’s been buying.  Her investment will be successful because she’ll qualify for discounts and she’ll make it during a season of great commercial activity because a great deal of cash is circulating due to the bonuses and allowances workers get from their firms.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 49 years old and is married with two children. Seraphine sells second-hand clothing. Her business is well known and well organized. She works from 6am to 6pm five days a week. Seraphine has requested her second loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more second-hand clothing for resale. With any profit, Seraphine will be able to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 37 and married with four children. Three of her children attend school and one is too young. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past five years with the local villagers as her customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop. With the loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more stock of rice, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Nimaneno

texts.en:
Nimaneno is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 10,000 KES loan to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale. In the future, Nimaneno aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Nimaneno has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de repostería, ella prepara tortas, galletas, empanadas y pasteles, ella trabaja en forma independiente y también trabaja como docente del nivel primaria en la ciudad de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de repostería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como mantequilla, harina, azúcar y huevos para preparar las tortas y pasteles. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena, 44, is a member of the “Perolniyoc de Urubamba” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She’s married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with pastry making.  She makes cakes, cookies, turnovers and tarts.   She works independently and also as an elementary school teacher in the city of Urubamba.  She wants to expand the pastry making business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like butter, flour, sugar and eggs to make cakes and tarts.  She is happy with the loan and pledges to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cake making ingredients like flour, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Andrea, quien había oído acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, se informó y luego comento a sus amigas y vecinas sobre el tema, y ellas gustosas decidieron formar su grupo. De allí surge el comité llamado Mujeres Activas, el cual está integrado por 18 mujeres, todas ellas muy activas y trabajadoras.
La señora Andrea, la precursora del grupo, comenta que trabaja incansablemente, recorriendo las calles, ya que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ella se dedica al reciclaje. Junta todo tipo de materiales reciclables, como ser botellas de plástico, cartones, papeles, con lo cual con mucho esfuerzo logra mantener a su familia. comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de botellas, y cartones por cantidad para la posterior venta al mayor, ya que eso le dará mayor margen de ganancias. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le da, pues es una oportunidad de progreso para ella.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Andrea who had heard about Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] program.  She informed herself and then commented to her girlfriends and neighbors about the topic.  They gladly decided to form their group.  From that the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) group arose with 18 members who are all very active and hardworking.

Andrea, the group’s precursor, comments that she works tirelessly walking throughout the streets because her work is very demanding: she’s a recycler.  She collects all types of recyclable material like plastic bottles, cardboard and paper which with much effort she’s able to use to support her family.  She comments that she’s very proud of what she does because it’s a honorable, honest job.

She requests the loan to buy bottles and cardboard in quantity to later resell at wholesale because this will leave a larger profit margin.  She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s given because it’s an opportunity for progress for her.

loans.use: to buy bottles and cardboard for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: María Gabriela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo, a los que les brinda alimento, salud y vestimenta. Uno de los sueños que María tiene es seguir adelante con su negocio uno de los problemas más frecuentes que atraviesa es el no tener suficiente inventario para ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de sabanas, cosméticos, cremas, perfumes, calzado, reloj y ropa en general. Ella tiene que salir a ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante para obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en: María Gabriela sells general merchandise.  She has two children in her care; she provides them with food, health and clothing.  One of María’s dreams is to stay in business but one of her frequent problems is not having enough inventory on hand to provide variety to her customers.  The reason for the loan is to buy sheets, cosmetics, creams, perfume, footwear, watches and clothing in general.  To obtain new customers she has to go out and sell her wares as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy sheets, cosmetics, creams, perfume, footwear, watches and clothing in general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food, such as bananas, pineapples, potatoes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, ella tiene 55 años y está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Dominga desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas, tiene una tienda D. videos juegos, a la agricultura, a la crianza D. animales menores y a la venta D. cerveza. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Dominga requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo insumos como papas, salchicha y otras cosas más. 

Dominga se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Dominga pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. Choquekillca” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
Dominga was born in Urubamba but currently lives in Ollantaytambo. She is 55 years old, married with three children.  

She lives and works in the city of Ollantaytambo. She sells chips and sausages, owns a videogame shop, works in agriculture, raises small animals and sells beer. She has been in business for many years and does well due to her determination.  

Dominga is asking for this loan to purchase products such as potatoes, sausages and others.  

Dominga is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this option and promises to repay on time, according to schedule. She belongs to “Señor D. Choquekillca” Communal Bank from Asociación Arariwa in Urubamba city.

loans.use: to purchase products and supplies such as potatoes, sausages and others

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La socia Amalia; continua con la venta D. caldos los días domingos en el mercado “Vino Canchón”, desD. muy temprano por las mañanas, la socia tiene como especialidad la venta D. caldos D. cabeza D. res, caldo D. patas y caldo D. panza, caldo D. pollera. La socia sigue siendo en casa la unica que aporta economicamente y siendo una mujer trabajadora y muy disciplinada las cosas van mejorando para ella y su negocio le esta yendo muy bien; La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito para comprar carne al por mayor, y los ingredientes para continuar con su negocio, por que lo que estuvo ganando D. la venta D. sus caldos lo ha estado invirtiendo en la salud D. su esposo y en gastos D. la casa, ahora esta discpuesta a continuar y desea invertir en su negocio, en la compra d ecarne, D. ingredientes, D. papa al por mayor para que vuelva a comenzar y crecer.
texts.en: Amalia is still selling soup on Sundays in the "Vino Canchón” market. She specializes in cow's head soup, leg soup, stomach meat soup, and chicken soup. She continues to be the sole breadwinner for her household. She is a hard-working woman, and very disciplined. Things are improving for her and her business is going very well. She now wants to invest this loan in the wholesale purchase of meat, as well as other ingredients. She has had to spend her earnings on her husband's health and household costs, but she is now ready to invest in her business. She will buy meat and ingredients, as well as potato, wholesale so that she can start expanding her business again.

loans.use: to invest in buying meat wholesale, as well as other ingredients, so that she can continue with her business.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 39-year-old married woman with four children who are all in school. Her husband is also employed and contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Irine has operated a vegetable grocery for the past seven years with her neighbors as her customers. She dreams of expanding her business but faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With a loan of KES 40,000 she wants to purchase more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Villa Adela Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER DE VILLA ADELA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: promotora Yambal, venta de tucumanas, bazar, tienda, venta de videos, venta de juguetes y electrodomésticos, tejido de ajuar de bebe.

La señora Ruth,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de un familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta juguetes y electrodomésticos que viene trabajando hace años atrás, el mismo lo aprendió de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de juguetes) que adquirirá de Oruro y de Desaguadero y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer de Villa Adela” (Villa Adela’s New Dawn) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani focal center.  It has seven members led by a governing board headed by Ruth, the Secretary.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: Yambal cosmetics sales, turnover sales, clothing store, grocery store, video sales, toy and home appliance sales, baby clothes knitting.

 Ruth indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a family members.  She’s currently in business selling toys and home appliances, a business she’s had for several years now and that she learned from her family.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital.  She will buy toys in Oruro and Desaguadero to later resell in the street markets.  This way of working allows her to have resources to support her family because she is single and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría chanchos, gallinas y cuyes, ella cría y los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el mercado de Calca, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, chanchos y gallinas al por mayor y también para comprar alimentos para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, 43, is a member of the “LLANCASUN DE ARIN” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.  She has a spouse and four children.

She alternates her daily chores with a business raising animals: she raises guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  She raises them and fattens them up and then sells them in the market in Calca.  She works from 9am until 4pm and through this business is able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the animal sales business so is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs, pigs and chickens as well as feed for the animals.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and chickens at wholesale and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 29-year-old single man who owns a house without electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Joshua has operated a bread-selling business for the past year. He sells his bread to the local villagers and to retail shop owners. He faces a major challenge of transportation. 

With a loan of KES 20,000, he wants to purchase more bread for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business, which is his dream.

loans.use: to purchase bread for resale.

loans.name: Ndani

texts.en:
Ndani is a 37-year-old married woman with six children, two of who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Ndani has operated a retail shop for the past ten years; in addition she also runs a café. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Ramon De Jesus

texts.es: Ramón De Jesús se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, este negocio lo ha tenido desde hace más de 4 años. El negocio lo aprendió por cuenta propia ya que necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia. El empieza su trabajo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, todos los días tiene la responsabilidad de ayudarle a su esposa con los ingresos. El financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, focos, repuestos entre otros. Sueña con lograr comprar dos tricitaxi.
texts.en: Ramón De Jesús provides taxi services, a business he’s had for over four years.  He learned the business on his own because he needed to support his family.  He starts work at 7am and goes until 9pm.  Every day he has the responsibility of helping his wife with income.  The loan will be used to buy tires, headlamps and spare parts, among others.  He dreams with being able to buy two three-wheeled taxis.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlamps and spare parts, among others.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (es una bebida a base de maíz), la socia vende en su casa desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar la chicha como maíz y jora al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LLANCASUN DE ARIN” communal bank. The bank is located in the Calca district and province which is located in the Cusco department. 

The member’s name is Rosa. She is 28 years old and has a partner and two children. The member alternates her daily activities with a business selling chicha (a drink made with a base of corn). The member sells the drink at her home from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. Through this small business, she helps her children move ahead. Rosa wants to expand her business selling chicha. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for making chicha like wholesale corn and jora.

The member is happy for this loan and promises to fulfill the payments of her loan.

loans.use: purchase materials for making chicha like wholesale corn and jora.

loans.name: Mwakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 28-year-old single lady who lives at her family’s house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for herself and clothing.

Mwanakombo has operated a tailoring business for the past nine years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more fabrics and embroidery for her business. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and embroidery for her business.

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr:
Mariétou est une femme veuve âgée de 50 ans et mère de 6 enfants .

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 05/03/2009 ou elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick.

Mariétou fait du petit commerce dans la vente de friperie.

Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité et avec son nouveau prêt de 400000 francs Cfa elle acheter 20 balles de friperies qu elle va revendre au détails.

Madame Mariétou va payer à ses enfants des fournitures scolaires et des médicaments grâce à ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mariétou is a 50-year-old widow and mother of six.

She has been a member of the “banc villageois” since March 5, 2009, and is a member of the Sope Malick solidarity group.

Mariétou works in small-scale sales of secondhand clothing.

She has considerable experience in this area of business, and with her new loan of 400,000 CFA francs, she will purchase 20 bales of secondhand clothing which she will then sell retail.

Mariétou will be able to pay for her children’s school supplies and for medicine, thanks to her profits.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales son mayores de edad, ella se  dedica a la venta de calzados, ( sandalias de cuero, zapatos, zapatillas, etc) porque le parece que este negocio le genera ingresos.  Rosa es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy luchadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia lleva en el negocio desde el año 2000 , gana semanalmente S/. 250 soles, con el préstamo que recibirá gracias a Kiva de S/. 1500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de calzado por fiestas navideñas, ya que en esta fecha hay mucha salida de mercadería, una de sus metas o sueños es tener su propia casa  y su propio negocio para que de esta manera pueda vivir mejor en un futuro no muy lejano, su asesor cree que es una buena cliente y que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.
Rosa vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother with three grown-up children.  Her business is selling shoes (leather sandals, shoes, sneakers, etc.) because this business makes her income.  Rosa is a hard-working, honest and very tenacious woman who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life.  She has been working in the business since 2000 and earns 250 soles a week.  With the loan for 1,500 soles that she will receive thanks to Kiva, she will invest in buying footwear for the Christmas season as she sells a lot of merchandise at this time of year.  One of her goals or dreams is to own her own home and her own business so that she can live more comfortably in the not-so-distant future.  Her loan officer believes that she is a good client who will make her loan repayments on time.

Rosa lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima (the country's capital).  It is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peru's traditional national drink (pisco). It is in this hot, arid climate that we find the client's home and business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season (shoes)

loans.name: Maria Elpidia

texts.es: María Elpidia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, desde hace más de 7 años que tiene este medio de vida. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de polvos, cremas, tratamientos, shampoo, pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, ropa interior. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y disfruta de tener este medio de vida, pues ha sido gracias a él que ha podido brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: María Elpidia sells cosmetics. For more than seven years, she has done this work. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of powders, creams, treatments, shampoos, lipstick, nail polish and underwear. Her business is mobile and she enjoys having this business. Thanks to the business she has been able to provide her family with the needed income.

loans.use: purchase of powders, creams, treatments, shampoos, lipstick, nail polish and underwear.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 57-year-old married woman with seven children who are all grown up. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Ruth has operated a grocery store for the past six years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access fund to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Justino; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania,el socio junto con su esposa vende sombreros, chompas y muñecas en el distrito de Calca, el socio también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, el tiene un terreno de agricultura donde siembra maíz, quinua y frejol, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía y mejorar en el negocio de agricultura. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y también para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.        
                 
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LLANCASUN DE ARIN” communal bank. The bank is located in the Calca district and province which is located in the Cusco department.

The member’s name is Justino. He is 58 years old and married. He has 5 children. He alternates his daily activities with the sale of handicrafts. Along with his wife, the member sells hats, sweaters, and dolls in the Calca district. The member also is a farmer. He has a plot of land where he plants corn, quinoa and beans. Through this means of work, he is able to help his children succeed. The member wants to expand his business selling handicrafts and improve his farming business. He is requesting the loan to purchase handicrafts and to purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming land.

The member is happy about the loan and he promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: purchase handicrafts and purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farming land.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this loan of 45,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more stocks of beans, potatoes, rice, and other cereals for her business. In the future, Janet aspires to continue improving her business.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Janet has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of beans, potatoes, rice, and other cereals for her business.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Jhonny es soltero pero convive con la señora Maribel   tienen una niña de 3 años de edad, el señor Jhonny tiene casa propia en la zona este de la localidad de Sacaba, El señor Jhonny se dedica al servicio de chapería y pintura para todo tipo de vehículos, trabaja de  lunes a sábado  tomándose así un día de descanso el día domingo para dedicarse exclusivamente a su familia, su taller de chapería funciona  en su domicilio, el cual es muy conocido por los vecinos del lugar,  debido a que ofrece un buen servicio, cordial y respetuoso y realiza un acabado de muy buena calidad en los vehículos que se encuentra a su cargo, El préstamo es para incrementar el capital de trabajo o la adquisición de herramientas nuevas para su taller ya que la que tienen terminaron su vida útil, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación su deseo es tener un taller de chapería con equipos modernos y tener mucha clientela, esta es su única fuente de ingresos con la  que  mantienen  a su pareja y a su hijito, por tal motivo se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brinda para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Mr. Jhonny is unmarried but lives with Mrs. Maribel. They have a three-year-old daughter. Jhonny has his own home in the east of Sacaba. He has a bodywork shop where he services and paints all kinds of vehicles. He works Monday through Saturday, setting Sunday aside as a day to rest and spend time with his family. He runs his workshop out of his home, and it is very well-known by his neighbours because he provides a good, cordial and respectful service. He does high-quality work. This loan is to increase his working capital and acquire new tools for his workshop, since his current tools are nearing the end of their usefulness. He is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. He wants to have a very modern autobody shop with a large customer base. This is his only source of income for supporting his partner and child. For this reason, he is grateful to the institution for the support offered in expanding his business.

loans.use: to acquire new tools for his bodywork shop.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Astou est une femme mariée âgée de62 ans et mère de 7 enfants .Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 05/03/2009 ou elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité sope Malick.

Madame Astou fait du petit commerce dans la vente de tissus et de parfums. Elle mène cette activité depuis longtemps c'est pourquoi elle dispose d une bonne expérience.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 250000 francs Cfa elle va acheter 10 rouleaux de tissus et 5 cartons de parfums destinés à la  revente de détails.

A l aide de ses bénéfices elle va aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Astou is a 62-year-old married mother of seven.  She has been a member of the “banc villageois” since March 5, 2009, and is a member of the Sope Malick solidarity group.

Astou works in small-scale sales of cloth and perfumes.  She has been working in this field for a long time, which is the reason for her considerable experience.

With her new loan of 250,000 CFA francs, she is going to purchase 10 bolts of cloth and 5 boxes of perfume for retail sale.

Using her profits, she will help her husband pay for her children’s education and health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and perfume for retail sale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia Gregoria; continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos y venta de cereales, la socai vende, maíz en todas las variedades, vende habas, frejol, arvebas, pallares, morayas, trigo, cebada, entre otros productos, la socia tiene su stand aún en el mismo mercado y en la seccion de granos, ella trabja 6 dias a la semana y con este ingreso ella ha terminado de cosntruir su vivienda, y apoyo en los estudios de sus hijos, La socia desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de granos y cerelaes al por mayor para implementar su stand.
texts.en:
The member, Gregoria, continues with her business selling dry beans and grains and cereals.  She sells corn of all varieties, broad beans, beans, peas, butter beans, "morayas" [dehydrated potatoes], wheat, and barley, among other products.

Gregoria still has her stand in the same market in the bean and grain section.  She works six days a week, and with this income she has finished building her house and helped pay for her children's studies.

Gregoria wants the loan to invest in buying grain and cereal wholesale to set up her stand.

loans.use: to buy grain, beans, and cereal wholesale to set up her stand.

loans.name: Adilia Del Socorro

texts.es: Adilia Del Socorro tiene 52 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Desde hace mas de 14 años que tiene de experiencia con este negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues ella tiene que salir a las comarcas a buscarlos pues ya tiene ciertos clientes que le han solicitado encargos. Tiene 6 hijos pero solamente 3 están bajo su cargo. Ella sueña con realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, pues debido a sus pocos ingresos no ha podido hacerlo.
texts.en: Adilia Del Socorro is 52 years old and sells pigs. She has more than 14 years experience doing this work. The reason for the loan is to buy pigs as she has to travel to the different regions to buy them and she already has certain clients who have placed orders. She has 6 children but she is responsible for only 3 of them. She dreams of making improvements to her house which has been impossible due to her low income.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hojas de laurel y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes y pollos, la socia lo vende las hojas de laurel y los animales en el distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de hojas de laurel y ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar hojas de laurel y comprar animales como chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Ana, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Ana is 52 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She alternated her daily chores with her retail activity, selling bay leaves, and her farming activity, breeding animal such as pigs, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and chickens. She sells the bay leaves and the animals in the Calca district, and thanks to this activity she provides for her children. She wants to expand her activity as a seller of bay leaves as well as her animal breeding activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy bay leaves and animals such as pigs, chickens and cuyes.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy bay leaves and animals such as pigs, chickens and cuyes to then sell them.

loans.name: Ndéye Ndoumbour

texts.fr:
Madame Ndéye Ndoumbour est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de 3 enfants .Elle membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2009 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité sope Malick.
Ndéye fait du petit commerce dans la vente de céréales ( mil et arachide).Avec son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs Cfa elle va acheter 10 tonnes de mil 40 sacs d arachides.
A l aide de ses bénéfices Ndéye va Aider mari dans la gestion de besoins scolaires des enfants et payer de la nourriture a ces derniers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndéye Ndoumbour is a 53-year-old married woman, mother of three children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 9 January 2009 and is part of the sope Malick solidarity group.

Ndéye is a small retail merchant trading in cereals (millet and peanuts). With her new loan of 500,000 CFA francs she will buy 10 tons of millet and 40 bags of peanuts.

With her profits Ndéye will help her husband manage the educational and food requirements of their children.

loans.use: buy millet and peanuts

loans.name: Berris

texts.en:
Berris is a married woman with no children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Berris has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because they help small-scale income earners by giving them capital to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gema Carolina

texts.es: Gema Carolina tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa. El objetivo del crédito abastecer de nuevos productos a sus clientes, ya que se acerca una muy buena temporada. Actualmente ya tiene varios encargos es por eso que está solicitando este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes, shorts y trajes para niños. Ella es una madre muy dedicada y abnegada tiene un hijo bajo su cargo al cual le proporciona lo necesario.
texts.en: Gema Carolina’s activity is selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to stock up her shop with new products to offer to her customers, as a very good selling season is about to begin. She currently has many requests already, and for this reason she is requesting a loan in order to invest it in the purchase of trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, shorts and suits for children. She is a very devoted and self-sacrificing mother: she has one child whom she provides with the basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, shorts and suits for children.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 51-year-old single man who owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Peter has operated a fruit-selling business for the past three years; his potential clients are the people who make fruit juices. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of expanding his business.

With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase more stocks of fruits for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fruits for resale.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Claudio; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, el prepara panes y luego lo reparte en las diferentes tiendas del distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de panadería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, manteca y azúcar para preparar el pan.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Claudio, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Claudio is 38 years old, he lives with his life partner and he has 2 children. He alternates his daily chores with his activity as a baker. He prepares bread and then distributes it to the different shops of the Calca district. Thanks to this activity he provides for his children. He wants to expand his bakery, and he is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, butter and sugar to prepare bread.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, butter and sugar to prepare bread.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Sophie est une femme marié âgée de 48 ans et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 05/03/2009.

Elle fait du petit commerce avec la vente de tissus et de lait caillé.

Madame dispose d une  bonne expérience dans son domaine pour y avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 300000 francs Cfa elle va acheter 5 rouleaux de tissus et du lait caillé qu'elle va revendre au détails.

Les bénéfices qu elle va faire lui permettront de résoudre ses petits besoins financiers tels que la scolarité de son enfant et l alimentation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sophie is a 48-year-old married woman, mother of one child. She is a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 5 March 2009.

She is a retail merchant selling clothing fabrics and milk curd, and has accumulated several years of experience in this field.

With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs she will buy five rolls of fabric and milk curd, and then retail her products.

Her foreseen profits will enable her to resolve her small financial needs such as paying tuition fees for her child and feeding her family.

loans.use: buy fabrics and milk curd

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: La socia Cirila; sigue con sus restaurante y preparando deliciosos potajes tipicos y caseros, a la socia desea tener un poco mas de ingresos y asi ampliar su negocio, la socia en esta ocasión desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos para la preparacion de los diferentes potajes, la socia tambien invertira en la compra de cubiertos y vajilla, ella mejorara los baños y desea poder ampliar el local para el proximo año. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir enla compra de vajillas, cubiertos y de productos la por mayor para implementar us negocio.
texts.en: Cirila continues running her restaurant and preparing delicious typical and homemade vegetable and pulse stews. She wants to earn some more money and expand her activity, and in this occasion she is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of ingredients to prepare the different vegetable and pulse stews. She will also invest it in the purchase of cutlery and dishware; she will improve the restrooms and next years she plans on expanding her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of dishware, cutlery and products at wholesale price to improve her activity.

loans.use: To buy dishware, cutlery and products at wholesale price to improve her activity.

loans.name: Ndiémé

texts.fr:
Ndiémé est une femme mariée mère de 6 enfants et âgée de 50 ans.

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité takku liguey.

Madame Ndiémé fait du commerce de détails dans la vente de produits divers tels que le riz le sucre l'huile thé etc depuis longtemps.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 300000 francs Cfa elle va acheter des sacs de riz de l'huile 2 sacs de sucre qu'elle va revendre au détail.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices Ndiémé va payer la scolarité de ses enfants et régler ses besoins financiers personnel.
texts.en: Ndiémé is a 50-year-old woman, married and mother of six children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 1 September 2008 and is part of the takku liguey solidarity group. For a long time Mrs. Ndiémé has been a retail merchant dealing with various products such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, tea, etc. With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs she will buy bags of rice, vegetable oil, and two bags of sugar she will then sell retail.. Using her profits Ndiémé will pay for her children's tuition and deal with her personal financial needs.

loans.use: buy rice, vegetable oil, sugar, tea, ...

loans.name: Manisha

texts.en:
Manisha is 21 years old. She is married and has one child, age 2. 

In 1998, she established her meat shop business. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy goats and chickens for her business. 

In the future, Manisha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with products and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: To buys chickens and goats.

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es: La señora Luz Mariela a sus 57 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 19 años. La señora Luz Mariela es una gran emprendedora quien en el año 2.006 decide iniciar su propio negocio en un local de su casa, el cual le permitiera salir adelante al haber quedado sola con la obligación de su hijo. La señora Luz Mariela trabaja sola en su tienda, todos los días en una jornada desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m. Esta actividad, la señora Luz Mariela la aprendió de su padre, quien tenía una tienda en la cual ella le ayudaba. La señora Luz Mariela desea comprar surtido para su negocio como arroz, aceite, panela, snakcs, café, papel higiénico, entre otros, que le permitan mejorar su servicio, aumentar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. A futuro la señora Luz Mariela desea tener un supermercado en el cual pueda generar muchos empleos directos.
texts.en:
Luz Mariela is 57 years old and is the mother of a 19 year old child. Luz Mariela is a great entrepreneur who in 2006 decided to open her own home based business which permitted her to get ahead as she has been left alone to raise her child.

Luz Mariela works alone in her store, every day from 6:00AM until 9:00PM. She learned this business from her father who had a store in which she helped him.

Luz Mariela wants to buy supplies for her business such as rice, oil, panela [a sweetener that tastes similar to brown sugar, and is usually in a solid block], snacks, coffee, toilet paper and other items, that allow her to improve her service, expand her sales and thus improve the quality of her family life.

In the future Luz Mariela wants to have a mini-market in which she can create many direct jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera. 

Celina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella ha estudiado técnico en farmacia en uno de los mejores institutos de la ciudad del Cusco y vio la oportunidad de abrir una botica en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene una pequeña botica donde vende diferentes medicamentos, perfumes, cremas, jarabes, pañales, leche martena, vitaminas y otras cosas. Ya son 11 meses que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Celina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo medicamentos, pastillas, jarabes y otras cosas más. 

Celina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Celina pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Celina was born in the city of Ollantaytambo but currently lives in the city of Urubamba. She is 24 years old and is single.

She conducts her daily financial activities in the city of Urubamba. She has gone into pharmacy technician studies in one of the best institutes of the city of Cusco and she saw the opportunity to open a pharmacy in the town of Urubamba. 

She has a small pharmacy where she sells different medicines, perfumes, creams, syrups, diapers, baby formula, vitamins and other things. She has been doing this for 11 months and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Celina is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as medicines, pills, syrups and other items.

Celina is grateful for the opportunity given by this loan and at the same time she promises to make her payment in accordance with the schedule. Celina belongs to the communal bank Señor de Choquekillca of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as medicines, pills, syrups and other items

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florencia; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz, ella también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas ella los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar chicha como maíz y jora y también comprar alimentos para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Florencia, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Florencia is 39 years old, she is married and she has 1 child. She alternates her daily chores with her retail activity, selling chicha, a maize-derived fermented beverage. She also engages in breeding animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and chicken: she fattens them, breeds them and then she sells them in the Calca district. Thanks to these activities she provides for her child. She wants to expand and improve her chicha selling activity and her animal breeding activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare chicha such as maize and “jora” (maize specially prepared for making high-grade chicha) as well as to buy animal feed for her animals.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare chicha such as maize and “jora” (maize specially prepared for making high-grade chicha) as well as to buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Addlaid

texts.en:
Addlaid is a 27 years old, married woman with one child who is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Addlaid has operated a food stall for the past year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of customers failing to pay their bills on time. She dreams of establishing a clothes selling business.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of secondhand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improving her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marame-Fall

texts.fr:
Marame-fall est une femme mariée âgée de 59 ans et mère de 3 enfants , elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 01/09/2008 ou elle a de bonnes relations avec ses camarades. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick.

Elle fait du petit commerce dans la vente d'arachides et des fruits saisonniers.
Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 400000 franc Cfa elle va acheter des arachides et des paniers de fruits destinés à la revente.

Les bénéfices qu'elle va réaliser lui permettront de payer du riz du lait du sucre pour ses enfants à la fin de chaque mois mais également de payer leurs fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
Marama-fall is a 59-year-old married woman, mother of three. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 1 September 2008 and entertains good relations with the other members. She is part of the Sope Malick solidarity group.

She is a retail merchant dealing in peanuts and seasonal fruits, with good experience in her field of activity.

With her new loan of 400,000 CFA francs she will buy peanuts and fruit baskets intended for retail sales.

The profits she will achieve will enable her to pay for rice, milk, and sugar for her children on a monthly basis, but also to pay for their school supplies.

loans.use: buy peanuts and fruit to retail

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a 35-year-old married man with five children, three of whom attend school while the other two are still young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Suleiman has operated a retail shop for the past ten years; his potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar, and soap for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Séwrou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Séwrou est âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de un an. Il évolue dans le secteur
de la pêche  depuis 10 ans. C’est une activité qu’il a hérité de son père. Mais il est très intéressé par l’aspect lucratif de l’activité ce  qui lui permet d’assurer la survie de sa famille. Il est sociétaire  du guichet de la localité ou il habite depuis septembre 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 prévu pour l’agrandissement de sa pirogue. Ce financement pourra donc  l’aider  a accroitre ses recettes et  améliorer le bien être  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Séwrou is 30 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old child. He has been working in the fishing industry for 10 years. He inherited this business activity from his father. He is particularly interested in the lucrative aspect of the business, on which his family survives. 
 
Monsieur Séwrou has been a member of the local branch of UIMCEC since September 2010. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 XOF to enlarge his canoe.  This funding could help him to increase his income and improve the well being of his family.

loans.use: to enlarge his canoe.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 30 años D. edad, es casada con tres hijos.

Ella tiene 13 años D. experiencia en las ventas, empezó vendiendo anonas, ejotes, pipianes, etc. La fruta que estuviera D. temporada. Hace 7 años comenzó a vender y comprar ropa, además Ana destaza vacas y cerdos desD. hace 4 años y venD. la carne y hueso. Ana antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios D. su casa y decidió trabajar en el comercio debido a la necesidad, cuando se caso los gastos aumentaron por lo que ella tomo la iniciativa D. contribuir a solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ana compra la ropa en una ciudad del oriente del país, para llegar ahí ella camina a pie durante cuarenta y cinco minutos, luego aborda un autobús durante otros cuarenta y cinco minutos, al llegar realiza sus compras. Para la comprar las vacas y los cerdos, ella se los compra a las personas que venden los animales para este negocio, cuando destaza Ana se levanta a las 3:00 a.m. para realizar todas las actividades y vender la carne en su comunidad y en los alrededores.

Ana solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 cerdos, 1 vaca para destazo y el resto en la compra D. ropa, ya que esta época es muy buena para la venta D. ropa y por eso necesita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio. Con esto ella surtirá su negocio y podrá obtener el sustento diario para su familia y brindarles la educación a sus hijos, para que se les sea un poco más fácil enfrentarse a  la vida y no les cueste tanto como a ellos. 

Ana desea continuar trabajando muy fuerte, para el estudio D. sus hijos y luchara día con día para lograr ese objetivo y a la vez le piD. a Dios salud y que le conceda muchos años más D. vida, para no dejar a sus hijos pequeños, por que lo que más desea es verlos con un titulo universitario y si es posible casados.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old, married, and has three children.

Ana has 13 years experience in selling products.  She started out selling pineapples, corn, squashes, etc - whatever was in season.  Seven years ago she started buying and selling clothes.  In addition, Ana has been slaughtering cows and pigs and selling the meat and bone for four years.  Before this, Ana used to devote herself to looking after her house but she decided to start working in sales out of necessity.  When she got married her expenses increased and so she took the initiative and started contributing towards covering the household expenses.

Ana buys clothing in a city in the east of the country.  To get there she walks for forty-five minutes, catches a bus for another forty-five minutes and then goes and makes her purchases.  She buys her cows and pigs from people who sell animals for this business.  When Ana has animals to slaughter, she gets up at 3.00am so that she can carry out all her work and sell the meat in her community and neighboring areas.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy two pigs and one cow to slaughter.  She will use the rest of her money to buy clothing as this is a very good season for selling clothes and so she needs a loan to invest in her business.  In this way, she will stock her business and will be able to proviD. for her family.  She will be able to proviD. her children with an education so that they can face life a little more easily and things will not be as hard for them as they were for her.

Ana would like to continue working very hard to proviD. her children with an education and she will work every day to achieve this goal.  She asks God for good health and hopes that he gives her many more years of life so that she doesn't have to leave her young children because what she most wants is to see them with a university degree and married if possible.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and one cow to slaughter, and to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eulogio; el tiene 62 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el socio vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y galletas, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar leche, azúcar, arroz, fideos y galletas al por mayor para implementar la tienda de abarrotes. 

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Eulogio, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Eulogio is 62 years old, he is married and he has 3 children. He alternates his daily chores with his activity, running a grocery store. He sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and biscuits. He works from 6 am to 10 pm and thanks to this activity he provides for his children. He wants to expand and improve his grocery store, and he is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles and biscuits at wholesale price to improve his grocery store.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles and biscuits at wholesale price.

loans.name: Betty

texts.fr:
Betty est mariée et mère de 5 enfants.

Elle est âgée de 69 ans, elle membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité sope Serigne Babacar.

Madame Betty fait du petit commerce dans la vente de fruits dont elle dispose une bonne expérience.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 250000 francs Cfa elle va acheter des paniers d'oranges et de mandarines et des pastèques qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.

Grâce à ses bénéfices Betty va subvenir aux besoins familiaux tels que la scolarité des enfants et leur alimentation.
texts.en:
Betty is married and has five children. She is 69 years old and has been a member of her local credit association since 1/09/2008; she is part of the Serigne Babacar solidarity group. Madame Betty sells fruit for a living and is successful in her work. With a loan of 250,000 Francs (CFA) she will purchase baskets of oranges and mandarines and watermelons which she will sell at retail in her local quarter. 
Thanks to the profits that she will generate, Betty will be able to see to her family's needs, such as her children's schooling and food.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Krisha Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 56 years old. She is married and has two children ages 36 and 27. 

In 1995, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. 

In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Marcia Leonor

texts.es: Marcia Leonor tiene 39 años, ella es comerciante de productos varios. Tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo siempre ha sido una mujer responsable y dedicada. Ella está solicitando este crédito que será destinado para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, piedrín, cemento, arena, alambre, hierro y zinc  ella necesita realizar una construccion de una pared en la parte trasera de su vivienda para tener mayor seguridad. Desde hace cuatro años estaba pensando en realizar estas mejoras pero como no tenia los ingresos necesarios no había podido hacerlo, espera que con este crédito pueda realizar su sueño.
texts.en: Marcia Leonor is 39 years old, and she is a retailer selling different products. She has 2 children she is responsible for and she has always been a devoted and responsible woman. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of construction materials such as blocks, piedrín (a type of building stone), cement, sand, iron and zinc. She will build a wall in the back part of her home so as to make it safer. She has been planning to make these improvements for four years but she was not able to do it because she hadn’t enough money. She hopes she will be able to make her dream come true thanks to this loan.

loans.use: To buy blocks, piedrín (a type of building stone), cement, sand, iron and zinc.

loans.name: Soboulde/bamtare Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bamtaré a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 13 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame  Khadiyatou (assise à l’extrême droite de la photo et le bras levé) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de riz, de l’huile, du savon, du thé, sucre et autres produits divers qu’elle achète  à travers les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre dans son village. Activité qu’elle exerce de puis plusieurs années.

Son prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner en ces produits qu’elle commercialise.

Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille par le fait de soutenir de son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Bamtaré group was formed on 17th May 2011 after a local credit bank was established. It is made up of 13 women who all live in the same village. They all sell various goods for a living. 

Madame  Khadiyatou (sitting at the far right of the photo with her arm raised) is the group leader. She is 26 years old and is married with five children. 

She sells rice, oil, soap, tea, sugar and other mixed goods; she buys them at weekly markets and re-sells them in her village. She has been involved in this line of work for a number of years. 

Her loan will enable her to purchase greater volumes of these goods. 

The profits that she generates will enable her to improve her family's living conditions by helping her to support her husband.

loans.use: to purchase goods for re-sale

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ysmael; el tiene 40 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de engorde de ganado, el hace engordar a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de engorde de ganados. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los ganados.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This client is a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Ysmael is 40 years old, he is married and he has 6 children. He alternates his daily chores with his livestock breeding activity: he fattens the animals and then he sells them in the different fairs of the Calca district. Thanks to this activity he provides for his children. He wants to expand his livestock fattening activity, and he is requesting a loan to buy animal feed and medicine for the animals.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and medicine for the animals.

loans.name: Nassiri

texts.en:
Nassiri is a 33-year-old married man with eight children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the rest are still young for school. His wife Mwanapili is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Nassiri has operated a bicycle spare parts selling business for the past seven years; his potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase more stocks of spare parts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Soboulde/jokker Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Joker Endam a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 15 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.
