Madame Rougui est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle a aussi à sa charge deux autres membres de sa famille.

Elle vend du riz, du lait et du savon. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son crédit va lui permettre d’acheter du riz, du lait et du savon pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte appuyer son mari dans les charges domestiques.
texts.en:
The group Joker Endam was created on May 17, 2011 at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of 15 women who all live in the same village and practice small trade.

Mrs. Rougui is the head of the group. She is 61 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also looks after two other family members.

Mrs. Rougui sells rice, milk and soap, an activity that she has been practicing for several years.

Her loan will allow her to buy rice, milk and soap for resale, and she will use the profits to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk and soap for resale

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: Ángel, de 58 años, es una hombre bueno y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores e independientes, solo el último tiene 20 años y vive con él. Además de su hijo comparte su vida con su pareja y su nieto a quienes a diario brinda lo mejor en su casa que pudo obtener con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Ángel consiste en la construcción de viviendas, pero su especialidad es el de construir galpones de pollos, corrales de cerdos y granjas, además de la construcción, también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, esta actividad lo realiza a lado de su esposa. Mientras que el de la construcción lo hace a lado de algunos obreros que contrata, lleva trabajando con este negocio por 14 años y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por mas tiempo. Le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad ya que gana bien, le permite tener tiempo para algunas otras actividades y le da la estabilidad que necesita para tener una vida tranquila, invierte en personal y algunos materiales y gana un promedio de 35% de su inversión, tiene como objetivos el de ampliar sus galpones y así criar sus aves en mayor cantidad. Este será el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, además está muy comprometido en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará pollitos para iniciar con la crianza, además de mejorar sus galpones y comprar alimentos balanceados, además de esto también comprará materiales y herramientas para poder segur haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ángel is 58 years old and a good, friendly man. He lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has five children. Four of their children are grown and independent. Only the youngest, who is 20 years old, lives with Ángel. Besides his son, Ángel shares his life with his wife and grandson, who he tries very hard to give the best he can.

Ángel's job is home construction, but his specialty is building chicken coops, pig pens and other farm enclosures. Besides construction, he also raises poultry, an activity he does alongside his wife. When he is doing construction, he works alongside some workers that he contracts. He has been running his business for 14 years and hopes to be able to continue doing it for a long time more. He enjoys his work a great deal because it earns good money,  allows him to have time for other activities, and gives him the stability he needs to have a tranquil life. He invests in personnel and some materials, and earns an average 35% on his investment.

His goal is to expand his coops and to raise more birds. This will be his seventh credit with MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have this financial support, as it makes him feel confident that he will be able to advance his business. He is also very committed to repaying his loan, as he has done with the prior loans he took out. With the amount requested, 2,500 nuevos soles, he will buy chicks to start raising, will improve his coops, and will purchase a balanced diet for his birds. He will also buy materials and tools to be able to continue his construction business.

loans.use: to buy chicks, materials to improve his chicken coop, and tools for his construction business

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr:
Abiba est une femme  âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 08ans et le dernier 03ans.
Abiba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend dans une boutique à domicile après achat à Lomé.
Abiba a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut agrandir l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Abiba voudrait diversifier sa marchandise. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Abiba is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a military man. She has three children who are all in school. The eldest is eight and the youngest three years old.

Abiba has been working as a vendor since 2008. She sells from a store in her home after purchasing her products in Lomé.

Abiba requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise. She wants to expand her business.

In the coming years, Abiba would like to diversify her merchandise. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de herramientas para la agricultura como palas, picos y mangueras, ella vende en forma independiente desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de herramientas para la agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para la agricultura al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Cirila, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Cirila is 36 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her retailing activity, selling farming supplies such as spades, pickaxes and hosepipes. She is an independent seller and she works form 9 am to 5 pm; thanks to this activity she provides for her children. She wants to expand and improve her retailing activity as a seller of farming supplies, and she is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies at wholesale prices.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with seven children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanapili has operated a fish selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stocks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Las Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS YUNGUEÑITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yessica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: servicios, comercio, iniciación de negocios y producción de comida. 

La señora Yessica  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella iniciará un negocio de de ventas de licores con este préstamo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para comprar su mercadería (compra de licores), que adquirirá de El Alto y posterior lo comercializara en un lugar de venta que a alquilado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “LAS YUNGUEÑITAS” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer working with the Juan Pablo Center. It is composed of six members and it is directed by a direction board led by Yessica. The members of the Communal Association engage in different activities such as services, retail, new businesses and food production.

Yessica says it is the first time she has entered in Pro Mujer, and that she has been invited by the loan officers. She will start a liquor store with this loan.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy her products (spirits) in El Alto after they have been prepared; she will then sell them in her shop. As she is single, this type of activity allows her to earn an income to support her family as much as she can.

loans.use: To buy spirits.

loans.name: Lizet Fabiana

texts.es: La Sra. Lizet  es soltera vive en la zona del Abasto en una casa en anticrético la cual el anticrético es de su madre. Trabaja vendiendo ropa durante el día  y estudia por las noches,  vende ropa ambulando por los mercados y fines de semana viaja a los diferentes lugares aledaños a la ciudad de Santa Cruz donde se realizan ferias para poder vender sus productos de manera ambulante,  también aprovecha los días feriados cuando no tiene clases,  Lizet tiene 21 años sus ventas que realiza son de ropa nueva,  es una persona que como pilar fundamental lo tiene el estudio y el trabajo, se sacrifica mucho ya que con esta actividad  de la venta de ropa corre con sus gastos de estudio y de manutención, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería al por mayor de ropa para vender estas fiestas de fin de año, ya que es donde mas venta tiene y por ende mas ingresos para incrementar su capital de trabajo,   vende desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, es responsable y tiene ganas de superación día a día, su deseo es el de terminar sus estudios y de ejercer su profesión, de esta manera de poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ms. Lizet is single and lives in an anticrético in the Abasto zone. [An "anticrético" is a kind of lease-purchase tenancy arrangement common in Bolivia.] The anticrético is her mother's. Lizet works selling clothing during the day and studies at night. She sells clothing on foot through the markets, and on weekends she travels to fairs held in various places around the city of Santa Cruz. She does this in order to sell her products in an ambulatory manner. She also takes advantage of holidays when she does not have class. Lizet is 21 years old and the clothing she sells is new. She is a person whose fundamental pillars are education and work. She sacrifices a lot, as she pays for her studies and supports herself by selling clothing. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise wholesale, which she will sell during the end-of-year holidays. This is when she makes the most sales and is therefore able to bring in more income to increase her working capital. She starts selling at a very early hour of the morning, is responsible, and has the desire to improve her lot day by day. Her hope is to finish her studies and to work in the profession she is studying, so that she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new clothing wholesale, which she will sell for the end-of-year holidays

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de carpintería ella juntamente con su esposo trabajan en el taller de carpintería haciendo trabajos como mesas, sillas y puertas, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y pegamentos para el negocio de carpintería. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Julia, a member of the “Llancasun de Arin” Communal Bank, which is located in Calca, a district of the Calca province in the Cusco department.

Julia is 40 years old, she is married and she has 1 child. She alternates her daily chores with her job in the carpenter's shop where she works together with her husband. They create objects such as tables, chairs and doors. Thanks to this small activity she provides for her child. She wants to expand their carpentry activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy wood and adhesives for the workshop.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy wood and adhesives for her carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Esperanza Adelina

texts.es: Esperanza Adelina tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida. Inicio este negocio desde muy joven como una alternativa de empleo para su familia. La mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, huevos, leche, fideos, refrescos, jugos, pan y golosinas. Desea ampliar cada día más su local para mejorar su inventario.
texts.en: Esperanza Adelina has a grocery store which she has been running for 12 years to earn a living.  She began it when she was young as a work alternative for her family.  Most of her customers are friends, neighbors and relatives.  The loan will be used to buy basic grains, eggs, milk, noodles, softdrinks, juices, bread and sweets.  She wants to keep adding products to improve her stock.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, eggs, milk, noodles, softdrinks, juices, bread and sweets.

loans.name: Diongoma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diongama  a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou. Il est composé de  22  femmes qui vivent dans le même quartier. Elles ont toutes comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame khady (debout à l’extrême droit emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants

Elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes au marché central de sa ville. Elle a une expérience très avancée dans ce domaine pour y avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en légumes auprès des villages pour la revente au marché.

Elle compte assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Diongama group was formed on November 15, 2006 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" of Kambeng Doumassou. It consists of 22 women who live in the same neighborhood. They each manage small shops. 

Khady (standing to the far right wrapped in a white scarf) is in charge of the group. She is 51-years-old. She is married and mother to five children. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at the central market of her town. She is very experienced in this field because she has worked in it for several years. 

With this new loan she plans to stock up on vegetables from the towns for reselling at the market. 

She plans to ensure the care of her children.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables from the towns for reselling at the market

loans.name: Lilia Ines

texts.es: La señora Lilia a sus 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía relacionada con productos y accesorios femeninos para el arreglo personal. La señora Lilia se ha dedicado a este oficio por muchos años de su vida, con esta actividad ha podido llevar los gastos propios y los de dos nietas que tiene a su cargo, ya que la señora Lilia no cuenta con el apoyo de ninguno de sus 4 hijos.  La señora Lilia desea comprar mercancía relacionada con productos de navidad, con el fin de que su pequeño negocio este más surtido y acorde a la época de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Lilia podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma aumentar la calidad de vida de ella y sus dos nietas. El sueño de la señora Lilia es tener su propio almacén y salir adelante luego de haber sufrido un preinfarto que le ocasionó la perdida del 60 % (porciento) del habla.
texts.en: Mrs. Lilia is 56 years old and sells all kinds of women's accessories and personal care products.  She has been in business for several years and it has allowed her to cover her own expenses as well as those of her two granddaughters who she cares for.  Lilia receives no support from any of her four children.  Lilia wants to buy products related to Christmas so her small business is better stocked for the New Year season.  This will help increase her income and improve her and her granddaughters' quality of life.  Lilia's goal is to have her own shop and get ahead after having suffered a stroke that caused a loss of 60% of her speaking ability.

loans.use: To buy Christmas related products.

loans.name: Kaja Group

texts.en:
Prisca, who is in her late twenties, is single. She has been running a vegetable selling business for one year now. She works from 6 a.m. to  9 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to to increase her business stock and has successfully paid back her loan.  She wants a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a wholesale shop selling things like sugar, wheat flour, and baking flour.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kaja" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cebollas, zanahorias y maíz y luego lo vende en el mercado de Calca desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de  agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LLANCASUN DE ARIN", which is located in the district of Calca, in Calca Province, in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Sabina is 27 years old and has a common-law husband and three children.  In addition to her daily activities she also has a patch of land where she grows onions, carrots and corn which she sells at the market in Calca.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and is able to provide for her children through her work.  She wants to increase her agriculture business and has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cropland.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona tranquila, optimista y con muchos valores. Miguel tiene 3 hijos, vive en San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi al Norte de Ecuador.

Miguel trabaja en la fabricación de puertas de madera, este negocio el empezó hace 15 años, trabajaba por pedidos y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, este negocio es aquel que le da el sustento para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y de el, es por eso que realiza el sexto crédito en Fodemi ya que es una persona emprendedora y quiere que su negocio siga creciendo porque al igual sus ingresos serán mejores.

Su sueño es poder contruir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a calm, optimistic person with high values.  He has three children and lives in San Gabriel in the province of Carchi in northern Ecuador.

Miguel makes wood doors for a living and started the business 15 years ago.  He works on an order basis and little by little has been able to grow his business, which is his source of income to cover his family's needs.  This is his sixth loan through Fodemi, as he is very enterprising and wants his business to continue growing so he can increase his income.

His dream is to be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy wood and materials such as varnish, paint and other items to continue making doors.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero actualmente ella vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. 

Genoveva desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, pan, gaseosas, refrescos, gelatinas, y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Genoveva requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería por mayor pues le sale más barato, ella desea abastecer la tienda comprando sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche y otras cosas más. 

Genoveva se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Genoveva pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Genoveva was born in the city of Quillabamba but now lives in the city of Urubamba.  She is 41 years old, married and has two children.

She carries out her daily activities and runs her business in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She has a grocery store and sells all kinds of essential items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, bread, sodas, softdrinks, gelatin and other goods.  She has been in business several years, which thanks to her hard work, is going well.

Genoveva needs a loan to buy goods wholesale so they will be less expensive.  She wants to stock her store with sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, cases of milk and other items.

She is very grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Choquekillca" which belongs to the Arariwa Association in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, cases of milk and other items.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene su actividad que es la compra y venta de ganado. Desde hace mas de 15 años que tiene este medio de vida. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta a diario como son el precio del ganado que va en aumento cada día. El motivo del crédito que realiza es destinado para la compra de vacas, chivos y toros. Pues actualmente tiene una muy buena oferta que quiere aprovechar, el siempre ha sido una persona dedicada y con muchas responsabilidades en su familia. Tiene un hijo de 18 años que le enseña a ganarse el pan de cada día y que el como padre le brinda la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en: Pedro has a business buying and selling livestock. He has supported himself this way for more than 15 years, in spite of the challenges he confronts each day, such as the the price of livestock which is rising day by day. The reason for the loan he is taking out is to buy cows, bulls and goats, because he currently has a very good opportunity to buy and he would like to take advantage of it. He has always been a very dedicated person who takes on many responsibilities within his family. He has an 18-year-old son whom he is teaching to earn his daily bread, and for whom he is providing the necessary support as a father.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls and goats.

loans.name: Decio

texts.es: Decio, de 32 años, es una joven amable, es soltera, pero no tiene hijos y todos los días sueña con poder surgir, salir adelante y poder brindar todo lo necesario para tener una buena calidad de vida a sus padres con quienes vive en casa propia. El trabajo de Decio, consiste en varias actividades, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ahí mismo funciona su disco bar, en donde ofrece a sus clientes buena música, bebidas heladas y aperitivos. Pero el fin de semana, por las noches vende comida en su casa. Por otro lado, también hace trabajos de corte de cabello y peinados para sus clientes. Todas estas actividades los hace sola y en un local muy bien acondicionado en su casa. Trabaja con mucha tenacidad desde hace cinco años. Tiene muchos planes en mente, pero por el momento solo desea mantener sus negocios. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contento de saber que le volverán a dar la confianza para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo, esta muy comprometida de cumplir con sus pagos de cuotas así como pago en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy buenos y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará bebidas para ampliar la variedad de productos que tiene, asimismo comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda, así como materiales para su peluquería e ingredientes para seguir preparando comida.
texts.en: Decio, age 32, is a very friendly and good woman. She is single and has no children. Every day she dreams about getting ahead and being able to provide everything necessary for a good quality of life to her parents, with whom she lives in their own house. Decio's work consists of various activities. She has a grocery store where she sells basic daily necessities. In the same place, she operates a disco bar, where she offers her clients good music, cold drinks and cocktails. On weekends in the evening, she sells food at his home. At the same time, she also offers haircuts and hairstyling services to her customers. She does all of these activities alone and in a very well-equipped space in her home. She has worked with great tenacity for five years. She has many plans in mind, but at present all she wants is to maintain her businesses. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that they will once again place confidence in her so she can increase her working capital. She is very committed to making her payments, just as she paid off her previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are very good and show solidarity. With the amount she has requested, 2500 Peruvian soles, she will buy beverages to broaden the variety of products she offers, and she will also buy basic staple goods for her store, as well as materials for her hair salon and ingredients to continue preparing food.

loans.use: to buy daily staple goods, beverages, materials for his hair salon and supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Aldifooty Group

texts.fr:
Aldi footy est un groupe créé le 12 octobre 2010 à l’inauguration de leur Banc villageois Dialicounda Naforé. Il est composé de  16 femmes qui ont une bonne entente. Elles ont le petit commerce comme activité principale.

Madame Aida  (assise à l’extrême droit de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle  est mariée et mère de trois enfants.

Elle vend de la patte d’arachide et de l’huile de palm au marché de son quartier. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l’avoir pratique pendant au moins cinq ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de la patte d’arachide pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices tirés de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Aldifooty group was created on the 12th of October 2010, on the inauguration day of their "banc villageois" Dialicounda Naforé. The group is made up of 16 women, who all get along well together and are all involved in small retail.

Aida, sitting on the far right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She sells peanut butter and palm oil at her local market. She is an experienced saleswoman with over 5 years experience in this area.

This loan will allow Aida to restock on peanut butter for resale. She plans to use the profits from her business to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Eugenia Basilia

texts.es: La señora Eugenia es cliente antigua ya viene trabajando con nuestra institución desde el año 2004, en un grupo solidario hámster que integraban entre tres personas desde hace mas de un año se individualizaron dos de los integrantes, la señora Eugenia vive en la zona de Alto Seguencoma en la casa de sus suegros, su familia esta integrada de sus cuatro hijos tres en edad escolar y su esposo que se dedica al transporte publico como y la señora Eugenia vende electrodomésticos a crédito por su zona y otras zonas aledañas, en este momento solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería electrodomésticos al por mayor por época  navideña ya que cada fin de año lo hace para incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Eugenia es un apersona muy trabajadora, con deseos de superación, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenia is an old client that has been working with the communal bank since 2004 in a solidarity group that has three members for more than a year called Hamster named by two of the members. 

Eugenia lives in the are of Alto Seguencoma in her in-laws house. The family has 4 children, three who are school age and her husband works in public transport. 

Eugenia sells household electrical appliances on credit in her neighborhood and surrounding areas. Currently she is asking for a loan to buy appliances at wholesale for the Christmas season as each end of the year she does it in order to increase her working capital. 

Eugenia is a hard working person, eager to get ahead, whose dream is to see her children become professionals and to be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy household electrical appliances at wholesale prices for the Christmas season

loans.name: Santos Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella desD. muy pequeña se ha dedicado a tejer hamacas, fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron. Todos los días Santos elabora hamacas y por las tardes ella venD. pan y tamales, para obtener ingresos para su familia.

Santos compra los materiales para elaborar las hamacas, como el hilo y los manguillos, cada 15 días en un pueblo cercano a su casa que esta a una hora y lo hace en compañía D. su hijo menor.

La señora Santos solicita el préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra D. mil tejas y 1000 varas D. tuza, para el techo y las paredes D. su vivienda. Así Santos mejorara su casa que con tanto esfuerzo la ha construido con la venta D. las hamacas. Su casa no toda tiene teja y las varas D. tuza que tiene ya no le sirven. En un futuro ella desea construir una casa D. ladrillo, por eso ahorrara D. los ingresos que reciba D. la venta D. sus hamacas.
texts.en: Santos is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Santos has been weaving hammocks since she was very young. Her parents taught her to do this work. Every day, Santos makes hammocks and, in the afternoons, she sells bread and tamales to make income for her family. Santos buys her materials for making hammocks, such as thread and straps, every two weeks in a village near her home which is one hour away. She makes the trip together with her younger son. Santos is requesting this loan to invest in buying 1,000 tiles and 1,000 tusa canes for the roof and walls of her home. In this way, Santos will improve her home which she built through a lot of hard work making and selling hammocks. Not all of her home has a roof and the canes that she has are no longer any good. In the future, she would like to build a house from bricks. For this, she will save up the income that she makes from her hammock business.

loans.use: to buy 1000 tiles and 1000 tusa canes for the roof and walls of her house

loans.name: Yoelin

texts.es: Yoelin, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltera, actualmente vive con su padres y hermanos. Ella con el crédito va comprar una computadora para uso personal y realizar trabajos de la universidad. Ella actualmente está estudiando y conoce sobre el buen manejo y adecuado de estos instrumentos, por lo cual comprara una para facilitar sus trabajos de universidad. Ella tiene como meta poder sacarle el mayor provecho a su computadora para salir adelante con su carrera y así hacer más fácil sus tareas correspondientes. Ella querer ser una profesional y ayudarle a sus padres con la responsabilidades del hogar por lo cual quiere hacer más rápido y eficaz su estudio con esta nueva herramienta que va comprar.. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yoelin, is 20 years old and single. She currently lives with her parents and siblings. With the loan, she will buy a computer for personal use and to do her work at the university. She is currently studying, and she knows how to use and take care of these technology tools, so she will buy one to facilitate her university work. Her goal is to take advantage of her computer to help her move ahead with her degree program and complete her assignments more easily. She wants to be a professional and help her parents with the household responsibilities, and for that reason she wants to make her studies go more quickly and efficiently with this new tool she will buy. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in the past from government banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Aliloho

texts.fr:
Aliloho est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur  de taxi moto et a 02 enfants.
Aliloho travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2006. Elle a un salon de coiffure pour répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle vend  des mèches qu’elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Aliloho a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réaménager son salon comme les fêtes de fin d’année s’approche pour attirer plus de monde.
Dans les prochaines années, Aliloho voudrait  se perfectionner dans la coiffure pour devenir une coiffeuse de renom. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit aider son conjoint dans les taches ménagères et voir ses enfants réussir.
texts.en:
Aliloho is 29 years old and is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. The couple have 2 children. Aliloho has been working as a hairdresser since 2006 and owns a hair salon. In order to fulfill her customer´s needs and wishes, she also sells them hair extensions that she buys at the Grand Market of Lomé.

Aliloho is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions. She plans to refurbish her hair salon in order to attract more customers during the end of year holiday season.

Over the next few years, Aliloho would like to perfect her hairdressing skills and build up a good reputation. She plans to use her profits to help her husband with the household expenses and give their children a foundation for a successful future.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Inés; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas y el negocio de verduras lo realiza llevando a lugares como Machupicchu por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, gallinas y chanchos y también para comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos, lechugas y tomates.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

This is Mrs. Inés. She is 52, widowed, and has three children. She divides her time between her housework and her vegetable business. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens. To sell vegetables, she travels to places such as Machu Picchu. This is how she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve both of her businesses. She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and also for buying vegetables such as onions, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce, and tomatoes.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay the quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and chickens, as well as vegetables such as onions, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce and tomatoes.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
CONFIANCE est un regroupement de sept femmes mariées qui  ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans,   3 enfants et qui  vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KADI  la première à droite, fait le commerce de  condiments dans ce groupe de femmes CONFIANCE. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 3cartons de cube maggie, 25kg de sel gemme, 100kg d’oignons, 3 paniers de houx frais, 4paniers de tomates fraiches, 2 paniers d’ aubergines au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Confiance is a group of seven women, who average 37 years of age with three children each; the majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their fourteenth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Kadi, on the far right, sells condiments in the Confiance group of women. With her loan she is planning to buy three cartons of Maggi stock cubes, 25 kg of rock salt, 10kg of onions, three baskets of fresh holly, four baskets of fresh tomatoes and two baskets of egg-plants at Sikasso's Grand Market and in surrounding villages. She resells at Sikasso's Grand Market, at a fixed place, and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,500FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, cebada, moraya y papa, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos como cebada, trigo, moraya y papa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. This bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

This is Mrs. Marina. She is 37, single, and has two children. She divides her time between her housework and her business selling goods such as barley, wheat, moraya [freeze-dried potato] and potato. She sells in the Urubamba market and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Through this business, she is able to get her children ahead. She wants to expand her business. She is requesting this loan for the wholesale purchase of goods such as barley, wheat, moraya [freeze-dried potato] and potato.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy goods such as barley, wheat, moraya [freeze-dried potato] and potato wholesale.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur de CD et en même temps conducteur de taxi moto. Elle a 04 enfants.
Akossiwa travaille comme couturière à domicile depuis 2007. Elle vend aussi des tissus . Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé.
Akossiwa a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises(tissus) afin de répondre  à la demande des clients en cette période de fête.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 39 years old and married to a CD reseller, who is also a motorcycle taxi driver. The couple have 4 children.

Akossiwa has been working at home as a seamstress since 2007, and she also sells fabrics. She gets her supplies in Lomé and is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on fabric, so that she can better respond to customer demand during the end of year holiday season.

loans.use: to restock on fabric.

loans.name: Gardenia Edelmira

texts.es:
Gardenia de 39 de años, trabajo vendiendo comida porque era una buena cocinera y por necesidad de trabajar.

Trabaja todos los días y por lo general trabaja de 10 de la mañana y termina por la noche sin hora específica.

La dificultad del trabajo es la delincuencia ya que el sector en el que vive es muy peligroso. No está casada pero tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en instituciones fiscales.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa para poder vivir tranquilamente con sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Gardenia, age 39, works selling food because she is a good cook and needs to work.

She normally works every day, starting at 10:00 am and ending at different times every night.

Crime is a challenge for her business, because her neighbourhood is very dangerous. She is unmarried but has two children who are currently in public school.

Her goal is to finish building her home in order to live peacefully with her two children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DANAYA sont de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KAMBA   qui est assise au milieu, mène les activité d’achat – vente de  pagnes wax à travers ce groupe de femmes DANAYA, il ya environ 8ans. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, de 4 balles de pagnes wax au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso et souvent à Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Danaya group are married women, who average 36 years of age with an average of three children each; the majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their tenth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Kamba, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, has been buying and selling "pagnes wax" (highly decorative and colourful pieces of fabric) through the Danaya women's group for about eight years. With her loan she is planning to buy four bales of "pagnes wax" at Sikasso's Grand Market (she often buys in Bamako as well) and she resells walking around the same market, as well as within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to satisfy customer demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy  "pagnes wax"

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Angamos Group

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio la Sra. Giovanna junto a su esposo han logrado comprar  su propio carro, durante muchos años su esposo se dedica al transporte público y manejaba carros de otras personas lo cual no le dejaba muchos ingresos además de ser muy sacrificado, ahora es diferente porque siendo su propia unidad las ganancias son mejores, la Sra. Giovanna es quien administra el carro está pendiente de todo lo necesario para el buen funcionamiento, por otro lado ella también se dedica a la limpieza de casas y departamentos cuenta con clientes fijos a quienes les realiza el servicio algunos días de semana, estos ingresos son de mucha utilidad para ella y su familia así  han construido su propia casa, quieren seguir progresando para ello ahorran porque quieren comprarse otro carro, el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le facilita le servirá para comprar la póliza del seguro y  el mantenimiento mecánico necesario, él grupo al cual pertenece se llama “ MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANGAMOS” son 7 socias vecinas del mismo lugar.

   •La Sra. Giovanna es la 5ta de la derecha esta vestida con polo negro (en la foto también aparecen 2 señoras invitadas)
texts.en:
With great effort and sacrifice, Giovanna and her husband have been able to buy their own car. For many years, her husband has worked providing public transportation. He used to drive cars belonging to other people, which did not provide him with much income, while also requiring lots of sacrifice. Now it is different, because having their own vehicle means that their earnings are better. Giovanna is the one who manages the car, taking care of everything that is needed for its good operation. At the same time, she also works cleaning houses and apartments. She has steady customers for whom she provides services several days a week. This income is very useful for her and her family, and they have been able to build their own house. They want to keep making progress, and they are saving their money because they want to buy another car. The loan which EDAPROSPO is facilitating for her will be used to buy the insurance policy and necessary mechanical maintenance. The group she belongs to is called “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANGAMOS” ["Entrepreneurial Women of Angamos"]. It has 7 members who are neighbors in the same area. 

   • Giovanna is the fifth from the right, and is wearing a black shirt. The group photo includes 2 women who are guests.

loans.use: to buy insurance and carry out maintenance on her car.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Adjowa est une femme  âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé avec 02 enfants en charge.
Adjowa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2005. Elle vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place et achète ses produits au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Adjowa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjowa, age 39, is married to an employee and has two children to support. Since 2005, she's been reselling grocery products.

She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, and resells to her customers in a neighborhood of her town.

Adjowa is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy more products. She wants to ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for resale

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JIGUISSEME est constitué de femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles polygamiques à Kaboïla un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt septième prêts avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
ALIMATA, debout au milieu  fait le commerce de  pagnes (wax et real)  dans ce ce groupe de femmes JIGUISSEME, il y’a plus de 12 ans et est beaucoup sollicitée par les clients. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des 20 pièces de pagnes (wax et real) au prix d’en gros au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso. 
Elle les revend à Kaboïla, de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The Jiguisseme group is made up of married women, who average 37 years of age with an average of four children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Kaboïla, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their twenty-seventh loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Alimata, who is standing in the middle of the photo, has been buying and selling "pagnes" (highly decorative and colourful pieces of fabric), both the "wax" and "real" varieties, in this Jiguisseme women's group for more than 12 years and is in great demand from her customers. With her loan she is planning to buy 20 pieces of "pagne" fabric (both "wax" and"real") at a wholesale price at Sikasso's Grand Market. She resells in Kaboïla, on a door-to-door basis, as well as within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,500FCFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to satisfy customer demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes"

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una madre soltera con 35 años de edad, tiene a su cargo tres hijos  menores de edad, los cual estudian en el nivel primario y secundario, ella se dedica a la fabricación de canastas, bolsas,sombreros, etc fabricados de totora, eligio este tipo de negocio ya que lo aprendió de su familia.  Dora es una mujer luchadora y muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a sus hijos lleva en el negocio desde el años 1998, gana semanalmente el importe de S/. 200 soles, con el crédito que se le otorgara gracias a kiVa de S/. 1500 soles lo invertirá para la compara de materiales de construcción ( ladrillos, cemento, etc) una de sus metas es que sus hijos puedan terminar de estudiar y que lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales, para que en un futuro determinado puedan tener una buena calidad de vida, sus asesor cree que es una buena cliente.
Alejandro vive y trabaja en Chincha, or Chincha Alta, Perú. Chincha is named after its early Dora the Chincha culture, celebrated for their advanced knowledge of agricultural and their maritime prowess. Today Chincha is an incredible mix of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but has preserved as it has for much of its history.
texts.en:
Dora is a single, 35-year-old, woman who has three dependent children in her care.  All her children are studying at the primary and secondary level.  Dora's business is making baskets, bags, hats, etc. from tortora reed.  She chose this type of business because she learned it from her family.  Dora is a tenacious and very entrepreneurial woman who has a great desire to get her children ahead in life.  She has been in this business since 1998 and earns 200 soles a week.  She will invest the loan for 1,500 soles, that she will receive thanks to Kiva, in buying building materials (bricks, cement, etc.)  One of her goals is for her children to finish their studies and become good professionals so that, in the future, they can enjoy a good quality of life.  Dora's loan officer believes her to be a good client.

Dora lives and works in Chincha, Chincha Alta, Peru. Chincha is named after its early Chincha culture.  The Chincha are celebrated for their advanced knowledge of agriculture and their maritime prowess. Today Chincha is an incredible mix of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian population, indigenous people and influences from the Spanish Empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but it is preserved as it was for much of its history.

loans.use: to buy building materials (bricks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Adjouavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un transitaire et a 04 enfants.
Adjouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. depuis 2003. Elle vend à son domicile après achat à Lomé.
Adjouavi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale afin de répondre à la demande de la population.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjouavi voudrait avoir d’autres points de vente et assurer un radieux avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjouavi, age 31, is married to a freight agent and has four children. Since 2003, she's been reselling grocery products.

She purchases her supplies in Lomé, and resells at her home.

Adjouavi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy more products to better meet customer demand.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to open other points of sale and ensure a shining future for her children.

loans.use: to buy and resell grocery products

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El señor Samuel, nacido en la comunidad de mora, del departamento de Santa Cruz de 24 años, su señora esposa es la Sra. Fátima trabaja en una sala de bingos  de la ciudad de Santa Cruz tienen un hijo y ambos trabajan  y se  esfuerzan para buscar mejores días para su familia y para el bienestar de su hijito, ellos radican desde hace 3 años en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, viven en la zona del  Plan 3.000 actualmente el Sr.  Samuel se dedica a prestar sus servicios de soldadura en forma independiente, a las empresas o personas particulares que lo solicitan, su crédito justamente es para la compra de herramienta de trabajo en el área de arco y oxigeno y esto de ayuda en realizar un buen trabajo  y así satisfacer a sus clientes el sr. Samuel  esta agradecido con el préstamo y la oportunidad que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Samuel was born in the community of Mora, in the Department of Santa Cruz. He is 24 years old, and his wife, Fátima, works in a bingo hall in the city of Santa Cruz. They have one child, and both of them work and make great efforts to achieve better days for their family and for the well-being of their little child. For the past three years, they have lived in the city of Santa Cruz. They live in the "Plan 3000" zone. Currently, Samuel works providing welding services on an independent basis, to businesses or private individuals who request his services. His loan will be used to buy working tools in the area of arc and oxygen welding. This will help him do a good job and thus satisfy his customers. Samuel is grateful for the loan and the opportunity that has been provided to him.

loans.use: to buy tools for arc and oxygen welding.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe es divorciada, desde que se separo de su esposo ha salido adelante sola con sus hijos ya están grandes, actual mente trabaja como cajera en un restaurant de la localidad. Solicita el préstamo por que esta necesitando el cableado de la luz pues ya están en muy malas condiciones y le están causando problemas en el consumo y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is divorced.  Since she separated from her husband she has gotten her children ahead by herself.  Her children are now adults.

She currently works as a cashier in a local restaurant.

She is requesting a loan because she needs to change the electrical wiring in her house.  It is in very poor condition, and it is causing her problems using it.  She is afraid that an accident could happen.

loans.use: to change the electrical wiring system in her whole house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
La socia Urbana se esta dedicando al negocio D. venta D. turrones uqe esta hecho a base D. arroz con miel,ella preprara los turrones y luego los reparte a las diferentes tiendas o colegios,la socia trabaja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. turrones.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,miel y papeles para la envoltura D. turrones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Urbana devotes herself to the business of selling nougats, which are maD. with a base of rice and honey.  She prepares the nougats, and she later distributes them to different stores or schools.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her business of selling nougats.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, honey, and papers to wrap the nougats.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, honey, and papers to wrap the nougats.

loans.name: Doris Beatriz

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer que ve hacia el futuro, le gusta salir adelante planteandose metas y objetivos. Doris es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en San Gabriel al Norte de Ecuador en la Provincia del Carchi. Trabaja en la compra venta de joyas.

Inició su negocio hace nueve años debido a la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus ingresos económicos eran muy bajos. Es cliente de Fodemi por casi ocho años ahora realiza un nuevo crédito el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de joyas ya que quiere incrementar su negocio para que mejoren sus ingresos económicos, que le ayudarán a darle el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un local y montar su joyería.
texts.en:
Doris is a woman who looks towards the future. She likes to get ahead by making plans and setting goals. Doris is married and has 3 children. She lives with her family in San Gabriel in the northern part of Ecuador in the province of Carchi. She works selling jewelry.

She began her business 9 years ago because the family needed to get ahead, and her income was very low. She has been a customer of Fodemi for almost 8 years and currently is asking for a new loan which is going to be invested in the purchase of jewelry as she wants to expand her business in order to have higher profits, in order to help her children by providing for their studies. Her dream is to have a facility to organize her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry which will permit her to expand her business

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe KOSSOMINE sont toute des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  5 enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
KOROTOUMOU, au milieu fait la transformation et vente de Sounbala dans ce groupe de femmes KOSSOMINE. Expérimentée à la matière elle beaucoup sollicitée par des clients venant de Sikasso et d’ailleurs. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150 kilogrammes de graines de néré, dans les villages avoisinants. Elle les transforme avant de les vendre au  grand marché de Sikasso  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.50FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Kossomine group are all married women, who average 40 years of age with an average of five children each; they live in polygamous families in Koboïla, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their third loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Korotoumou, who is in the middle of the photo, makes and sells sounbala (a spice made up from "néré" seeds) within the Kossomine women's group. As a result of her experience in this domain, she is in great demand from her customers who come from Sikasso and elsewhere. With her loan she is planning to buy 150 kg of "néré" grains in the neighboring villages. She transforms the "néré" seeds into sounbala before selling them at Sikasso's Grand Market to order and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,500FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to satisfy customer demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy "néré" grains

loans.name: Edneyda Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", este banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, en la Provincia y Deparatamento de Cusco.

La socia  es contadora de profesión, la socia también vende productos por catalogos de belleza; ella se dedica a varias actividades como la preparación de chocolates, ella realiza figuras con relleno y sin relleno, fuentes de chocolate para coberturas, la socia tambien realiza manualidades; la socia desea en esta ocasion el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos para elaborar los chocolates dulces, tambien invertira una parte en la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, labiales por catalogos para tener en reserva. La socia invertira el credito en la compra d eproductos por catalogo y de mercaderia para su chocolateria.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO" ["The Lionesses of San Jeronimo"]. The bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo, in the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is an accountant by profession, and she also sells products from beauty catalogs. She also works in various activities such as the preparation of chocolates. She makes shapes with fillings and without fillings, and chocolate fountains for glazing. She also makes handicrafts. On this occasion, the borrower would like a loan to invest in buying ingredients to prepare sweet chocolates. She will also invest a portion in buying beauty products such as creams, perfumes, and lipsticks by catalog to have in reserve. The borrower will invest the loan in buying products by catalog and in supplies for her chocolate business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products from a catalog and supplies for her chocolate business.

loans.name: Ramiro Adonay

texts.es:
Ramiro de 23 años, trabaja muy duro como chofer de maquinaria pesada en una empresa que se encarga de construir las calles no pavimentadas.

Trabaja solo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. La dificultad que presenta en el trabajo es el mal clima, ya que le afecta mucho el sol. Está casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 3 años. En la foto aparece con su esposa ya que los dos tienen planificado mejorar su vivienda por eso el quiere el prestamo para comprar cemento, arena y bloques. 

Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa para vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 23, works very hard as a heavy machine operator in a business that builds unpaved roads.  He works alone from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening.  The difficult part about his work is the bad weather because the sun affects him a lot.  He is married.  His wife takes care of the home and he has two children, 2 and 3 years old.  In the photo he appears with his wife since the two of them are planning to improve their home.

This is why he wants the loan, to buy cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

His goal is to be able to finish building his house to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se esta dedicando al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes,ella venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,lecche y fideos,ella tambien en el local D. su tienda D. abarrotes venD. desayunos en las mañanas y tambien venD. kekes en forma ambulatoria en las tardes,por medio D. estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes,negocio D. venta D. desayunos y negocio D. venta D. kekes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y fideos para implementar la tienda D. abarrotes y tambien comprar insumos para prepara los desayunos y kekes como harina,leche,azucar y mantequilla al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member who works in her small grocery store business. She sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk and pasta, In her grocery store she also sells breakfasts in the morning as well as cakes as a street vendor in the afternoon. With these small businesses she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve her grocery store business, and her breakfast and cake selling businesses. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and pasta to stock her store and also to buy ingredients to make the breakfasts and cakes, such as flour, sugar, and butter wholesale.  

Gloria is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and pasta to stock her small grocery store as well as to buy ingredients to prepare breakfasts and cakes, such as flour, milk, and butter wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: Juan Luis, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar una novilla para la producción de leche. El tiene la experiencia necesaria para la explotación de este animal y cuenta con un repasto y corral en óptimas condiciones para el mantenimiento de este animal. El tiene como meta generar una muy buena producción de leche para el consumo propio y para la venta al mercado de la localidad. El piensa en el futuro de él y su esposa por lo cual quiere invertir en este negocio y así ir generando ingresos para los tiempos difíciles de algunas temporadas. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan Luis is 24 years old. He lives with his common-law wife, who is his highest priority. With the loan, he plans to buy a heifer for milk production. He has the necessary experience to make good use of this animal, and he has a corral and grazing area in optimal condition to maintain the animal. His goal is to generate a good level of milk production for his own use and to sell at the market in his town. He is thinking about the future for himself and his wife, and for this reason he wants to invest in this business so he can generate income for the difficult times in some seasons. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from government banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for milk production.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, et ont en moyenne  6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kaboïla un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt septième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
DJALIA, la première à gauche fait la transformation des graines de néré en Sounbala dans ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. Expérimentée à la matière elle beaucoup sollicitée par des clients venant de Sikasso et d’ailleurs. 
Elle compte acheter, dans les villages avoisinants, avec son  prêt , 300 kilogrammes  de  graines de néré afin de les transformer en Sounbala.
 Elle les vend au  grand marché de Sikasso  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogontala group are married women, who average 41 years of age with an average of six children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Kaboïla, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their twenty-seventh loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Djalia, on the far left of the photo, transforms "néré" seeds into sounbala (a spice) within the Kotognogontala women's group. Experienced in this domain she is in great demand from customers who come from Sikasso and elsewhere. With her loan she is planning to buy 300kg of "néré" grains in order to make sounbala. She sells the spices at Sikasso's Grand Market to order and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,500FCFA, part of which will be used to pay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy "néré" grains to transform into Sounbala

loans.name: Disnarda

texts.es: Disnarda, de 46 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y emprendedora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 12 años, el mayor es independiente y tiene su familia a parte, mientras que los dos menores aún depende de ella y su pareja para poder tener una buena educación. Vive en una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su conviviente con quien trabajan mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Disnarda consiste en la venta de pan de todo tipo, bebidas y helados con sabor de frutas regionales, que siempre salen mucho por el intenso calor que se vive en la zona. Todos estos productos los vende en su casa, ahí llegan sus clientes. Por otro lado, trabaja para algunas personas en la cosecha de cítricos y le genera un ingreso adicional en la economía de su hogar. lleva tres años haciendo estas actividades y empezó vendiendo de a poco y ahora su negocio se ha establecido. Le encanta trabajar así ya que maneja su propio tiempo y genera ingresos para su familia. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero por el momento solo desea consolidar su trabajo y mas adelante ampliar su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy ilusionada de saber que le brindarán un respaldo financiero para poder empezar a invertir en mayor cantidad para su negocio. Está muy comprometida en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y poder integrarse rápidamente a su banco comunal ya que son un grupo muy sólido y sobre todo muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará producto para incrementar su negocio, comprará pan, gaseosas, además de ingredientes e insumos para seguir haciendo sus deliciosos helados de pura fruta.
texts.en: Disnarda is 46 years old. She is a cheerful, friendly and enterprising woman. She lives with her spouse, with whom she has three children aged 20, 17 and 12 years old. The oldest is independent and with his own family, while the two youngest still depend on her and her spouse to have a good education. She lives in her own house where she shares her days with her spouse who also works a lot to offer a better quality of life to their family. Disnarda's job is selling all types of bread, beverages and ice cream flavored with regional fruit, of which there are many because of the intense heat in the area. She sells all of the products in her house, where her customers go. On the other hand she works for some people harvesting citrus, which generates additional income for the home. She has been doing these activities for three years and she started by selling a little, and now her business has stabilized. She loves working like this, since she managed her own schedule and generates income for her family. She has a lot of plans for the future, but at this time she just wants to consolidate her work and in the future expand her business. This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very excited to know that they will offer her financial backing in order to start to invest more in her business. She is very committed to making her payments on time and be able to integrate quickly into the communal bank, since it is a very solid and above all responsible group. With the amount she has asked for, 1,5000 soles, she will buy products to grow her business. She will buy bread, soft drinks, as well as ingredients and materials to keep making the delicious fruit ice cream.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks and fruit to make ice cream.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica nació en la ciudad de Urubamba pero vive en la misma de ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo. 

Yessica desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y patos, ella también tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Yessica requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería por mayor pues le sale más barato, ella desea abastecer la tienda comprando sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche y otras cosas más. 

Yessica se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Yessica pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Yessica was born in the city of Urubamba and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 32 years old and is married and from this marriage she has one child.

Yessica works and earns her daily bread in the city of Ollantaytambo. She breeds small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks. She also has a grocery store. She has been in business for some years and things are going well thanks to her effort and hard work.

Yessica is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise at wholesale, which is cheaper. She wants to supply her store buying sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of milk and other items.

Yessica is grateful for the the opportunity that this loan gives her and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule. Yessica belongs to the communal bank Señor de Choquekillca of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, boxes of milk and other items

loans.name: Martha Antonieta

texts.es:
Martha de 47 años, empezó con su negocio de venta de botellones de agua y productos químicos, pero con la ayuda de Dios su negocio ha ido evolucionando y ahora también tiene el negocio de vender frutas.

Realiza su trabajo sola, sin horarios fijos. No ha tenido ninguna dificultad hasta ahora. No está casada y si tiene hijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su ventas en navidad por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo frutas y productos quimicos. 

Su meta es poder agrandar más su negocio de venta de productos químicos y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Martha, 47, began with her business selling bottles of water and chemical products, but with God's help her business has evolved and now she also sells fruit in the business.

She works alone, without a fixed schedule.  She has had no problems thus far.  She is not married and she does have children.

She has many aspirations with her Christmas sales and so she wants to buy fruit and chemical products with the loan.  Her goal is to be able to enlarge her business selling chemical products and selling fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruit and chemical products.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", lel banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 35 años de edad; la socia es soltera y tiene un hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la compra y venta de bebidas alcoholicas; la socia distribuye piscos a las diferentes tiendas y market en la zona y en la ciudad d eCusco, la socia es minorista aún no abarca sectores de clientes, pero poco a poco se va haciendo paso.
