La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de pisco al por mayor para la distribución en las tiendas y market en dond ela socia tiene sus clientes.

 
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the communal bank "Las Leonas de San Jeronimo" [St. Jerome’s Lionesses] located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province and department of Cusco. Edith, 35, is single and has one son. She alternates her daily chores with the purchase and sale of alcoholic drinks. She distributes pisco [Peruvian national drink] to different stores and markets in the area within Cusco. She is still a retailer who has yet to cover more customer segments, but little by little she's making progress. 

Edith will use the loan to buy pisco at wholesale prices for distribution to stores and markets where she has her clients. She is happy with the given loan and thanks Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy pisco at wholesale prices for resale to other stores and markets where her clients are located.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ABI, qui est assise à gauche fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires il y’a onze ans. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 paniers d’orange + 1sac de 25kg de sel + 100kg d’oignons et  2 cartons de cube maggie. Elle s’approvisionne dans les jardins potagers  des villages environnants et au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  grand marché à Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Sabaly group are married women, who average 38 years of age with an average of three children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Sikasso. 

They are on their eighth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. 

Abi, who is sitting on the left of the photo, has been buying and selling condiments for the past eleven years. With her loan she is planning to buy two baskets of oranges, one 25kg sack of salt, 100kg of onions and two cartons of Maggi stock cubes. She gets her supplies from vegetable gardens in surrounding villages and at Sikasso's Grand Market. She resells at Sikasso's Grand Market and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on a retail basis.  

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,500FCFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy condiments and fruit

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La socia Dominga se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. fruta como manzanas,platanos,naranjas y uvas y negocio D. venta D. carne,ella lleva a lugares como Paruro,ella trabaja independientemente,por medio D. este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. fruta y negocio D. venta D. carne.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,naranjas,uva y platanos al por mayor y tambien para comprar carne al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dominga is still in the business of selling fruit such as apples, bananas, oranges, and grapes and a meat sales business. She sells in places such as Paruro. She works alone and through this business she provides for her children. 

She wants to expand and improve the business of selling fruit and her meat sales business. She is asking for a loan to buy apples, oranges, grapes and bananas at wholesale and also to buy meat in bulk.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, grapes and bananas at wholesale prices and also to buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Epimenio

texts.es:
El señor Epimenio a sus 41 años de edad, se dedica a la construcción de obras como casas y edificios desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, esta actividad la inicio siendo ayudante y con el pasar del tiempo se convirtió en oficial de construcción. 

El señor Epimenio desea comprar una maquina cortadora de mármol, la cual es muy necesaria para los trabajos que realiza y así reducir gastos en el alquiler de este tipo de maquinaria. Lo anterior le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A futuro el señor Epimenio sueña con tener su propia oficina y generar muchos empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Epimenio, at 41 years old, has been working building houses and buildings for approximately 15 years.  He started this job as a helper and over time became a skilled construction worker.  

Epimenio wants to buy a marble-cutting machine, which is very necessary for the jobs he does.  In this way he will reduce expenses for renting this type of machine.  This will allow him to increase his earnings and so improve his family's quality of life.

Epimenio dreams of a future when he has his own office and generates many direct jobs in his community.

loans.use: to buy a marble-cutting machine.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwwa est une femme âgé(e) de âge ans. Elle est mariée à un déclarant en douanes et est mère de 03 enfants.
Akossiwwa travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames depuis 1991. Elle achète à l’intérieur du pays et vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place.
Akossiwwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames.
texts.en:
Akossiwwa is woman married to a customs agent. She has three children. Since 1991, she's been reselling yams. She purchases her supplies in the interior of the country, and resells to her customers at a market in her town.

Akossiwwa is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy yams.

loans.use: to buy and resell yams

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BADEYA sont  essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
 FATOUMATA qui les pagnes en main première à gauche fait le commerce de pagnes wax – real et tissus il ya environ 10 ans .
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  15 pièces de pagnes wax – real Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BADEYA are married women who average 38 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a district of the city of Sikasso. They are seeking their first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their growing customer base. 

FATOUMATA has been selling wax pagnes for about ten years. She is first from the left in the photo, holding some of her merchandise. She will use her loan to buy 15 units of wax pagnes. She buys her stock at the Grand market of Sikasso and sells her merchandise at the market of Kamalen Sirakoro, as well as door-to-door and within the family, to men and women, for cash.

She plans to earn an average profit of 22,500 FCFA per month, part of which will go towards daily household expenses and the remainder added to her savings. She wants to increase her sales and better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale

loans.name: Nawindsongti Group

texts.fr:
Mme NAWINEBARKA  est la représentante du groupe NAWINDSONGTI. Elle est mariée  et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Les 06  vont à l’école. Elle a 10 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du soumbala  depuis  1998 (13ans). Elle vient de débuter  l’activité de tissage. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de Bissighin  en ville .Ses clients sont  les  ménagères (femmes).

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de 100kg de grains de néré pour la fabrication du soumbala.

 Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne accroitre son activité de vente de soumbala et développer son activité de tissage récemment commencer et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nawinebarka is the leader of the Nawindsongti group. She is married and has 6 children aged between 21 and 4 years, all of whom go to school. She is responsible for 10 people in total.

Nawinebarka has been selling soumbala (a spice made of the seeds of the African Locust Bean, or Néré) for 13 years, since 1998, and has just started a weaving business. She gets her supplies in the market of Bissighin. Her clients are housewives, and she uses the profits from her business to take care of her family.

Nawinebarka would like to buy 100 kilograms of Néré seeds with which to make soumbala. She would like to increase her sales of soumbala and develop her weaving business, in order to be able to better take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy a 100 kg bag of Néré seeds.

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
La señora San Juana y su esposo están esperando la llegada de su primer hijo. Solicitan un préstamo para pagar la clínica donde nacerá su bebe, y estar preparados para cualquier emergencia que se pueda presentar. También les esta haciendo falta algunos productos y accesoria para la llegado del bebe. 
Doña San Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad y su esposo es empleado de una fábrica.
texts.en:
San Juana and her husband are awaiting the arrival of their first child. They are requesting a loan to pay the clinic where their baby will be born, and to be prepared for any emergency that may arise. They also need some products and accessories for the baby's arrival. 

San Juana works selling used clothing in different parts of the city, and her husband is an employee in a factory.

loans.use: pay medical expenses for childbirth.

loans.name: Demin Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DEMIN sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, qui ne cesse d’augmenter.Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
 SALI, en blanc, debout au milieu fait le commerce de poisons (fumés et frais) il ya environ 6. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  5 caisses de poissons fumés et 4 paniers de poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Demin group are married women, who average 42 years of age with an average of five children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a district of the town of Sikasso. 

They are on their fifth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their ever-growing customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

Sali, dressed in white and standing in the middle of the photo, has been buying and selling fish for around six years. With her loan she is planning to buy five crates of smoked fish and four baskets of fresh fish. She gets her supplies in Sikasso town's Grand Market. She resells them at a fixed place in the market in Kamalen Sirakoro and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 47,500FCFA, part of which will be used for daily household expenses, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Neri Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Neri pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 25 años de edad; la socia es soltera; La socia es ingeniero civil de profesión, ella trabaja  asistiendo las obras; la socia asiste como técnica de obras, ella tambien alquila dos canchones al publico en general, pero actualmente la socia desea invertir en construccion, la socia desea invertit el la primera etapa de construcción de vivienda, en los planos y certificaciones, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la construccion de viviendas en la fase 1 que son los papeleos, elaboracion de planos, certificaciones entre otras.

 
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
The member, Neri, belongs to Las Leonas de San Jerónimo Communal Bank, located in the district of San Jerónimo in the province and department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old and single.  She is a civil engineer by profession and works assisting the building work as a building engineer.  She also rents two large enclosed pieces of land ["canchones"] to the public in general.

Currently Neri wants to invest in construction, in first-phase home construction, in plans and certifications.  She wants to invest the loan in first-phase home construction, which is paperwork, plans, certifications, and other things.
 
She is happy about the loan granted and she thanks the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to invest in first-phase home building: paperwork, plans, certification, and other things.

loans.name: Amnie Anabel

texts.es:
La socia Amnie pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 37 años de edad; la socia es soltera; La socia es Obstetra de profesión, La socia trabaja  independientemente en su propio centro obstetra; la socia tambien trabaja particularmente, ella en la actualidad desea poder implementar us centro de salud y para ello desea invertir el prestamo enla comra de medicamentos basicos para las diferentes atenciones, ella desea crecer poco a poco y para ello esta poniendo sus primeras bases. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de medicamentos para implementar su centro obstetra.


 
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Amnie belongs to the communal bank Las Leonas de San Jeronimo. The communal bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province and department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, and single. She is an obstetrician. She works independently, in her own obstetric center. 

She also works conscientiously, and currently she wants to be able to expand her health center and to do this she needs to invest the loan to buy basic medicine for different applications. She wants to grow little by little and she is building from the ground up. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy medicine to use in her obstetric office.

She is happy with the given loan and she thanks the Kiva loaners.

loans.use: to buy medicine to use in her obstetric office

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 40ans. Elle est célibataire et a 01 enfant.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 1996. Elle vend à Bé Kpota et achète les produits à Lomé.
Afiwa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa ouvrir d’autres points de vente et assurer un bon avenir à son enfant.
texts.en:
Afiwa is 40 years old, single and the mother of one child. She has been selling cosmetics since 1996. She sells her products in Bé Kpota and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Afiwa is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to restock on cosmetics. In the coming years, she would like to open more shops and provide her child with a solid foundation for a good future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Rayos De Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RAYOS DEL SOL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de calzados, venta de lanas, tienda de barrio,  venta de ropa interior, taller de cerrajería, venta de helado, venta de kerosene, trenzado de mantas. 

La señora Julia  indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado de mantas que viene trabajando hace años atrás por el apoyo de su amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de lana), que adquirirá de El Alto y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializara a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rayos del Sol” (Rays of Sun) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Julia. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as manufacturing shoes, selling wool, managing a neighborhood store, selling undergarments, managing a locksmith shop, selling ice cream, selling kerosene, and making braided shawls.

Sra. Julia says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago after receiving an invitation from a friend. She currently has a business that makes braided shawls. Julia has worked in this business for several years and has the help of her friend.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory by purchasing wool. She acquires her supplies in El Alto and then produces the goods that she will sell based on her orders. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Julia is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Julia said that she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Kenyereye Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KENYEREYE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
FATOUMATA, assise à droite  fait le commerce de poissons (fumés et frais) il ya environ 5 ans. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux grandes caisses de poissons fumés.Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro à une fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the KENYEREYE group are married women with an average age of 38 years and have an average of 3 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Sikasso. They are on the first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, which continue to increase. 

FATOUMATA, sitting on the right, has been in the the fish business (smoked and fresh) for around 5 years. She intends to buy with her loan, 2 large cases of smoked fish. She stocks up in the big market in the town of Sikasso. 

She retails them for cash from a permanent family stall at Kamalen Sirakoro market to a customer base made up of men and women. She plans to make a monthly profit of 21,500 FCFA of which a part will be used for the daily expenses of the family and the other for savings. 

She aims to increase her business turnover in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La señora Maricela a sus 30 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 8 y 6 años. La señora Maricela tiene una pequeña tienda en al sala de su casa desde hace aproximadamente 6 meses. Un familiar de la señora Maricela fue quien la motivo para que montara su propio negocio luego de haberse separado de su esposo, luego de esto la señora Maricela quedo sola para las obligaciones de su hogar. La señora Maricela desea comprar surtido para su tienda como arroz, panela, snakcs, gaseosas, dulces y productos para el aseo personal, que le permitan prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y a su vez incrementar sus ingresos con los que pueda brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. A futuro la señora Maricela sueña con tener un mini mercado y brindarles un excelente bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maricela, 30, is a mother of two children, aged 8 and 6 years old. Maricela has had a small store in her living room for approximately 6 months. One of Maricela's family members motivated her to start her own business after she separated from her husband. After the separation, Maricela was left on her own to support her home. 

Maricela wants to buy an assortment of products for her store, such as rice, panela [brown sugar loaf], snacks, soft drinks, sweets, and products for personal cleaning. These purchases will allow her to provide a better service to her clients and increase her income to provide a better quality of life to her children. 

In the future, Maricela dreams with having a mini-market and providing excellent well-being to her children.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products.

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA  est la représentante du groupe BASNEWENDE. Elle est mariée  et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. Les 02  vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des légumes (choux, tomate)  depuis14ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Boussé, Péla et Yako  au BURKINA. Ses clients sont  les  femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02 sacs de choux et 01 caisse de tomate.

 Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  épargner pour s’acheter une moto afin de faciliter ses déplacements et d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. RASMATA is the representative of BASNEWENDE Group. She's married and the mother of three children, age 3 to 13. Two of them attend school. She has three persons to support.

She's been selling vegetables (cabbages, tomatoes) for fourteen years. She gets her supplies in Boussé, Péla and Yako, in Burkina Faso. Her customers are women.

She would like to buy two sacks of cabbage and one box of tomatoes. She uses her profits to take care of her family.

She ambitions to put money away to expand her business, and buy a motorcycle to ease her trips.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of cabbage and one box of tomatoes

loans.name: Clencia

texts.es:
Clencia nació en la ciudad de Olantaytambo pero vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. 

Clencia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanía de tipo tejido, ella vende sus productos en uno de los mercados de artesanía más populares de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Clencia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y también para comprar lana.
 
Clencia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Clencia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Clencia was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, but she lives in the city of Urubamba. Clencia, 45, is in a common-law relationship and has two children. She carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Ollantaytambo. 

She produces and sells knitted handicrafts. Clencia sells her products in one of the most popular artisan markets in Ollantaytambo. She has been in this business for many years and is doing well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work.

Clencia needs the loan to buy merchandise and also to buy wool. She is thankful for the opportunity brought to her through this means and promises to make her payments according to the time line. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Choquekillca” in the Asociación Arariwa located in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and wool.

loans.name: Elena Maribel

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer sociable, paciente y le gusta ayudar a las demás personas. Elena es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en Cotacachi que se encuentra ubicado a 20 minutos de Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura, al Norte de Ecuador.

Elena tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, empezó a trabajar por satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos, ya que actualmente sus ingresos no son los aptos para tener una buena calidad de vida. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de mercadería como ropa camisetas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, calentadores entre otros ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y quiere aprovechar ya que le generará buenos ingresos por sus ventas y permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y su familia.

Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia para ahí poder montar su negocio en un local propio.
texts.en:
Elena is a sociable, patient, lady who likes helping other people.  She’s married and has two children, ages six and two.  She lives with her husband in Cotacachi, located 20 minutes from Otavalo in the Imbabura province in northern Ecuador.

She has a clothing selling business, having started it to be able to provide for her children.  Her income in not enough to provide for a good quality of life.  This will be her second loan through Fodemi, which she will use to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and warmers, among other things, now that the Christmas season is approaching.  She wants to take advantage of the season and generate a good income through her sales.  This will allow her to improve her children’s and family’s quality of life.
 
Her dream is to have a home of her own and be able to run her business from there.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es: Edwar, de 43 años, es un hombre trabajador, bueno y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años. Todos los días trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos con quienes comparte la alegría de vivir juntos en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Edwar consiste en la siembra de cítricos, tiene una chacra en donde empezó hace 15 años con este trabajo, al principio tenía solo unas cuantos plantas cítricas, pero poco a poco y con bastante esfuerzo fue sembrando uno a uno y así fue creciendo su sembrío que tiene una medida de 1.5 hectáreas. Además de este negocio, tiene un ingreso adicional, que obtiene vendiendo bebidas alcohólicas heladas en su casa, y a diario se van a comprarle sus bebidas, en este negocio tiene la ayuda de algunos obreros quienes se encargan de la limpieza de la chacra. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que puede disponer de tiempo y tener ingresos que le permiten tener una mejor condición de vida. Antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a trabajar para otras personas y eso no le permitía tener muchas ganancias. Ahora lo que más desea es consolidar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 8 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado, se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cutas, como anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará bebidas para seguir vendiendo, además comprará materiales agrícolas para poder realizar la limpieza de sus tierras y contratar a algunas personas que le ayuden con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Edwar is 43 years old and is a good, hardworking, and responsible man.  He lives with his wife and they have three children, ages 19, 17, and 15.  He works every day to be able to provide a better quality of life for his children, with whom he shares his happiness for living together in their own home that they built with great effort.

Edwar raises citrus.  He has an orchard that he started 15 years ago.  At first he only had a few plants, but little by little, with lots of effort, he planted one by one and began increasing his orchard.  Now he has 1.5 hectares.

He also brings in additional income by selling cold alcoholic beverages from his home.  He buys them daily.  In this business he gets help from some of the workers who tend to the fields.  The good thing about his work is that he can have some spare time and also enough income to improve his life.  Before having this business, he worked for other people and that didn’t provide for much of an income.

Now he wants to consolidate his business.  This will be his 8th loan though MFP and he is very grateful to know that he will have financial support, now that he will feel certain that he can advance his business.  At the same time, he is committed once more to make his payments on time, as before.  With this loan of 1,500 PEN ($575), he will buy beverages to resell, and also agricultural supplies so that he can clean his fields, and hire some workers who can help with the work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Wilbert Isaias

texts.es:
Wilbert pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  tiene 60 años de edad; El socio  es casado; El socio tiene 5 hijos ya todos ellos independientes; el socio antes solia hacer mobilidad escolar con su combi, ahora el desea invertir el prestamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su carro, el socio invertira en la compra de repuestos entre otros, el socio tambien compra y vende alivinos, al por mayor y menor a diferentes clientes que ya lo conocen y lo buscan para hacerle pedidos; el socio desea simplemente mantenerse ocupado y ver crecer a sus hijos y formar sus familias, eso le hace feliz. El socio solicita el prestamno para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y en la compra de nuevos repuestos.
  
El socio  está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Wilbert is a member of the "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank, located in the San Jeronimo district within the Cusco province and department.

He is 60 years old, is married, and has five adult children on their own.  He was providing school bus services with his van, but now he would like to invest the money from this loan to maintain his vehicle.  He will buy repair parts and other things.  He also sells medications in large and small quantities and various customers seek him out to place orders with him.  He just wants to stay busy and watch his children grow and start their own families.  This makes him happy.  He is asking for this loan to maintain his vehicle and buy repair parts.

He is happy about the loan and is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy repair parts and maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Edmundo Americo

texts.es:
Edmundo pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito se San Jeronimo en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  tiene 48 años de edad; El socio  es casado; El socio tiene 3 hijos de 11, 7, 5 años de edad; el socio es distribuidor de licores, piscos, vinos; el socio tambien tiene otro negocio de venta de ropas, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de licores, vinos, champan, piscos para implementar y distribuir a sus respectivos cleintes en sus negocios. El socio solicita el prestamno para invertir en la compra de licores, vinos, champan, piscos, para estas fiestas navideñas.
  
El socio  está contenta con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
Edmundo is a member of the "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank, located in the San Jeronimo district, within the Cusco province.

He is 48 years old, married, and has three children, ages 11, 7, and 5.  He is a distributor of liquors, ports, and wines.  He also has a clothes selling business.  He is asking for this loan to buy liquors, champagne, and ports to distribute to his clients over the holiday season.

He is grateful for the loan and appreciates the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana de 25 años, empezó su negocio con el préstamo que le hizo una amiga y con su esfuerzo pudo salir adelante y ampliarlo más el cyber con su propios meritos.

Trabaja sola desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

El problema que presenta su negocio es la delincuencia por lo que tuvo que aumenta la seguridad en su cyber.
Es madre soltera que tiene una hija de 4 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Su meta es poder ampliar más el cyber, poder adecuar de mejor manera su casa y poder terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Twenty-five year old Diana began her business with a loan from a friend.  With lots of effort she was able to get ahead and expand her business through her own resources.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm.  Her business has a problem with crime so she had to increase security in her cyber café.  She is the single mother of a four year old girl who attends the local school.  Her goals are to expand her cyber café, make improvements to her house, and complete her university studies.

loans.use: to buy three computers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roboan

texts.es: El señor Roboan a sus 32 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 10 y 4 años. El señor Roboan se dedica a la venta de helados a las afueras de los colegios  con una maquina que elabora este producto. El señor Roboan desea comprar insumos para la elaboración de los helados como leches y saborizantes, adicionalmente necesita hacerle mantenimiento a la maquina que realiza los helados puesto que ya tiene varios años de uso. Con lo anterior, el señor Roboan podrá trabajar más tranquilo y con la seguridad de que la maquina no se le va a dañar. El sueño del señor Roboan es poder proveer todo lo que su familia necesita, crecer mucho más con su negocio, comprar más maquinas y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en: Roboan is 32 years old and the father of two children, ages 10 and 4.  Roboan sells ice cream outside schools and makes his product by machine.  He would like to buy ingredients to make ice cream; like milk and flavorings.  He also needs to perform maintenance on his ice cream machine, as he’s been using it for several years.  This will make his work easier, knowing that his machine will not be damaged.  Roboan’s dreams are to be able to provide for all his family’s needs, to grow with his business, buy more machines, and create jobs in his community.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and maintain his equipment.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres del Chaco se han unido con ganas de progresar y salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación. Realizan actividades individuales, pero también en conjunto con lo cual podrán fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Lida, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos comenta que empieza su jornada de trabajo a muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que va a traer productos frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha podido crecer y ayudar a su familia, cubriendo los gastos y manteniendo la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras frescas con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Quiere comprar tomates, lechugas, repollos, cebollas y demás tipos de verduras.
texts.en:
Eleven women from Chaco have come together with a desire to move ahead in life through their work as a team.  They saw a great opportunity in the “Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación” (Foundation’s Committee for Women).  They do individual activities, but also work together and this strengthens their camaraderie.

Lida is one of the members and she sells vegetables.  She tells us that she begins her workday very early in the morning, since she has to bring in fresh products to offer to her customers.  Thanks to her work, she’s been able to raise an income and help her family, covering the household expenses and maintenance.

She is asking for this loan to buy fresh vegetables so she can supply her business and be able to meet her customers’ needs.  She wants to buy tomatoes, lettuce, cabbage, onions, and other types of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sobeida Dubernoides

texts.es:
Sobeida de 36 años, empozo con su negocio de costurera por medio de la cuñada, ahora tiene su propio taller de costura.

Trabaja con empleados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio. No está casada pero tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 3 años. Tienes muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar telas e hilos para mejorar sus confecciones. 
 
Su meta es comprar más maquinarias para así incrementar su taller y así poder implementar más empleados.
texts.en:
Sobeida is 36 years old and started her sewing business with her sister in law.  Now she has her own workshop.  She works with her employees from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  Thanks to God she has not had any problems with her business.  She is not married, but has two children, ages 11 and 3.  She has many aspirations for her business and wants to buy fabrics and thread to improve her manufacturing.

Her goal is to buy more sewing machines in order to grow her workshop and be able to hire more employees.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
La señora Delmy tiene 32 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Rio Chiquito en el departamento Cortes. Ha pasado los últimos 4 años junto a su pareja Luis, lo cual es cajero. Delmy tiene dos hijos: una niña de 11 y un niño de 13 años de edad y ambos están estudiando. 

Delmy inició su negocio en 2010, debido a la necesidad de obtener otro fuente de ingreso para su familia. Lo empezó con ahorros de la familia y un crédito que solicitó en ODEF. Delmy trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 9:30 de la noche todos los días. Vende útiles escolares, novedades, y golosinas. 

Solicitó este crédito de L13,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de golosinas y novedades. Delmy espera superarse cada día más en su negocio y así dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Delmy is 32 years old and lives in the village of Rio Chiquito in the department of Cortes.  She has spent the last four years with her partner Luis.  He is a cashier.  Delmy has two children; a daughter of 11 and a son of 13, and they both attend school.

Delmy started her business in 2010, due to the necessity of finding another source of income for her family.  She began it using family savings and a loan that she requested from ODEF.  Delmy works from 6 in the morning until 9:30 at night, every day.  She sells school supplies, novelties, and candy.

She requested this loan of L13,000 to stock up her inventory by purchasing candy and novelties.  Delmy hopes to do better and better with her business on a daily basis, and so be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy and novelties.

loans.name: Munyofwe B Group

texts.en:
Albert is the facilitator of the Munyofwe B group. Albert and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Albert takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Albert had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Albert was only able to harvest 4½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Albert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Albert will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Munyofwe B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Albert is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kon Koun Doien Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEB.  est la responsable du groupe KON KOUN DOIEN. Elle est veuve  et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 22ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de l’igname depuis 2006(05ans). Elle s’approvisionne  à Léo au BURKINA. Ses clients sont  les  femmes et les restauratrices.

Elle veut  s’acheter  1/2 sac (54 ignames).

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices et s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  devenir une grande commerçante pour acheter et revendre les ignames en grande quantité et aussi ajouter des pains de singe (tedo).
texts.en:
Ms. DjénéB. is the group leader of the Kon Koun Doien group. She is a widow and the mother of two children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 22. One child attends school. She has three persons under her care.

She has been selling yams for the past five years (since 2006). She resupplies in Leo in Burkina Faso. Her customers are women and restaurant operators.

She wants to buy one half-bag of yams (54 yams).

She puts her profits into savings and cares for her family. She aims to become a great retail merchant, buying and selling large quantities of yams and also baobab juice (Tedo).

loans.use: buy one half-bag of yams (54 yams)

loans.name: Erika Alexandra

texts.es: La señora Erica a sus 20 años de edad es madre de un hijo de un año, se dedica a la confección de línea propia de ropa. La señora Erica confecciona todo tipo de pijamas y blusas de dama, el taller lo tiene acondicionado en su casa, esto le permite estar al cuidado de su pequeño hijo. La señora Erica desea comprar una nueva maquina y telas en cantidad. Con lo anterior, podrá aumentar sus ventas y su producción por ende aportar más dinero para los gastos de su casa. La señora Erica sueña con tener su taller más grande y así generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en: Erica is 20 years old and the mother of a one year old son.  She makes all types of pajamas and ladies’ blouses in a workshop she has set up in her home.  This allows her to care for her young son.  Erica wants to buy a new sewing machine and fabric in bulk.  This will allow her to increase her sales and bring in more money for expenses.  Erica dreams of having a larger workshop; in this way she can create jobs in her community.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Liber Ramon

texts.es:
Liber de 49 años, empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad desde los 13 años y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien hasta el día de hoy.

Con ayuda de sus compañeros ya que le hace falta herramientas de trabajo. Sus dificultades son la falta de herramienta para realizar su trabajo.Si está casado y su mujer realiza los quehaceres del hogar y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que están casados.

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo madera para hacer mas acabados para la venta. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y poder tener su negocio bien adecuado.
texts.en:
Liber is 49 years old and began working at a young age, 13, and thanks to God things have gone well for him to date.  He needs some tools to do his work, but has gotten help from his friends.  He’s married and his wife takes care of the housework.  Their three children are adults and married.

He wants to continue with his business and will use the money from this loan to buy lumber to make more furniture items to sell.  His goals are to improve his home and have a well-equipped business.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis de 50 años, empezó su negocio vendiendo tortillas y con la ayuda de Dios pudo salir adelante y empezó a vender meriendas y hasta el día de hoy le ha ido bien.

Trabaja solo desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. Su dificultad es la delincuencia debido a la peligrosidad del sector en el que vive. Es soltera y todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, pescado para hacer mas comida para la venta en su negocio. Su meta es poder terminar de construir su casa y adecua el local en el que vende comida para su mejor atención.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50 years old and has started a business selling tortillas. With God’s help, she has been able to push forward and has also begun selling light meals. To this day, she has done very well.

Gladis works alone from 6pm to 9pm. The difficulty she faces is dealing with crime, which means the neighborhood where she lives can be dangerous. She is single and all of her children are grown. With this loan, Gladis will buy rice, oil, and fish so that she can prepare more food to sell in her business. Her goal is to finish the construction of her house and to equip the location where she sells food so that she can provide better service.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and fish.

loans.name: Emita

texts.es: Emita, de 41 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, esta casada y producto de su matrimonio es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes mientras que los tres que aún dependen de ella. El trabajo de Emita consiste en la siembra de cítricos, además cosecha camu camu y tiene una ganadería con 10 cabezas de ganado, asimismo posee una chacra de 10 hectáreas que con el pasar del tiempo fue creciendo su producción. Lleva trabajando en su negocio 23 años, le esta yendo muy bien y se siente tranquila ya que con la cantidad de animales que tiene lo ve como un respaldo para su futuro. Pero eso no significa que no tiene que seguir creciendo con su negocio. Le agrada mucho lo que hace, y más cuando su familia la apoya. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará planas de frutas cítricas para seguir sembrando y producir más. Además contratará personal para hacer el mantenimiento total de su hectáreas y para que su ganado tenga más espacio.
texts.en:
Emita, age 41, is a fine and friendly woman. She is married and the mother of five children, two of whom are already independent adults. The other three children are still dependent on her. Emita’s work consists of growing citrus fruits. She also grows “camu camu” (a fruit that is native to the Amazon rain forest) and owns 10 heads of cattle. Emita owns a farm with 10 hectares of land where she spends her time growing her crops. She has been working in this business for 23 years. Emita has done very well and feels assured that the number of animals that she owns will be enough for the future. However, this does not mean that she will stop growing her business. Emita likes what she does, and she enjoys her work even more when she has the help of her family.

This will be her eighth loan with the MFP organization. Emita has always been a good member of her Communal Bank. She is greatly admired because she is one of the most responsible and supportive members. Emita hopes that this loan will provide the financial backing that she needs to continue growing her business. The amount of 1500 PEN that she requested will be used for growing more citrus fruits. She will also use the money to hire workers to perform maintenance on all of her land, which will help to provide more space for her livestock.

loans.use: to hire workers to maintain her land.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y por sobre todo humilde, quien día a día trata de luchar por darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
Tiene un pequeño taller de Costura en la Ciudad de Areguá, distante a unos 20 km. De la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, hasta donde se va para trabajar. Ella es separada, vive con dos de sus hijos mayores y su Mamá. Ella trabajaba como empleada para otras personas siempre en el rubro de la costura. Ella comenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo por lo cual tiene buenos ingresos.
Con los créditos que obtuvo de la fundación logró comprar máquinas y montar su propio taller, donde actualmente ella trabaja y confecciona prendas. El Crédito actual lo solicita para comprar telas en cantidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para su taller. Agradece a la fundación por la confianza que esta le da, pues gracias a esta está pudiendo salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marta is from the city of San Lorenzo. She defines herself as a very hardworking, entrepreneurial, and above all, humble woman. She struggles daily to provide her family with a better future. 

She has a small sewing workshop in the city of Areguá, 20 km. away from the city of San Lorenzo, where she travels to for work. She is separated and lives with two of her older children and her mother. She used to work as an employee for other people, always in the sewing industry.  She always has a lot of work which provides her with a good income. With the loans she received from Fundación Paraguaya, she bought machines to set up her own workshop where she works and makes clothing. This credit will be used to buy fabrics in bulk, which will be very helpful for her workshop. 

Marta is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for the trust they place in her, thanks to which she has been able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her workshop.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: La señora María Gabriela a sus 66 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. comidas rápidas y críspelas en un carro adecuado para esto. La señora María Gabriela venD. sus productos a las afueras D. los colegios. La señora María Gabriela desea comprar insumos para su negocio tales como panes, harina, carnes, salsas, maíz, entre otros, que le permitan tener abastecimiento D. materia prima con el fin D. no preocuparse por falta D. esta cuando las ventas son muy malas. Con lo anterior, la señora María Gabriela podrá aumentar sus ingresos y D. esta manera mejorar su calidad D. vida, la cual es delicada debido a los problemas D. salud que ella tiene. A futuro, la señora María Gabriela sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
María Gabriela is 66 years old. She sells fast food and popcorn in a car maD. for this. María Gabriela sells her products outsiD. schools. 

María Gabriela wants to buy supplies for her business such as bread, flour, meat, sauces, corn, and other items that would enable her to stock the basic items so as to not be worried about not having them whenever sales are very low. With this in mind, María Gabriela could increase her income and in this way better her quality of life, which is fragile due to the health problems she has.

In the future, María Gabriela dreams of having her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Keiry Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Keiry tiene 22 años de edad y vive con sus padres y dos hermanas en la aldea de Nuevo Jalapa en el municipio de Nuevo Celilac. Keiry es soltera y no tiene hijos. 

Keiry era enfermera en una hospital local pero hace 8 meses, con el apoyo de sus padres, ella decidió poner su propio negocio para no depender de otro para trabajo. Inició su pulpería en marzo y trabaja todos los días de 6:00 AM a 8:00 PM atendiendo su clientela. Vende productos alimenticios y todo lo que pertenece a la canasta básica. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para surtir su negocio con productos comestibles ya que se acerca la temporada de navidad y las ventas aumentan. Keiry espera crecer como comerciante para ayudar a sus padres y hermanas.
texts.en:
Señora Keiry is 22 years old and lives with her parents and two sisters in the village of Nuevo Jalapa  in the Nuevo Celilac municipality.  Keiry is single and has no children.

Keiry was a nurse at a local hospital, but 8 months ago, with the help of her parents, she decided to start up her own business so that she didn't need to depend on other people for employment.  She opened her convenience store in March, and works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day serving her customers.  She sells grocery items and everything needed for household basics.

She requested this loan of L10,000 to stock up her business with grocery products, as the Christmas season is nearing when her sales increase.  Keiry hopes to grow as a business woman, so that she can help support her parents and her sisters.

loans.use: for the purchase of grocery products.

loans.name: Bulicho B Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Bulicho B group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 7½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bulicho B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Moses is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: Melania mujer emprendedora, comerciante desde hace un tiempo, oficio costurera, los planes que sus hijos alcance estudiar una carrera, obtara a mejor salario un futuro mejor que el de ella. Con el préstamo anterior logro construir las paredes de los cuartos y para este nuevo ciclo de préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales como: láminas de zinc corrugadas, perlines, golosas, pintura contra oxidación, entre otros materiales entechado los cuartos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su proyecto de construir su vivienda por completo obteniendo seguridad, comodidad para su familia.
texts.en: Melania is an enterprising businesswoman who’s been sewing for some time.  Her plans include her children having careers and making more money than she’s been able to make.  She used the money from the previous loan to build the walls in her home and this loan will be used to buy corrugated zinc sheeting, iron bars, finishing, anti-rust paint, and other things to finish the rooms.  She appreciates the financial support for her home building project, helping to improve the security and comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet, de 29 años, es una mujer buena y muy trabajadora, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella a diario trabaja mucho y dedica su tiempo a sus hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir y su motivo de seguir progresando. Juntos habitan en casa de su abuelita. El trabajo de Janet consiste en la crianza de animales de corral, entre los animales que cría tiene cerdos y patos, los vende solo cuando tiene pedidos entre sus conocidos y algunos clientes. Para ello acondicionó un lugar en la huerta de su casa, el lugar cuenta con todas las medidas sanitarias y de espacio reglamentario, lleva realizando este trabajo por seis meses y le esta yendo bien,  trabaja sola y esta en proceso de intensificarse en el negocio. Día a día aprende más y con esto cada paso que da es con algo de un aprendizaje, ahora espera llegar las fiesta de fin de año para aumentar sus ventas, ya que estos animales se cotizan a mayor precio y le da mayor ganancia. Este será el sexto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales para construcir un lugar más amplio para sus chanchos, además de abastecerse con alimentos balanceados y algunas vitaminas para fortalecer a sus animales.
texts.en:
Janet, age 29, is a hardworking woman. She is married and has four children. Janet's family is the most important thing in her life and she works hard everyday to take care of her children and to improve their lives. The family lives in Janet's grandmother's house. 

Janet raises livestock and poultry, including pigs and ducks, in her garden. The space is large enough to meet sanitary regulations. She sells the animals on request from her customers and acquaintances. The business is six months old and doing well. Janet runs the business by herself and is in the process of expanding. She learns more and more each day, and treats each phase of her business as a learning process. She is looking forward to the upcoming holiday season, when prices and demand both rise. 

This will be Janet's sixth loan from MFP. The loan will allow her to reach her business goals, and she is committed once again to paying her loan installments on time. Janet is grateful to be a member of her community bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive. With the 2,000 PEN, Janet will buy building materials to expand her pig pen, as well as a larger supply of enriched feed and vitamins for her animals.

loans.use: o buy building materials for her pig pen, enriched feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La  Sra. Benita tiene 47 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Ibarra hace más de 19 años, tienen dos hijos, uno de 17 y otro de 5 años, los cuales son el por que de la lucha diaria de ellos.
Ella es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanía como frazadas, manteles y otros, mientras que su marido tiene un pequeño transporte público interno y así se ayudan mutuamente con los ingresos para el hogar. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindar a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar, de manera que puedan acceder a una profesión y el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer frazadas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes debido a que en época de verano los costos son menores y muchas personas aprovechan las ofertas.
texts.en:
Benita is 47 years old and has been married to Ibarra for more than 19 years. She has two children, one 17 and one 5 years of age, and they are why she struggles every day.

She is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She works making and selling handicrafts such as blankets, tablecloths, and other items, while her husband has a little internal public transport and thus together they earn the daily bread. Thanks to her work and strength she could provide her children all the comforts and at the same time pay schooling fees, so that they can obtain a profession and become good people.

She is asking for a loan to buy thread and dyes in order to weave blankets that in this season are much requested by her clients because in the summer the cost is less and many people take advantage of the offers.

loans.use: to buy thread and dye in order to weave

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando a sus 62 años de edad es padre de 8 hijos, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. El señor Fernando tiene más de 40 años de experiencia en la cría de cerdos, actividad con la que sacó adelantes a todos sus hijos y la cual hereda de su padre. La jornada de trabajo del señor Fernando es de todos los días de la semana. El señor Fernando desea comprar una cerda que pueda criar, puesto que varios cerdos se han muerto y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos; asimismo necesita comprar cuido para alimentar a sus cerdos. El señor Fernando sueña con ver crecer su negocio y tener un buen patrimonio para dejarle a sus hijos una buena estabilidad económica y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fernando, 62, is the father of 8 children.  He is a pig merchant.  Fernando has more than 40 years’ experience raising pigs, an activity that allowed him to raise all his children and which he inherited from his father.  Fernando works every day of the week.  He wants to buy a sow to breed because several of his pigs have died and this way he can increase income; he also needs to buy pig feed for his pigs.  Fernando dreams with seeing his business grow and to have a good estate to leave his children good economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a breeding sow and pig feed.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la mecánica, tiene un laboratorio de bombas inyectoras desde hace varios años, lo que hace en forma conjunta con su padre el Sr.Francisco.
Su lugar de trabajo se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de la Ciudad de Itá, donde atiende a una gran cantidad de clientes, lo cual lo ayuda mucho, pues eso le genera muy buenos ingresos. El se define como una persona muy trabajadora que a su corta edad ya se encuentra manejando su propio negocio.
Nos comenta que su meta es seguir creciendo cada día mas, por lo que solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de herramientas para utilizar dentro de su taller, pues son muy importantes para que siga trabajando.
texts.en: Hugo, 25, lives in the city of Itá.  He is a mechanic.  He’s had an injection pump lab for several years that he runs together with his father.  His workplace is located in a strategic spot in the city of Itá where he has a large number of customers which is great help to him because it generates good income.  He defines himself as a hardworking person who at his young age is already running his own business.  He comments that his goal is to continue growing more every day so is asking for a loan to buy work tools to use in his shop because they are very important in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: El señor  Mario Alberto es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Trabaja en una maquiladora en el día y de noche trabaja en taxi para así obtener más ingresos y así suplir los gastos del hogar. Desde hace varios años el obtuvo su casa de interés social, la cual le ha estado haciendo mejoras, este sacrificio que hace es para darles una mejor comodidad a sus 2 hijos junto con su esposa. El proyecto que el tiene es terminar de levantar una barda en la parte de frontal ya que en el crédito anterior no le fue suficiente para que quedara totalmente hecha. Solo levanto las bardas laterales que dan hacia el vecino. Para Mario es muy importante ofrecer a su familia seguridad por lo que necesita comprar material como block, cemento arena, varilla y pagar la mano de obra, de esta manera el podrá irse tranquilo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto is a hardworking man determined to offer his family a better quality of life.  He works at an assembly plant during the day and at night drives a taxi to earn extra income and be able to meet household expenses.  

Several years ago he obtained his government-subsidized house that he’s been making improvements to. This sacrifice he makes is to provide more comfort to his wife and two children.

The project he has is to finish erecting a front wall since the previous loan didn’t quite suffice to finish the job.  He was only able to erect the lateral walls that face his neighbor.  For Mario, it’s very important to offer his family security and to do so he needs to buy materials like concrete block, cement, sand, rebar and to pay labor costs.  This way he will be able to go to work with peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy building materials to erect a wall.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro de 73 años es casado; hace treinta años el tenia 2 prioridades en su vida, la primera era dejarles a sus hijos, la mejor herencia seria terminar su Educación Escolar y la otra era que cuando el y su esposa llegaran a la vejez tuvieran un lugar digno donde pasar sus últimos días y ambas prioridades fueron realizadas, para él  su hogar es muy  cálido y la  comodidad con la que hoy vive es el esfuerzo de muchos  años de trabajo, es una casa pequeña que tiene lo necesario para ser felices y puedan recibir a sus hijos y nietos   en épocas importantes. Solo que el tiene un problema en el techo de su casa y se trasmina el agua; este cae justo donde se encuentra el foco de la sala, por lo que no puede prender el foco en épocas de lluvia porque le puede generar un corto circuito, el anhela que para navidad el techo de su casa ya este reconstruido y evitar este problema de la gotera justo en el foco porque de otra manera seria este año 2011 en el que él no pudiera recibir a sus hijos en Navidad en su casa y tenían que irse a la casa de alguno de sus hijos. La mayor satisfacción que él tiene es ver reunida a toda su familia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 73 years old and married.  Thirty years ago he had two priorities in life, one was to make sure his children finished their educations and the other was to be sure that he and his wife had a place to spend stay in their later years.  He met both of those goals.  His home is warm and the fruit of all the effort he put forth through many years of working.  It’s a small house, but has all the necessities for them to be happy and have their children and grandchildren visit during important seasons.

The only problem he’s having is with the roof leaking and the water is entering into the living room near the light.  He is unable to use the lights during the rainy season because of short circuits.  He would like to have the roof replaced befor Christmas, otherwise he won’t be able to host his children for Christmas this year, and they will have to go to one of their homes.  His main satisfaction will come from having all of his family in his home.

loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Silongelo B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Silongelo B Group in Western Kenya! Rose is the facilitator of the Silongelo B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rose takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Silongelo B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Rose with her group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ayudanos Senor 3 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Cleotilde is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Senor (Help Us, Lord) 3 & 7, a group made up of mostly Haitian citizens. They are located in the city of La Romana, where decades ago Haitians emigrated to work in the sugarcane industry. They all live in a rural community outside of the main city. This kind of communities are called Batey, which are villages founded for sugarcane workers.

Cleotilde and her long-term partner make their home here in a simple structure with their three children. Their community is "a Batey", where most of the people live without services and where it is necessary to go to a closer city to get everything they want.

Cleotilde's excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has been running her business for almost three years. She started investing in calling cards when many people bought prepaid cellphones because they need to buy calling cards to recharge their mobile credits, and over time she started buying clothes to sell. Since this happened, she has been dedicated to vending clothes and calling cards, and she is also adding other products like shoes and cosmetics. 

She will use this loan to purchase clothing, shoes, and miscellaneous products. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudio es de la ciudad de Luque, está casado, tiene 36 años. El en conjunto a sus esposa tienen una joyeria y una despensa en su domicilio, tienen tres hijos uno de 11, otro de 5 y 2 años respectivamente.
El Sr. desde siempre se dedico a la joyería, empezó como ayudante, su señora fue costurera por varios años, con los ahorros que poseían y varios prestamos abrieron para su taller de Joyas y una despensa en su domicilio. Actualmente cuenta con varios clientes, lo cual les ayuda a mantener la casa y cubrir todos los gastos diarios de la casa.
El solicita el crédito para abastecer su joyería con pulseras, anillos, cadenas y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudio is from the city of Luque.  He’s married and he’s 36 years old.  Together with his wife he owns a home-based jewelry store and a grocery store.  They have three children who are 11, 5 and 2 years old respectively.

He has always worked in jewelry having started out as a street vendor.  His wife was a seamstress for many years.  With the savings they had and with several loans they opened their jewelry and their grocery store at home.  Currently, he has several customers which allows him to support his household and cover daily household expenses.  He’s asking for the loan to stock his jewelry store with bracelets, rings, chains and other types of jewelry to have more variety on hand to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Mahussi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUSSI est composé de trois personnes qui se connaissent de par leurs activité. C'est la troisième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Dossi Gisèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dossi Gisèle est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Dossi Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dossi Gisèle est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Justin. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Dossi Gisèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Dossi Gisèle vend depuis quatre ans, des glacières et des assiettes par le système de distribution. Dossi Gisèle s’approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dossi Gisèle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUSSI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUSSI group is composed of three people who know one another because of their businesses. It is the third time that this group has asked for financial aid from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business activity. The leader of the group, Dossi Gisèle, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. Dossi Gisèle is 29 years old and lives in Bénin. Dossi Gisèle did not attend school. Dossi Gisèle is married to a driver named Justin. The couple has four children all in school and in their care. In addition to their children, the couple has another child to support. Dossi Gisèle lives together with her husband and their children. In order to handle the diverse family expenses, Dossi Gisèle has sold coolers and plates for four years using the distribution system. Dossi Gisèle stocks up in Togo. In the quest for client satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Dossi Gisèle seeks together with the other members of the MAHUSSI group, a third loan from ALIDé, The first two loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy coolers and plates

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past four years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his fresh produce shop, in which he sells mainly coffee and maize.

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to find a second source of income.

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas es casado tiene 39 años tiene una hija y un hijo, su hija  ya no depende económicamente es soltera, su hijo menor  está estudiando la educación Secundaria.  El sr. Tomas ve en su hijo  la posibilidad de tenga un mejor futuro y sabe que la única forma de lograrlo es preparándolo para el que termine una carrera universitaria, el tiene todas sus ilusiones puestas en este hijo ya que su hija primogénita estudio únicamente la educación media superior por ver las carencias económicas que había en su hogar y él como padre no quiere ver como su hijo menor trunque su educación al ver que hay necesidad en su hogar, el Sr. Tomas está decidido a trabajar por siempre para que su hijo sea termine una carrera, su hijo necesita una computadora para hacer sus trabajos que le encargan en la escuela ya que en los últimos meses ha estado pagando en renta de computadoras e impresiones y en ocasiones no ha llevado tareas por falta de dinero para la renta de un equipo de computo. Tomas solicita el apoyo para poder adquirir esta computadora y facilitarle la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomas is 39 years old and married.  He has a son and a daughter, but her daughter no longer depends on them financially.  Their young son attends high school.  He sees in his son the potential for a better future and he knows that the only way to achieve this is to prepare him for university.  He has all his dreams riding on his son, because his daughter only studied to junior high school because of the household financial difficulties.  As a father, he doesn’t want his son to miss out on his education because of other needs within the household.

Tomas is always working, so that his son will be able to establish himself in a career.  His son needs a computer to be able to do his homework.  He’s been renting a computer and printer for the past few months and there have been times when he has not been able to complete his homework due to lack of money to pay for computer rentals.  Tomas is asking for support to be able to acquire this computer and facilitate his children’s educations.

loans.use: to buy a computer for homework.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El Sr. Agustín es de ciudad del este está casado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales los 3 aun son pequeños y están en la escuela primaria. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle un buen futuro a sus hijos, ya que ellos son su razon de ser, de él y de su esposa.
Tienen una despensa bien surtida  donde trabajan desde muy tempranas horas, tanto el como su esposa. Se iniciaron en la actividad con una platita que recibió Agustín como parte de una indemnización de un trabajo anterior. 
Agustín  además de su despensa trabaja con una huerta  donde planta lechuga, mandioca y otras hortalizas para que con la venta de ellos  pueda ayudar a abastecer su despensa. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, fideos, arroz, enlatados y demás insumos para poder abastecer su almacén.
texts.en:
Agustín is from Ciudad del Este.  He’s married and has three children all of which are still little and going to elementary school.  He comments that all his efforts are aimed at providing a better future for his children since they are his and his wife’s reason for living.
