They have a well-stocked store where they work from very early in the day, both he and his wife.  They started the business with a little money Agustín got as part of a severance pay from a previous job.

In addition to working in his store, Agustín also has a farm where he grows lettuce, manioc and other vegetables and with earnings from their sales he’s able to stock his store.  He is a very responsible person who very much wants to get ahead.  He has a jovial, enterprising spirit and there’s no doubt that he will reach all the goals he’s set for himself.

He is requesting the loan to buy beverages, noodles, rice, canned goods and other supplies to stock his store

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers.

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like sugar, soap, and rice, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children to higher levels.

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more items like sugar, soap, and rice.

loans.name: Los Pinos De Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS DE CORAZON” iniciará su primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Francisca. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de bolsas desechables, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de juguetes americanos, venta de pollo a la brosterh.

La señora Francisca  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comida (pollos a la Brosther  que viene trabajando hace años atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de viveres) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The Los Pinos de Corazon group will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Senkata. The group is made up of six members and they have a board headed by Francisca. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied and among them we have: disposable bags, candy sales, food sales, sales of American toys, and broasted chicken.

Francisca says that this is the first cycle that she has worked with Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of a promotion. Currently she has a food business, broasting chickens, that she started some years ago.

The loan that she is asking for will be used to raise capital for the purchase of supplies that she will buy from Ceja [an area in La Paz with a huge daily market] and which later she will market and sell in her store. This form of work permits her to earn income in order to support her family as much as possible. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her food business

loans.name: El Sueño Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El sueño del futuro” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de artículos de librería, ventas de ropa, artesanía en lana, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Angelina integrante y delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ubicada en el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera manga larga color negro, jeans azules, su cabello está tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la repostería, específicamente chocolatería desde hace tres años. Comenta que aprendió cuando ayudaba con las labores a su cuñada.
Los chocolates y bombones los producen en su casa por las mañanas y los envasa y distribuye por las tardes, en almacenes y ferias artesanales. 
Su mercadería la compra una vez por semana en distintas distribuidoras. 
Comenta que le va muy bien y tiene bastante clientela, sin embargo cuando las ventas disminuyen reemplaza su producción con cuchuflis (galleta cilíndrica, rellena con manjar). Comenta que está postulando a un proyecto para vender sus productos en una feria artesanal y poder instalarse. 
Con el crédito comprará insumos para el negocio de los chocolates, cuchuflis y bombones. 
Sus metas son expandir su negocio para otras comunas, para esto necesita comprar un vehículo que le permita trasladarse. Además le gustaría brindarles trabajo a personas que lo necesiten. 
Angelina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 4 y 2 años de edad, la mayor asiste al colegio por lo que puede flexibilizar sus horarios de acuerdo a sus tiempos libres. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que se ha generado confianza y respeto entre los integrantes. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “El Sueño del Futuro," has 17 enterprising members who all work in different activities, including: selling office supplies, clothing sales, wool handicrafts, among others.  They all live in the city of Concepción.  Angelina, a member and representative for the group, is found in the photograph in the first row, second from the left, in a long-sleeved black polo shirt, blue jeans, and hair tied in a ponytail. 

She has had a confectionery business, specifically, a chocolate business, for three years.  She comments that she learned this trade by helping her sister-in-law with this type of work.  She produces the chocolates and chocolate truffles in her house in the mornings, and in the afternoons she packages them and distributes them to the stores and handicraft markets.  She buys her merchandise once a week from various distributors.  

She comments that the business is going very well, and she has quite a few customers.  However, when her sales fall off, she produces "cuchuflis," a cylindrical cookie with a sweet caramel filling.  She says that she is making a plan to sell her products in a handicraft market where she can set up a sales post.

With this loan, she will buy supplies for her business making chocolates, chocolate truffles and cuchuflis.

Her goal is to expand her business to other townships, and to do this she needs to buy a vehicle so that she could get around.  In addition, she would like to be able to provide jobs for people who need them.  

Angela lives with her husband and their two daughters aged 4 and 2.  The oldest attends school; she can arrange her schedule according to her free time.  

Angela is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  In addition, she feels very comfortable with her communal bank, since she has gained confidence and respect for the members.  

Concepción is seated at the mouth of the Biobío river, one of the largest in the country, in the Biobío region in the south of Chile. This region has played an important role in our country, being at the center of important battles, such as the War of Arauco, and related settlements, since it borders the Mapuche territory. The city is currently undergoing significant economic and demographic development.   It is increasingly considered as one of the most important urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business making chocolates, cookies and chocolate truffles

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos está casado, tiene dos hijos, uno en edad escolar. Es de ciudad del Este, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, en la feria de Ciudad del Este los días miércoles, jueves y viernes, también vende en la zona de Minga Guazú los demás días de la semana. Su venta cada vez más está en ascenso, y le otorga un buen ingreso, pues siempre tiene muy buenos productos.
Cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, gracias a la cual están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, lo cual lo ha ayudado a mantener a su familia y también a su propio negocio. El solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de 
frutas y verduras de estación, con la cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has 2 children, one of whom is school-aged.  He is from Ciudad del Este, and he tells us that he has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Ciudad del Este market on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays.  He also sells in the Minga Guazu area the other days of the week.  His sales have been rising over time as he always has very good products, and this business provides him with a good income.  He relies on the help of his wife, and thanks to her they are getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and dedication.

Now he is a successful small businessman with a sizable and loyal customer base, and this has helped him to support his family and his business.  

He requests the help of the Fundación in order to buy fruits and vegetables that are currently in season, so that he can stock up his business and meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to later sell   .

loans.name: Semoe

texts.en:
Semoe is 37 years old and lives in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Semoe has been working hard to manage his hardware store, which sells tools, cement, nails and other products. 

To help expand his business, Semoe has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings(UGX)  from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more construction supplies for resale, and will help Semoe to generate greater profits and pay for his child's school fees. Semoe hopes that in the future he will be able to finish building his home.

Semoe is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Semoe who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena es de ciudad del Este, tiene un hijo, el cual ella ha criado sola, con mucho trabajo y sacrificio, el cual aun se encuentra en edad escolar.
Ella se dedica a la peluquería, mediante el cual ha podido salir adelante y mantener a su hijo y también a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, a la cual le gusta trabajar sin depender de nadie. Gracias a su trabajo hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato y buen trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, tijeras, gel, shampoo, cremas hidratantes y demás productos necesarios para abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues la ayuda le será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
Elena is from Ciudad del Este.  She has a school-aged son that she has been raising on her own, with a lot of work and sacrifice.  She has a hair salon, and this has been the means through which she has been able to get ahead and provide for her son and also for her family.  She is described as a very hardworking, tenacious and enterprising woman, who enjoys working and not having to depend on anyone.  Thanks to her work, she is now a successful small businesswoman who has a lot of customers, due to the good work that she does and the good treatment that she gives her customers.  

Elena requests this loan to buy hair dyes, hair weaves, hair gel, shampoo, hydrating creams and other products she needs to stock her business.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity that they are providing her, as this assistance will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: hair dyes, hair weaves, hair gel, shampoo, hydrating creams and other products

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Edicto is one of the members of the El gran esfuerzo ("the great effort") 1, 2 & 3 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. This group is dedicated mostly to the door-to-door business, carrying their products by walking in different communities.

Edicto is a hardworking father of six children. He lives with two of them and their mother, and the rest of his children are living in their own home and some in Haiti. He tells us that his biggest challenge is to have his own house, and he is saving his business profits to start building it. He operates a clothing sales business, and with this loan he will invest by purchasing products like pants, blouses, shirts, and underwear.

Edicto is very excited to receive his tenth loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid his previous loan. He has had his business for about six years. He started with the first loan he received from us. His dream is to have a house and to live quietly in it with his family.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Waiswa

texts.en:
Waiswa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past six years, Waiswa has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells women's clothes.

To help expand his business, Waiswa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dresses, blouses, and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomesi, and will help Waiswa to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Waiswa hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children to higher levels. 

Waiswa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Waiswa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more dresses, blouses, and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomesi.

loans.name: Allan Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Allan tiene 32 años y vive en la aldea de Villa Real en el municipio de Villanueva.  Es casado y su esposa Alba trabaja con él en el negocio. La pareja tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.  

Desde pequeño don Allan ha trabajado en la soldadura. Su padre le enseñó el oficio. Hace 5 años, Allan dejó de ser futbolista para iniciar su propio taller de soldadura. Trabaja 5 horas al día en la construcción de portones, verjas, balcones y techos. 

Solicitó este crédito de L14,000 para surtir su taller con la compra de materiales. Espera ver crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Allan is 32 years old and lives in the village of Villa Real  in the Villanueva municipality.  He is married, and his wife Alba works with him in his business.  They have a two-year-old son.

Since he was young, Don Allan has worked as a solderer.  His father taught him the trade.  Five years ago, Allan left off from being a footballer to start his own soldering workshop.  He works five hours a day making gates, railings, balconies and roofs.

He requested this loan of L14,000 to stock up his workshop by purchasing materials.  He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Masimu

texts.en:
Masimu is 32 years old and lives in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past four years, Masimu has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Masimu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice and maize flour, and will help Masimu to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Masimu hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger shop that provides quality goods.

Masimu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Masimu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Bakali

texts.en:
For the past nine years Bakali, a 35-year-old resident of the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda, has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers.

To help expand his business, Bakali has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more food products for resale, which will help him to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Bakali hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more groceries stores.

Bakali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bakali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, who lives in Changamwe, Mombasa, owns a butchery which has been in existence for five years and employs two other people. He also drives a public transport vehicle. He is married and has two children, neither of whom is in school.

Josphat is requesting a loan of ksh 40,000 to help him purchase more cattle for slaughter. His main challenge is the periodic scarcity of cattle, which drives prices up. Josphat states that the additional income arising from the loan will help him meet the family's daily requirements and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Asuwa

texts.en:
Asuwa is 34 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Asuwa has been working hard to manage her clothes store, which makes and sells different types of clothing. 

To help expand her business, Asuwa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials to make clothes, and will help Asuwa to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Asuwa hopes that in the future she will be able to continue expanding her business. 

Asuwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asuwa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has ten children.  Seven of his children are currently in school. For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his business, which sells matresses. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mattresses for resale, and it will help John to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. John hopes that in the future he will be able to become a mattress supplier for the entire eastern Uganda region. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has three school going children. He runs a chemist (pharmacy) which has been in operation for the last three years. He employs two more people in his current business.
He was invited to Milango by his colleague and decided to join in order to access credit to fund his business. Joshua is applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase more pharmaceutical drugs and cosmetics for sale. Joshua sees no major challenge facing his business. His business is located in an area of much activity. It is believed that the market next to his premise is the largest open air market south of the Sahara.
The extra income will help Joshua provide good education to his children. He also intends to open a cereal shop from the income.

loans.use: To purchase more pharmaceutical drugs and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has been selling water to her neighbors in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya for five years. The increase in population around where she stays has caused a high demand for water. She is married and has five children; three are in school. She also sells cooked food to her neighbors.
Saumu is therefore applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to buy more tanks and install pipes. Her main challenge in life has been the lack of capital, but she is proud of her association with Milango because she can now access credit to carry out business.  
Her aim is to build a restaurant in future as she believes this will help improve the living standard of her family while also enabling her to educate those in school.

loans.use: To buy more tanks and install pipes.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El sr. Edwin se dedica  al servicio de reparación de maquinas, es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 1 año y 6 meses, no convive con la madre del niño,  pero el se hace cargo de su hijito con lo que es la manutención y algunos gastos extras, el sr. Edwin vive en la casa de sus padres hace varios años junto a sus hermanos cada uno de ellos independientes, el se dedica al mantenimiento y reparación de maquinas peladoras hace 2 años, es muy cotizado por su trabajo ya que no hay muchos técnicos en esta especialidad su trabajo lo desempeña en la localidad de Sacaba, el préstamo lo invertirá para compra herramientas para realizar su trabajo, es un joven muy trabajador, con ganas de superación, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señor Edwin  works as a machine repairman for a living.  He is single, but has a 1 1/2 year old child.  He doesn't live with his child's mother, but he pays child support and some extra expenses.  Señor Edwin has lived with his parents for several years along with his siblings, all of whom are adults.  He has  been maintaining and repairing peeling machines for 2 years.  His work is highly valued as there aren't many technicians in this field.   He works in the town of Sacaba.  He will use the loan to buy work tools.  

He is a hard-working young man who is eager to excel.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: purchase tools for maintaining and repairing peeling machines.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She has lost her husband and is now supporting six children, one of whom is currently attending school. For seven years, Mary has been working very hard to build up her small pharmacy, which sells various medicine and supplements to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan money to purchase more medicine for her shop, and wants to use her extra profits to renovate her house. In the future, Mary hopes to change her drug shop into a larger dispensary.

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new stock of groceries such as fruits, vegetables, rice, etc.

loans.name: Syliver

texts.en:
Syliver is 29 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He has a lovely wife and for the past three years, has been working hard to build up his retail shop, which sells different kinds of food and home products to local customers.

To help expand his business, Syliver has requested a loan of 2.5 million Uganda Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan money will be used to buy more food items for resale, and will help Syliver to generate more profits and expand his business. Syliver hopes that in the future, he will be able to build a house for him and his wife.

Syliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Syliver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale

loans.name: Ngugi

texts.en:
Ngugi lives in the Mariakani area of the Coastal Province, Kenya.  She is married with two children, both of whom are in high school; one in the first year and the other in the third year. Ngugi has a kiosk which she uses to sell fruits e.g. bananas, mangoes and sugarcane. She has been in this business for the last ten years and it is an idea she got from a friend who used to sell coconuts. Ngugi has been a Milango client for six weeks and she intends to get this loan to build a permanent kiosk where she will begin a grocery shop.
She is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables.
Ngugi is committed to having a very big grocery shop in the future.
Ngugi will be able to cater to the needs of her family using the income obtained and also pay fees for her children who are in school since her husband is not working.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El señor Héctor Manuel de 44 años es casado y tiene a su cargo un hijo que depende de el económicamente. Hace 19 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, la cual fue haciendo mejoras y donde vio crecer a sus hijos. Para Héctor es muy importante tener en buenas condiciones su vivienda ya que es el lugar que lo cubre de las inclemencias del tiempo. En este momento quiere construir un portal en la parte de enfrente, para que al momento de querer descansar ahí poner su silla y respirar aire puro. El trabaja como voceador de un periódico de la localidad ofreciéndolo en una calle principal. Para que el proyecto se realice necesita comprar  cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Héctor Manuel is 44 years old, married and has a son who depends on him financially.  Nineteen years ago he acquired his home, to which he’s been making improvements, and where he watched his children grow, through a public housing project.  It’s very important for Hector to have his home in good condition, because it protects him from inclement weather.  At this time he wants to build a doorway in the front part of the house, so that he can relax there, set up his chair and breathe in the fresh air.  He works as a salesman for a local newspaper, selling on a main street in town.  In order to be able to complete his project, he must buy cement, sand, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to build a doorway in his home.

loans.name: Laider

texts.es: Laider, de 46 años, es una hombre bueno y trabajador, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos menores y todavia dependen de él para continuar con sus estudios. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el kilómetro 26 de la ciudad. El trabajo de Laider consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad y bebidas. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además se dedica a la siembra de cítrico, actividad que lo ejecuta en la chacra que le cedieron sus suegros. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 15 años, trabaja solo pero en ocasiones debe contratar peones. Él se inició con pequeñas siembras pero con el tiempo ha logrado una buena productividad y a la vez ampliar la siembra, ahora sus margenes de ventas son altas. Le esta yendo muy bien, pues ambas actividades se están desarrollando de la mejor manera. Este será el préstamo número 18 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos recibidos. Esta muy contento de pertenecer a su grupo, ya que el es fundador y siempre esta en espera que les vaya bien ya que lucharon mucho para consolidarlo y mantenerse como buenos clientes. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará bebidas, productos de primera necesidad, y contratar peones para que realicen la limpieza de campos y ayudar en la cosecha de frutas cítricas.
texts.en:
Laider, 46, is a good and hardworking man. He lives with his common-law couple with whom he has 3 young children. His children still depend on him to continue with their studies. Together, they live in his house located in the 26th kilometer of the city. Laider works in the sale of basic consumer goods and drinks. He has a small grocery store in his house. 

He also works planting citrus fruits, which he does in the field his parents-in-law gave him. He has been planting for 15 years. He usually works alone, but sometimes needs to hire laborers. He started out at a small scale, but with time he has improved his productivity and expanded his farming. Now, his sales margins are higher. He's doing really well, since both business activities are developing in the best possible way. 

This will be his 18th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP) and he hopes to receive everyone's help to continue with his objectives. He pledges to make his payments on time, like with his prior loans. He's very happy to belong to this group, since he is the founder and is always hopinh that eveyrthing goes well with them given their considerable effort to form the team and maintain their status as good clients. 

With the requested loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, he will buy soft drinks, basic consumer goods, and hire laborers to clean the fields and help harvest the citrus fruits.

loans.use: to buy products and drinks to stock his store and hire laborers.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia, de 22 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy emprendedora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 5 y 1 año, ellos son su motivo de trabajo, esfuerzo y sacrificio, pues desea brindarles siempre lo mejor y mejorar su calidad de vida. JUntos habitan en casa de sus padres junto a ellos. El trabajo de Lilia consiste en la compra y venta de ganado, sale los fines de semana a la ganadería del distrito, ahí busca a los mejores ganados y los que están a mejor precio. Una vez comprados son sacrificados en el camal, lugar donde trabaja y expende la carne a sus clientes. Se indicio en este negocio con otro tipo de animales, con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora se dedica exclusivamente a lo venta de carne de res. Lleva trabajando así ya por tres años y lo hace a lado de su conviviente quien siempre la apoya en el trabajo encargandose de lo más pesado, mientras ella se encarga de administrar, así tiene tiempo de cuidar a sus hijos. Gana un promedio de 30% de su inversión y desde que empezó a trabajar con este negocio le esta yendo mejor ya que antes tenia muchos problemas económicos ya que no había mayores ingresos. Ella como toda mujer emprendedora desea hacer crecer su negocio. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual y responsable todas sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará más cabezas de ganado para seguir expendiendo carne de res.
texts.en:
Lilia, 22, is a friendly, and very enterprising young woman. She lives with her partner, and they have two children, ages five and one. They are the reason for her work, effort, and sacrifice, as she wants to always provide them with the best, and improve their quality of life. They live in her parents' house. 

Lilia buys and sells cattle. On the weekends she goes out to the local cattle farms, and looks for the best cattle, and those that are the best price. Once she buys them, they are slaughtered in the abattoir where she works, and then the meat is sent to her customers. 

She started off in this business with other types of animals. With time, her business gradually grew, and now she sells beef exclusively. She has been working at this for three years now, and does it alongside her partner.  He always supports her, by looking after the heaviest work, while she looks after the running of the business, so she has time to take care of their children. 

She earns an average of 30% on her investment, and since she began to work in this business, it's been going better for her.  Previously, she had many financial problems, as there wasn't a lot of income. 

As all enterprising women do, she wishes to see her business grow. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, so she is hoping for your contribution so that she can continue working toward her goals. Moreover, she is once again committed to paying her instalments responsibly, and on time. 

With the amount of 2,000 soles that she is applying for, she will buy more head of cattle, so that she can continue selling beef.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Rosa has two children and they live together with her father. She tells us that her greatest challenge now is to have her own house. She loves going to church and to work.

Rosa is very excited to be receiving her 11th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans and thereby given a step forward in the growth of her business. She has had her business for around 11 years. She set up her business with a small amount of savings which she was keeping for business purposes and she started growing it with her first loan from Esperanza. She is planning to invest her new loan in buying different styles of clothes. Now is Christmas season and people are needing to buy a lot of goods, which is the reason why she will be prepared for Christmas sales. She plans to use her profits to buy things she needs and start building her house.

Rosa is one of the members of 'El Gran Esfuerzo' (The Big Effort) 4 7 5 group which is located in the town of Hato Mayor. The town's economy depends on farming and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. The city population is Dominicans and emigrant Haitians. The group's main business activity is selling clothes, and most of the members which compounded this group are Haitians immigrants.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nerva

texts.es: Nerva, de 28 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 8, 6, 2 y el menor de todos que recién tiene 1 mes de nacido. Ella junto a su pareja, trabajan mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y así asegurarles una buena educación y tener un futuro mejor. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, que lograron obtener con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Nerva consiste en la venta de carne de res, negocio que lo realiza desde hace mucho tiempo en su casa. Ahora desea hacerlo pero en el mercado de su ciudad. Por lo que espera que le vaya mejor que antes, sabe que el reto es complicado pero tienes todas las ganas de sobre salir hasta que su negocio se consolide. Este será el crédito número 6 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo puntual con sus pagos y cuotas programadas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Le encanta pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará carne para empezar su venta en el mercado, además comprará algunos implementos necesarios para empezar con su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Nerva, 28, is a kind, friendly, and very hard-working woman. She lives with her partner, and they have four children, ages eight, six, two, and the youngest of all, a one month-old newborn.  She and her partner work hard to provide a better quality of life for their family, and to make sure they have a good education and a better future. They live together in their own house, that they managed to get with a great deal of effort. 

Nerva sells beef. She has been doing this work for a long time in her house. Now she wishes to do it in the city market. So she is hoping that things will go better for her than before. She knows that this is a complex challenge, but is very eager to do her best, until her business is well-established. 
 
This will be her sixth loan with MFP, so she hopes for your contribution so that she can continue working toward her goals. Moreover, she is committed to continuing to be on time with her payments and scheduled instalments, as she was with her previous loans. 

She loves belonging to her communal bank, as everyone is very responsible and supportive. With the amount applied for,  2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy meat to start selling in the market.  In addition, she will buy a few implements she needs to begin her new project.

loans.use: To buy more meat, and implements for her meat stand.

loans.name: Alba Doris

texts.es: La señora Alba Doris a sus 43 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa y productos por catálogo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años. La señora Alba Doris desea comprar mercancía tal como prendas de vestir femenina y masculina, con el fin de tener surtido para la temporada de fin de año. Asimismo, lo anterior le permitirá incrementar las ventas y podrá brindarle a su único hijo bienestar y una buena calidad de vida. El deseo de la señora Alba Doris es ver crecer su negocio y a futuro tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Alba Doris is 43, and sells merchandise such as clothing, as well as products by catalogue. She has been doing this work for many years. Alba Doris wishes to buy merchandise, such as articles of women's and men's clothing, with the aim of having stock for the year-end season.  

This will allow her to increase her sales. She will be able to provide for the well-being of her only son, and give him a good quality of life. Alba Doris wishes to see her business grow, and in future to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 46 años, es un hombre muy fuerte, amante de la naturales y muy trabajador, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene siete hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes y los otros cinco tienen 19, 17, 12, 9 y 2 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Pedro consiste en la siembra de arroz en una chacra que alquila, aprovecha las condiciones del lugar, en época de lluvia los siembra y brinda los cuidados necesarios para poder ver crecer de a poco a sus plantas. Lleva realizando este trabajo por dos años, lo hace con la ayuda de alguno de sus hijos quienes están aprendiendo cada día mas y mas sobre el trabajo con el cual su padre les puede brindar educación y alimentación. Le va muy bien ya que tiene buenas ventas, es proveedor de tres molinos importantes de la región quienes están siempre a la expectativa que lleve sus productos a venderlos, ya que siembra uno de los mejores productos de la región. Al principio le fue complicado realizar este trabajo ya que no tenía mucho conocimiento, pero aprovecho algunas charlas que le dieron en unos talleres y aprendió todo lo que necesitaba. No se considera un experto pero los conocimientos que tiene le permite cosechar un buen producto. Desea mas adelante tener su propia chacra ya que cuando alquila se le va parte de su ganancia, además desea poner una bodega en su casa en donde su conviviente pueda vender y generar un ingreso adicional a su economía. Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos para montar su tienda en su casa, además de invertir un poco en el pago de peones para el mantenimiento de su chacra.
texts.en:
Pedro, 46, is a very strong man, a lover of nature, and very hard-working. He lives with his partner, and they have seven children, two of whom are now adults and on their own. The other five are ages 19, 17, 12, 9, and 2.  They live together in their own house, that they managed to buy with a lot of effort. 

Pedro grows rice on a small farm that he rents. He takes advantage of local conditions; in the rainy season he plants his crop, and provides the necessary care to see his plants grow little by little. 

He has been doing this work for two years, with the help of some of his children, who are learning more and more about the work each day. This way, their father can provide them with both learning and food.  It's going very well for him, as he has good sales. He is a supplier to three important mills in the area, who are always waiting for him to bring them his crop to sell, as he produces one of the best crops in the area.

In the beginning, it was very complicated for him to carry out this work, as he didn't have a lot of knowledge. But he took advantage of various workshop sessions, and learned everything he needed. 

He doesn't consider himself an expert, but the knowledge he has allows him to harvest a good crop. In the future he wishes to have his own small farm, as when he rents, this takes away part of his earnings. 

In addition, he wishes to set up a small store in his house, where his partner can sell merchandise and generate additional income for their household finances. 

This will be his fourth loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he will have a loan, since in this way, he will feel secure in moving forward with his business. Moreover, he is committed to once again making his instalment payments. 

With the amount applied for, 1,500 soles, he will buy products for stocking the store in his house, and also spend a bit to pay laborers, so that he can maintain his small farm.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking his store, and to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as snacks, soft drinks, personal hygiene products, cookies, cooking oil, and coffee.

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es: Melvin de 28 años, labora como docente de educación Primarias en el Colegio Rafaela Herrera de Colonia La Fonseca  desde hace 7 años, donde es bien reconocido y apreciado por sus estudiantes, y por los padres de familia como un docentes de experiencia y con suficiente capacidad de brindar el pan de la enseñanza a sus educando,está solicitando su 5to credito  para invertirlo en mejoramiento de su casa de habitación repellandola para darle mayor durabilidad a las paredes y ademas mejorar la apariencia de la vivienda,  el tiene el apoyo de sus papá en los gtos del hogar,  y sus mayores sueños es darle a su familia un lugar digno y con un buen ambiente donde habiten siempre unidos y alegres como una familia estable.
texts.en: Melvin is 28 years old and has been working as an elementary school teacher in the “Colegio Rafaela Herrera” school in the La Fonseca neighborhood for the past seven years.  He’s well known and appreciated by his students and their parents, for being an experienced teacher, able to provide the bread of learning.  He is asking for his fifth loan to make some improvements to his home.  He wants to make some repairs to make the walls last longer and also to improve its appearance.  He has his father’s support for the household expenses.  His greatest dreams are to provide a dignified home and a good environment for his family, who is always united and happy as a stable family.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 33 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, es conviviente co su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 16 y 11 años de edad, ella vive en una casa propia a lado de sus hijos y su conviviente con quien trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. EL trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de abarrotes en su tienda. Su negocio se encuentra situado en una calle que es muy transitada y por tanto hay mucha afluencia de gente. Lleva trabajando por un año en este negocio y hasta el momento lo ha hehco sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo por que le permite realizar muchas cosas, como poder disponer de su tiempo y estar a lado de sus hijos al mismo tiempo que genera  ingresos a su familia. Tiene el apoyo incondicional de su pareja con quien vende a diario y se turnan para que el negocio no le sea estresante a ninguno de los dos. Agradece que todo le esta yendo bien y espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio y así poder generar mas ingresos. Este será el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará productos para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Sonia, 33, is a kind and very friendly woman. She lives with her partner, and they have two children, ages 16 and 11. She lives in her own house with her children and her partner, with whom she works hard to provide a better quality of life for their family. 

Sonia sells groceries in her store. Her business is located on a very busy street, and therefore there is a large flow of people. She has been working in this business for a year, and up to now, she has done it on her own. 

She really likes her work, because it allows her to do many things; such as having time to be with her children, at the same time as she is generating income for her family. She has the unconditional support of her partner, with whom she sells every day, and they take turns so that the store isn't stressful for either of them. 

She is thankful that everything is going well, and hopes to expand her business in future, and so generate more income. This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have a loan, so that she can continue increasing her working capital. With the amount of 2,000 soles she is applying for, she will buy products for stocking her store.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her store.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 25 años de edad, labora como docente de Educación Primaria en Escuela salomón Ibarra Mayorga de Colonia Los Angeles, está solicitando su 5to crédito con el propósito de mejorar la cocina de su casa de habitación, ella es bien reconocida en su comunidad como una persona honesta, trabajadora y muy responsable en sus compromisos adquiridos, ella tiene el apoyo de su marido quien le ayuda a pagar sus cuotas como trabajador de la Alcaldía municipal, quien se se desempeña como director del área del medio ambiente, ella sus mayores sueños son mantener siempre su familia unida y birndarle un lugar digno a sus dos pequeños hijos donde crescan felices para que sean hombres y mujeres de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en: Maritza, age 25, works as a primary school teacher in the Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School in the community of Los Angeles.  She is applying for her fifth loan with the purpose of improving the kitchen in her house.  She is well recognized in her community as an honest, hardworking, and very responsible person.  She has the support of her husband with her commitments.  He helps to make loan payments as a worker for the municipality, where he is employed as the area director for the environment.  Maritza's biggest dreams are to keep her family united and offer a dignified home for her two small children where their happiness increases so that they can become a man and woman who are productive members of society.

loans.use: to improve the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Jose Ventura

texts.es: Don José de 51 años, labora como promotor del programa amor  para los mas chiquitos en el Ministerio de la Familia, desde hace 3 años , solita su primer préstamo con el fin de invertirlo en mejorar la fachada de una pared de enfrente de su casa, el tiene el apoyo de su esposa quien labora con una pequeña pulpería, en su barrio es reconocido como una persona muy trabjadora y bien sociable con sus vecinos, quienes dan buenas referencias de él, sus metas y sueños de heredarles a su familia una casa con buenas condiciones, un ambiente agradable y que ellos vivan felices y mantenerse como una familia estable.
texts.en:
José, 51, has worked as a promoter of the program "Amor para los más Chiquitos" [Love for the smallest ones] in the Ministry of the Family for three years.  

He is requesting his first loan to fix the face of a wall in front of his house.  He has the support of his wife, who works in a small grocery store.  In his neighborhood, he is recognized as a hardworking person who gets along well with his neighbors, who give positive references for him.  

His goals and dreams are to give his family a house in good condition, a pleasant environment, and that they live happily and continue as a stable family.

loans.use: to fix a wall at his house.

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group, Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Soluction) 1, 2 & 5. Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their 7 children. Only 6 of the children are living together with their parents.

Sonia is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a beauty salon and a miscellaneous store. She will buy some products such as beauty and cosmetic products, clothes, accessories and many other items for economic activities. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Since she started taking loans her business has been growing and now she has a good inventory and clients.

She said that her most important challenge is to keep her businesses growing. Now she is also dedicated to developing a Colmado: a small grocery store. Her dream is to have an improved general store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products like clothing, shoes, accessories, beauty and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar a sus 26 años de edad es un emprendedor quien decide hace 5 meses iniciar su negocio con la finalidad de obtener ingresos adicionales a su actual trabajo. El señor Cesar trabaja en su tienda en las horas de la mañana y en la tarde deja a una persona encargada. Gracias a capacitaciones que el señor Cesar ha recibido en su actual trabajo ha podido mejorar su tienda.  El señor Cesar desea comprar surtido como arroz, aceite, panela, productos de aseo personal y del hogar, además de una vitrina y sillas para su tienda. El sueño del señor Cesar es ver crecer su negocio y que este posicionado en el sector, con el fin de dejar su actual trabajo de medio tiempo y así poder estar tiempo completo en su negocio, asimismo el señor Cesar espera brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 26, is an entrepreneur who decided five months ago to start a business, with the aim of earning additional income to supplement what he receives in his current job. Cesar works during the morning hours in his store, and in the afternoon, leaves someone in charge. 

Thanks to the training Cesar has received in his current job, he has been able to improve his store. Cesar wishes to buy stock such as rice, cooking oil, brown sugarloaf, personal hygiene products and home products. He also wants to buy a display case and chairs for his store. 

Cesar's dream is to see his business grow, and be well-established in the neighborhood; with the aim of leaving his current half-time job and being able to work full-time in his business. Cesar also hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy stock and fixed assets.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: La Sra. Regina vive en la zona del plan 3000, desde hace 5 años. La Sra. Regina tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos brasileros y franceses, además vende ropa todo por catalogo. Esta en su tercera secuencia con Emprender en la cual ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago. El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar mas mercadería en cosméticos y ropa por estas fiestas de fin de año ya que quiere abastecerse de mercadería ya que se encuentra de promoción que es a un precio mas barato y así poder vender al precio real y obtener un poco mas de ganancias y también abastecerse de mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de clientes que ha tenido en estos meses. La Sra. Regina es una persona responsable, trabajadora y es optimista con los proyectos que se traza para el futuro.
texts.en:
Regina has been living in the Plan 3000 neighborhood for five years, and has two children. Regina sells Brazilian and French cosmetics, as well as clothing; all by catalogue. This is her third loan with Emprender, where she has demonstrated a good payment record. 

The loan she is applying for is to buy more merchandise in cosmetics and clothing, for the year-end holiday season. She wants to stock up on merchandise, as it is on sale for a cheaper price, and she will be able to sell it at market price and so earn a bit more. She will also be able to stock up on merchandise to satisfy the customer demand that she's had in recent months.

Regina is a responsible, hardworking person, who is optimistic about the projects she has planned for the future.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia tiene 30 años, es casada, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien asume los gastos del hogar; Ana labora como docente de Educación Primaria, está solicitando su 1er préstamo, para invertirlo en mejoramiento de una habitación en su casa, donde vive con su familia, en esta comunidad es bien reconocida como una persona de buenas costumbre,que  ha se ha vinido esforzando por sacar a delante y a su familia y manternerlos siempre unidos, donde sus mejores sueños son mejorar las condiciones de su casa y asi poder tener un ambiente agradable que ofrecerles a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana Julia, 30 years old, is married and has the support of her husband, who pays the household expenses. She works as a primary school teacher. She is requesting her first loan to invest in improving a room in her home where she lives with her family. She is well known in this community as a respectable person, who has worked to help her family get ahead and to keep them always united. Her greatest dream is to improve her housing conditions and provide a pleasant environment for her children.

loans.use: to make improvements on her home.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, tiene 37 años, esta casada con Paulino de 36 años; viven en su casa propia, junto a sus 04 hijos a quienes les dedica mucho esfuerzo. Catalina, junto a su esposo, es el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Catalina es una mujer de arduo trabajo que cuenta con un terreno donde cultiva cacao. Viene trabajando 25 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao. En adelante, desea comprar plantas de cacao para poder incrementar su producción. Este será su préstamo numero 08 con MFP, asimismo se siente agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan ya que así puede continuar con su trabajo; al igual que en su banco comunal es puntual y responsable en las reuniones que se realiza. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más plantas de cacao para incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Catalina is 37, and married to Paulino, 36. They live in their own house, with their four children, who they do their very best for. Catalina, along with her husband is the support of the family.  

From a very early age her parents taught her to work their small farm. Catalina is a hard-working woman who has a plot of land where she grows cacao. She has been working on her own land for 25 years, and at harvest times, she needs the help of day laborers to move forward with the extraction of the crops. 

What she likes best about her work is harvesting her crops; since this way, she feels she is rewarded for the months of hard work by the quality of her crops. 

She considers that the hardest part is transporting her crops from her small farm to the town of San Francisco, a place where they offer better prices for her cacao. In the future she wishes to buy cacao plants, in order to increase her production. 

This will be her eighth loan with MFP, and she feels grateful for the support she is being offered, since this way she can continue working.  As well, in her communal bank she is on time and responsible in the meetings that are held. 

With the loan of 2,000 nuevos soles she is applying for, she will be able to buy more cacao plants in order to increase her crop.

loans.use: To buy more cacao plants.

loans.name: Mejia-Villatoro Group

texts.es:
Digna Emerita es miembro y coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Mejia-V., tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio La Soledad en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Digna se dedica a la venta de abarrotería y aprendió de este negocio desde que estaba soltera, ya que su madre tenía una pulpería y ella le ayudaba a atenderla. Luego cuando se casó su esposo le dio dinero para que instalara una pulperia propia y desde hace 4 cuatros ella maneja su propio negocio. Su horario de atención inicia a las 6 am y culmina  las 9 pm y su hijo mayor le ayuda a atender a los clientes. Su mayor desventaja es que hay varias pulperías en el barrio pero siempre trata de atender muy bien a sus clientes para que estos regresen. 

Digna está solicitando este préstamo para la compra de abarrotería en general como ser: arroz, frijoles, aceite, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, pan, café, churros, verduras, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Digna podrá surtir su pulpería de mas y variados productos y sus clientes encontraran lo que necesiten y eso le permitirá obtener mas ganancias.

Sus metas son convertir su pulperia en un supermercado y poder darle a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida y ayudarlos a que se realicen profesionalmente y tambien sueña con construir su propia casa. Digna tiene 8 ciclos de trabajar con los préstamos de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Digna Emerita is a member and the coordinator of the "Mejía-V." communal bank. She is 27, married, and has four children. She and her family live in Barrio La Soledad, in the municipality of Juticalpa. Digna sells groceries. 

She learned this business when she was single, as her mother had a small general store, and she helped her run it. Later, when she got married, her husband gave her money to set up her own general store, and she has been running her own business for four years. Her store hours begin at 6:00am and end at 9:00pm.  Her eldest son helps her serve customers. 

Her greatest disadvantage is that there are several general stores in the neighborhood; but she always tries to serve her customers very well, so that they come back.

Digna is applying for this loan in order to buy groceries in general, such as rice, beans, cooking oil, lard, condiments, soft drinks, meat, dairy products, cold cuts, bread, coffee, churros (a treat made from fried dough), vegetables, and other items. 

With the help of this loan, Digna will be able to supply her general store with more and varied products. Her customers will find what they need, and that will allow her to earn more.  

Her goals are to turn her small general store into a mini-market, to be able to give her children a better standard of living and to help them to become professionals. She also dreams of building her own house. 

Digna has been working with Fama loans for eight loan cycles, and has paid her instalments on time.

loans.use: To buy groceries in general for sale.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: Fatima de 46 años es soltera, tiene 2 hijos mayores los cuales trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos. Trabaja en una la Escuela desde hace 26 años como maestra de primaria. Esta solicitando su 7mo Credito para terminar los cuartos de su casa pues desea ponerles el piso y repellarlos, pues con el credito anterior solo logro levantar las paredes y ahora desea terminarlos, y si el dinero lo permite hacer el inodoro de su casa.
texts.en: Fatima, 46, is single and has two adult children who work and help her with expenses. She has worked in a school for 26 years as a primary school teacher. She is requesting her seventh loan to finish the rooms of her house as she wants to put in the floor and to plaster them. With a previous loan she was only able to construct the walls and now she wants to complete the rooms and, if there is enough money, to build a bathroom for her house.

loans.use: to finish constructing her house.

loans.name: Walter Juan

texts.es: Walter Juan de 43 años de edad es casado, trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operario de Limpieza desde hace 17 años, esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de continuar con la construccion de su su vivienda, con el credito anterior avanzo una parte, pero no logro terminar porque no le dio el dinero por lo que desea el credito para continuar levantando las paredes que le hacen falta y continuar asegurando su vivienda.
texts.en: Walter Juan, 43, is married and has worked as a Cleaning Operator for the Juigalpa Municipality for the past 17 years. He is requesting his fifth loan for the purpose of continuing to construct his house. With the previous loan he made progress on one part, but was unable to finish due to a lack of money. Consequently he would like a loan to continue erecting the walls he needs and to continue making his house secure.

loans.use: To build walls.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,menestras y verduras,el socio vende trigo,cebada,papa,maiz,tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,zapallo y lechugas,el socio trabaja independientemente llevando los productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales,menestras y verduras.El socio solicita el creditoa para comprar verduras,cereales y menestras al por mayor.
texts.en: This member still sells grains, beans and vegetables.  He sells wheat, barley, potatoes, corn, tomatoes, carrots, onions, pumpkins, and lettuce.  He works independently, taking his products to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  Through this business he has been able to provide for his children.  He wants to expand his business selling grains, beans and vegetables.  He will use the loan to buy vegetables, grains and beans wholesale.

loans.use: purchase grains, beans and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es: La señora Escolástica, casada con el señor Porfirio, con el cual tienen 3 hijos, y viven en el zona 6 D. mayo D. la localidad D. el Torno, pero que actualmente su esposo no se encuentra con ella por estar trabajando  en otro departamento, la señora vive actualmente con su hijo mayor D. profesión docente educativo la señora se dedica a la comercialización D. productos medicinales desD. hace mas D. 1 año y requiere del crédito para poder comprar muebles para  exponer sus productos, vitrina, estantes para su actividad actual , por lo cual ella agradece esa ayuda enormemente ya que le esta permitiendo crecer en su negocio y también mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Escolástica is married to Porfirio and has three children. They live in the "May 6th" neighborhood of Torno, but her husband is currently away working in a different region. Escolástica lives with her oldest child, who is a teacher by profession. Escolástica has worked for the last year selling medicinal products and needs a loan to buy furniture to display her products, such as display cases and shelves. She is grateful for this enormous help; the loan will help her expand her business and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy furniture such as display cases and shelves.

loans.name: Corazones Solidarios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Corazones Solidarios”, está conformado por 23 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, preparación de comida rápida, gasfitería, bordados entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de La Cisterna. 
Jaqueline integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo una polera color lila y su usando su cabello corto con chasquilla. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo huevos y quesos desde hace 5 años. Sus productos los vende en una feria libre desde hace 1 año y 2 meses. 
Sus productos los compra en una parcela y en distribuidoras.
Las metas en su negocio son expandirse y despachar sus productos para almacenes, panaderías y particulares.
Con el crédito comprará huevos y quesos al por mayor.
Jaqueline vive junto a su suegra, su marido, sus cuatro hijos y una nieta de 5 años de edad. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que Jaqueline anhela brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, a través de los ingresos que se vayan generando en su negocio. 
Comenta que dos de sus hijos se encuentran estudiando carreras universitarias, el sueño de ella es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comenta que es lo mejor que les puede brindar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Respecto a las reuniones, dice sentirse muy cómoda, ya que el grupo está muy afiatado, comparten los mismos intereses y se ha podido generar un ambiente de calidez humana.
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Corazones Solidarios" [Caring Hearts].  It is made up of 23 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to various professions such as used clothing sales, fast food preparation, plumbing, embroidery, etc.  All of them live in the town of La Cisterna.  

Jaqueline is a member of the communal bank.  She is the third person from left to right in the front row.  She is wearing a lilac polo shirt and has short hair with bangs.  She has been selling eggs and cheese for 5 years.  She has also been selling her products in a street market for a year and two months.  She buys her products on site and from distributors.  Her goals are to expand her business and to ship her products to stores, bakeries and individuals.  She will use the loan to buy eggs and cheese wholesale.  

Jaqueline lives with her mother-in-law, her husband, their four children and their 5 year old granddaughter.  She is motivated to continue in her business because she yearns to give her family a better quality of life with the income generated from her business.  She says that two of her children attend the university.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.  She says that this is the best thing she can give them.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her, as it has allowed her to invest in her business.  With regards to the meetings, she says that she feels very comfortable since the group is very devoted, they share the same interests and they have created a warm atmosphere.  

La Cisterna is a municipality located in the south central part of the country in the Metropolitana region.  It is mainly residential and commercial.  In the beginning it was a rural area with large plots of land, however, due to the growth in the population and the arrival of services, it has become 100% urban.

loans.use: purchase eggs and cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina, de 40 años es una mujer viuda, que ahora se dedica a sus 04 hijos quienes viven en su propia casa. Ella desde muy temprano se levanta para poder enviar a sus hijos a la escuela, para luego dirigirse a su trabajo que esta ubicado en el mercado de su ciudad, pues ahí tiene su puesto de ropa, en espera de sus primeros clientes a quienes aconseja  para poder llevar una prenda que les guste. Los clientes de Agustina, salen muy contentos de su puesto ya que son atendidos con amabilidad. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es dejar a sus clientes satisfechos con las prendas que le compran, lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y dice que no tiene muchas dificultades ya que siempre lo hace con mucha paciencia y sobre todo por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con el tiempo piensa en incrementar más prendas de vestir para seguir satisfaciendo los gustos de sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con los 500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar prendas de vestir como: polos pantalones, así podrá dar buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agustina, age 40, is a widow. She is dedicated to raising her four children and her own house. She gets up early every day to take her children to school before going to work in the city's market, where she sells clothing. Her customers depend on her advice and always leave happy with their purchases and with the good customer service Agustina provides. This is what Agustina likes most about her work. She has been running her business for eight years and has not found it very difficult. She works patiently with the goal of improving her children's lives.

With time, she hopes to expand her business and to continue providing excellent customer service. This will be Agustina's first loan with MFP. She hopes to use the loan to reach her business goals. She will use the 500 PEN to buy clothing such as polo shirts and pants for her business.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts and pants.

loans.name: Delmy Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Delmy tiene 38 años y vive la aldea de Monte Bello en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella es casada y su esposo Mariano es un técnico dental. La pareja tiene 2 hijas de 8 y 19 años de edad. Delmy, su hija mayor y su esposo aportan económicamente a los gastos familiares. 

Delmy ha tenido su negocio por 16 años. Durante 2 años Delmy estudió en una escuela artesanal y allí aprendió a cortar y confeccionar ropa. Ella elabora todo tipo de ropa, cameras y cortinas. Su especialidad son vestidos de niña. Ella recibe pedidos de clientes que ya conocen bien a su trabajo. Ella labora 8 horas diarias para confeccionar los pedidos de sus clientes. 

Solicitó este crédito de L12,000 para la compra de telas, hilos, y la reparación de una máquina que no le está haciendo bien la puntada de costura. Ella espera hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Delmy is 38 years old and lives in the village of Monte Bello in the San Pedro Sula municipality.  She is married, and her husband Mariano is a dental technician.  They have two daughters aged 8 and 19.  Her older daughter and her husband contribute to the family finances.

Delmy has had her business for 16 years.  For two years Delmy studied at an arts college where she learned to sew and to make clothes.  She makes all types of clothes, bed linens and curtains.  Her speciality are children's clothes.  She takes orders from customers who already known her work well.  She works 8 hours daily to sew the orders for her customers.

She requested this loan of L12,000 for the purchase of fabric and thread, and for the repair of a sewing machine which isn't doing a good job making stitches.  She hopes to make her business larger.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread, and repair a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, es una mujer joven de 21 años convive junto a Faustino de 30 años; ambos viven en casa propia y desean tener un buen futuro. Inés, empezó a montar una tienda de abarrotes donde vende arroz, azúcar, conservas. Hace 03 meses empezó con este negocio lo cual le va muy bien; y desde que sus vecinos se enteraron de la tienda, no dudaron en comprarle algún producto. A Inés le gusta su trabajo ya que recibe a sus vecinos con mucha alegría y atiende con amabilidad y considera que lo más difícil es cuando las cosas se terminan rápido pues neceita de capital para volver a invertir. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar más productos de abarrotes como variedades de detergentes, galletas, arroz, fideos, entre otros. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, y esta agradecida por darle la oportunidad de cumplir su trabajo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar productos de abarrotes para su tienda como: galletas, arroz, fideos, conservas, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en: Ines is a young, 21 year-old woman who lives with Faustino, who is 30.  They live together in their own home, and they want to have a good future.  Ines started up a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar and preserves.  She started this business 3 months ago, and it is going very well.  Once her neighbors found out about the store, they did not hesitate to buy her products.  Ines likes her work because she receives her neighbors with a lot of happiness and she tends to them in a friendly way.  What she considers most difficult is when she runs out of things quickly, as she needs capital to invest again.  With the loan she is requesting, she will be able to buy more grocery products such as a variety of detergents, cookies, rice, noodles, and other items.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity they are providing her to accomplish her work.  With the 1,500 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy grocery products for her store such as:  cookies, rice, noodles, preserves, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cookies, rice, noodles, preserves, and soft drinks
